loans.name: Karla Isabel

texts.es: Karla, tiene 26 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 1 hijo, reside en un sector del municipio de San Pedro Sula. Se dedica a la venta de mercadería desde hace 2 años. Vende por encargos y de forma ambulante. Anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa maquiladora y al quedar sin empleo decidió por vender mercadería, vende lociones, cremas, camisas, zapatos y sandalias. El préstamo que solicita es de 6,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar camisas y ropa de niño para vender en la temporada de fin de año, así mismo le ayudara a mantener surtido y con variedad de productos. Su plan es poderle ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Karla is 26 years old, in a common-law relationship with her husband, and has one child. She resides in an area within the town of San Pedro Sula. Karla has been selling merchandise for two years. She sells by taking orders and distributing products as a street vendor. Karla previously worked at a factory, but was laid off from her job. She decided to sell merchandise such as lotions, crèmes, shirts, shoes, and sandals.

The loan she is requesting is in the amount of 6,000 HNL and will be used to buy shirts and children’s clothes for the year-end season. This will also help keep her inventory stocked with a variety of products. Her plan is to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy shirts and children’s clothes for the year-end season.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Cicilia, fifty-seven years old and blessed with three children. She lives with her family. She is a dairy farmer; some of the milk is for their domestic consumption and the rest is put into commercial use.

She is borrowing a loan to buy a water tank so that she can harvest water for both domestic and farming use. This will enable her to maintain a consistent supply of milk and hence, improve her income. Cicilia is very happy for Kiva as this will enable her to expand her farming business.

loans.use: To buy a water tank.

loans.name: Maria Trecia

texts.en:
Maria Trecia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria Trecia is 33 years old and three of her children are currently in school.

Maria Trecia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like fish, cooking oil, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business.

Maria Trecia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like fish, cooking oil, meat, vegetables, and spices for her business.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Tessie is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

Tessie has a general store business in the Philippines. Tessie requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Tessie has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Tessie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ebenezer Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Nancy, a member of Ebenezer Women Group in Nakuru, Kenya. She is married and a mother of seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in November 2013.

Nancy is a maize, beans and vegetables farmer. She is grateful to HIHEA for the enterprise training. She is borrowing from Kiva to start a poultry business and boost her income by the selling more eggs and meat. She hopes this will enable her to educate her children and meet the family's basic needs.

Nancy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Chanuka Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Jane, a member of Chanuka Women Group. She is 42 years old, married and a mother of seven. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She operates a grocery shop to earn a living. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's (HIH EA) training on enterprise and financial management, which has enabled her to manage her business well. She is borrowing from Kiva to expand her business by buying more stock of fruits such as bananas and pawpaws so that she can increase her income. This will assist her to meet the family's needs and pay school fee. 

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of fruits such as pawpwas and bananas.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.es: Anatalia de 52 años de edad se dedica desde hace 15 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor  y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con sus hijos.
texts.en: Anatalia is 52 years old, and for 15 years has worked making and selling tortillas. Her business is located at her household, and she has many customers. She lives in her own house with her three children. She is requesting a loan to buy corn wholesale and lime to be able to continue making tortillas and increase her income, to have a better quality of life together with her children.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale, and lime.

loans.name: Calal

texts.en:
Calal is 28 years old, married, with two daughters.  The members of his family are refugees and live in IDP settlement.  Calal provides for the family growing and selling fruits in a small yard of his house. He has been working in this area for 7 years and has good skills. His monthly income is 180 AZN.
People prefer to attend Calal’s grocery because he is a very kind and cheerful man and always sells tasty and fresh fruits. He knows customer’s demands and does everything in order to satisfy them.
His income is too low to cover his family’s demands. He applied for 1,200 AZN in order to supply new types of fruit seeds and raise them. This will increase the harvest, the grocery’s assortment and produce more income.

loans.use: to supply new types of fruit seeds.

loans.name: Sulma Judith

texts.es: Sulma de 31 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con hija, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, Sulma esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor ya que le va muy bien con las ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para darle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sulma is 31 years old, and is a single mother who lives with her daughter in their own house. She works selling clothing for women, men and children on a mobile basis in different markets. She has many regular customers due to the quality of her clothing and her good prices. Sulma is requesting a new loan to buy more clothing wholesale, because her sales are going very well. In this way she can have more income so as to provide her daughter with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Dorotea

texts.es: Doña Maria se dedica desde hace 8 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, Doña Maria vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Doña María for 8 years has worked making and selling tortillas. Her business is located at her household, and she has many customers. Doña María lives in her own house with her family. She is requesting a loan to buy corn wholesale and lime to be able to continue making tortillas, thus increasing her income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and lime.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 34 years old, is married, and has five children, three of whom are currently in school.

Daisy is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle. She has been raising cattle for 3 years now and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 69 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Victoria has previously borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Victoria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rodora

texts.en:
Rodora is 55 years old and married with six children. Rodora works very hard to provide for them.

Rodora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, sugar, canned goods, noodles, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc., to sell.

Rodora has been in this business for 12 years. She sells a variety of items such as bread, sugar, canned goods, noodles, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc. 

In the future, Rodora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, sugar, canned goods, noodles, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 59 years old and married with six children.  

Salome is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Salome requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Salome has been raising livestock for 12 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Salome would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 42-year-old, smallholder farmer based in Litein, which is a small agricultural center near the Great Rift Valley. He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely 41-year-old wife, and they have been blessed with four children. 

On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for five years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. They recently ventured into a small personal business to supplement the meager income they earn through farming. 

From Kiva lenders, Richard is seeking a loan worth 65,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to grow his horticulture business. 

Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford Richard access to a loan facility that will aid him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Richards’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to expand his horticulture farming

loans.name: Wumpini  Pishigu No.2 Group

texts.en:
Fuseina is a 46-year-old woman from Pishigu No.2 in the Northern region of Ghana. Fuseina is married and has five children. Fuseina is the individual pictured on her knees on the Shea nuts in the basin among the members who are squatting.

Fuseina is a member of a Shea nuts processing group that has been in business for the last 10 years. The name of the group is ‘Wumpini  Pishigu No.2’. Fuseina earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their Shea nuts processing business so they can always produce premium quality for the local markets and non-local markets.

Fuseina and ‘Wumpini  Pishigu No.2’ have asked for a loan of GHS 4,750. Fuseina’s share of the loan is GHS 250, which she will use to pick and process Shea nuts. Fuseina aspires to earn more income, repay this loan and support her family's health and children's educational needs.

Fuseina thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To pick and process Shea nuts.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a twenty-two year old single man living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. His major business is motor vehicle transportation (taxi) and he also has a shop that sells general merchandise. He is a very hard working young man who is very committed to his work, having started the business to raise income for self support. He faces a challenge of high fuel prices and expensive spare parts.

He wants the loan to buy tires and repair his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy tires and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Monicah. She is 34 years old, married and a mother of three children, all of whom are attending school. 

Monicah is involved in dairy and poultry farming. The training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa has enabled her to run the enterprises effectively. Her businesses have expanded, and she wants to buy more chickens and chicken feeds. The loan will enable her to achieve her goal of expanding the business. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits in supporting her children’s education. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to make established payments.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Vitendo Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Joseph, a member of Vitendo Self Help Group. The group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in August 2013. 

Joseph is 45 years old and lives with his wife and six children. Three of his children are in primary school, and the other three are in secondary school. 

Joseph does both maize and poultry farming; this enables him to cater for his family’s food, shelter and school fees. He appreciates Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for the training he received on record keeping and enterprise development that helped him commercialize his farming. 

He wishes to diversify his farming by incorporating dairy farming in order to increase his income, so as to be able to pay school fees for his children. It is therefore for this reason that he is borrowing from Kiva to purchase a calf. He hopes in the long run he will be in a position to supply milk to the local dairy. This will lead to more income.

Joseph is so grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Karla

texts.es: Karla: Es una persona amable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 4 años estableció su taller de confección de uniformes, vestidos, faldas, camisas, togas. Gracias a los créditos otorgados anteriormente por PANA PANA y a las ganancias percibidas, le han permitido diversificar sus productos, también vende calzados. Solicita financiamiento para comprar telas y calzado en Managua y venderlos a precios accesibles. Su sueño es tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Karla is a friendly person who is originally from Puerto Cabezas. In order to have her own source of income, she established a sewing workshop four years ago. She produces uniforms, dresses, skirts, shirts, and togas. Thanks to her previous loans issued by Pana Pana and the profits she earned, Karla has been able to diversify her products. She also sells shoes.

Karla is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics and shoes in Managua, which she will be able to sell at affordable prices. Her dream is to have a store.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for sewing and shoes that she can sell.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria tiene 56 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace 4 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Doña Maria está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 56 years old and lives in her own house with her family. For four years she has had a small store located in her residence, and she has many customers because of her good prices and her kindness when she sells. Doña Maria is asking a loan to be able to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, beverages, candies, pastries, etc. and thus make better income for a greater quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, drinks, candies, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia Maria se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de miel,la socia vende miel desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de miel.La socia solicita el credito para comprar miel.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria continues her business of selling honey. She sells her product from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. Maria has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. She wants to expand her honey sales business.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy honey. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy honey to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer, beverages, sandwich bread, and other supplies.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica works hard to support her family. Veronica is married and has a native cradle making business in the Philippines.

Veronica requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her weaving business.

Veronica has been in this business for 10 years now.

Veronica would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Lolyin

texts.en:
Lolyin is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lolyin is 47 years old, and two children are currently in school.

Lolyin has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Lolyin requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Lolyin has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lolyin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana is 57 years old and has two children. Flaviana is a married woman, and one child is in school.

Flaviana is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Flaviana requested a 13,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Flaviana has been in her business for 25 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flaviana would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Lorna

texts.en:
Ma. Lorna is 43 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Ma. Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, etc.

Ma. Lorna has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, Ma. Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 55 years old and widowed with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Guillerma runs a General store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell including milk, liquor, and cigarettes. She has been in this business for 8 years. 

In the future, Guillerma would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell including milk, liquor, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 59 years old and has four children. She is a married woman.

Nida is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in the business for 4 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 8 times in the past in order to sustain it.

In the future, Nida would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Janet is 35 years old, and two children are in school.

Janet has a fishing business in the Philippines. Janet requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for fishing.

Janet has been in this business for two years. In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for fishing

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 51 years old and married. Rosalina works very hard to provide for her family’s daily needs.

Rosalina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, etc.

Rosalina has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Frashia

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Frashia. She is thirty one years old, married and a mother of four. All her children are in school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She farms maize and beans as her main economic activity. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management as she is able to budget and keep proper records.  She is borrowing from Kiva to boost her business by buying fertilizer. This will help improve on crop yield. She hopes for a bounty harvest, hence an increase in her income, thus catering to the family's needs and paying school fees. 
Frashia is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a small-scale farmer who lives in the Kapsumai area in the North Rift region of Kenya. He is married to 28-year-old Anna, who gave him 2 sons and 2 daughters. He has managed to sustain the family for the past 9 years selling milk and eggs.   

Philip's highest monthly expense is school fees. The income he is making from his current farming operation is insufficient to meet his family's needs. Thus, he is seeking a loan of 52,750 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase and insure a high-yielding dairy cow. The new cow will increase the quantity of milk that that is produced at the farm for sale.

The additional income from the milk sales will benefit Philip's family in numerous ways, including by enabling him to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Weldon

texts.en:
Weldon is a hardened mixed-farmer from Cheborge village in the Litein region of Kenya, which is known for luxuriant tea plantation farms. Weldon lives together with Flossy, his wife, and two children. 

For the six years that they have been married, Weldon gets help from his wife to run the 3.5 acre farm. The farm has one cow and five poultry. 50 trees have been planted on the farm since it began operation. 

Weldon is seeking a loan that will enable him to construct a shelter for his dairy cow. He is concerned that the cow faces harsh weather conditions day in day out. The shelter will offer protection to the cow as well as make his work in the farm much easier since the cows movement and feed intake will be under his control.

He stated that the investment will be of great impact to his family. Income generated from this investment will help him take care of the education of his two infant children.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is a 44-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in order to stitch up more dresses and earn a good amount of income. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 40-year-old farmer from Cheborgei village in the South Rift region of Kenya. He owns a 15-acre piece of land that is home to his family. With the support of his wife of 6 years, Geoffrey does mixed farming. The income he makes from selling milk, eggs, and tea produced at the farm enables him to provide a decent living for his family of 4 children. He also uses the income from farming to pay for his children's education.

Geoffrey is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow to add to the three cows he already owns. Dairy farming is a good, sustainable source of income for farmers like Geoffrey. As time goes by, children grow, and family expenses also soar. The only way a farmer such as Geoffrey can cope with this change is by scaling the business to earn more income.

The additional cow will produce more milk for sale and increase the family's income. With more income, Geoffrey will be able to meet the increasing demands of his family and grow his asset base. Some of the profits from this investment will be ploughed back into the business to facilitate its growth.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Chapakazi Group

texts.en:
Revocastus, who is in his late 40s, is married with four children who are still in school.  He has been running a butcher business for ten years now. He works from 6am to 7.30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be one of Revocastus's many loans that he has received from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his meat stock and can now serve many customers.  He has paid back all his loans successfully and appreciates Kiva for their support.  He used the profit to pay school fees, saved some in his bank account and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to increase his meat stock and meet his customer demand. He dreams of building a house for renting.

Revocastus will share this loan with his loan group "Chapakazi," which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his meat stock and meet his customer demand.

loans.name: Morena Delia

texts.es: Morena de 41 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con madre, sus dos hijos y su padrastro, ella posee desde hace 10 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, detergentes, jabón, consomés, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Morena, age 41, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her mother, her two children and her stepfather.  For the last ten years she has owned a small store located in her place of residence.  She has a lot of customers due to her good prices and the friendly attitude she has when making the sale.  She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, dry grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, detergent, soap, consomme, etc., and thereby be able to have better income, for a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, dry grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, detergent, soap, consomme, etc.

loans.name: Tulia Group

texts.en:
Pili, who is in her late 30s, is married with two children who are in school. She has been running a business of selling charcoal for ten years now.  She works from 6:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Pili's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the charcoal stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing fine and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, built her house and covered household expenses. 

She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to meet her customers' demand. She dreams of having a big charcoal store.

Pili will share this loan with her loan group, "Tulia," which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena heads up for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer so she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. Elena hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer

loans.name: Naasson Salvador

texts.en:
Naasson is 31 years old. He has earned his living for the last five years in agriculture, growing corn and beans. He sells his products in various markets that are located near his house. He lives with his wife and his daughter in a house that they own.

Naasson is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, soil amendments, pest control, etc., to improve the land that appears in the photo so that he can continue with his work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, soil amendments, pest control, etc., to improve his land

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Tomasa de 26 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 1 hijo que está estudiando 5° grado de educación básica., solo estudio hasta 4° grado de educación básica porque sus padres no pudieron darle el estudio completo por falta de recursos económicos, por lo que dejo la escuela y empezó a trabajar lavando y planchando ajeno y en la venta de pescado.

Tomasa, actualmente trabaja como cocinera en la escuela de la comunidad, tiene cerca de 1 año de experiencia, todos los días viaja a su trabajo, su horario es de 7:00 am hasta las 4:00 pm y antes pasa dejando a su hijo en la escuela.

El préstamo será utilizado para reparar una pared de su casa que corre riesgo de derrumbarse, comprara los materiales de construcción y pagara la mano de obra. Tomasa sueña con mejorar completamente su casa para vivir dignamente con su hijo y que él termine una carrera universitaria para que tenga las oportunidades que ella no tuvo.
texts.en:
Tomasa, 26 years old, is single and has one son who is in the 5th grade. She only finished 4th grade because her parents were not able to give her a full education due to lack of financial resources; as such, she left school and began working washing and ironing for others and as a fish vendor.

Tomasa now works as a cook in her community school; she has a year of experience, and travels to her job daily. Her shift is from 7:00 am until 4:00 pm, before which she leaves her son at school.

The loan will be utilized to repair a wall in her house that runs the risk of collapse. She will buy the construction materials and pay for manual labor. Tomasa dreams to completely improve her house to live with dignity with her son, and that he will finish a university career so he may have the opportunities that she did not have.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Nelson. He is a super incredible farmer! He certainly ranks among the top successful smallholder farmers on Juhudi Kilimo's client list. Born in 1980 into a humble family, Nelson's upbringing was difficult. He never finished high school because of mounting school fees in arrears, but he never gave up in life. He started practicing mixed farming and married a lovely wife who is 26 years old today. Together, they were blessed with 3 children.

Nelson practices farming on a 1-acre farm that is owned by the family in the village of Cheplanget. On the farm, he grows passion fruit, beans, millet, vegetables, soybeans, and maize. He also keeps more than two highly productive dairy cows for milk production. The 34-year-old farmer sells his produce in bulk 5 kilometers away from his home. His key clients are the Cereal Board, institutions, and local people. He is such a good farmer that the Kenyan Ministry of Agriculture picked his farm to be a model farm for other farmers. He is also the chairman of Cheplanget Group, a group he formed to help members, who are smallholder farmers, save money and use their savings to access loans from financial institutions.

Nelson is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to build a greenhouse. He needs greenhouse technology to continuously improve the productivity, profitability, and sustainability of his major farming systems. A greenhouse will provide a favorable environment for his plants and protect them from adverse climate conditions such as wind, cold, precipitation, excessive radiation, extreme temperature, insects, and diseases. With your assistance, Nelson will have year-round production of crops and off-season production of vegetable and fruits. He will also save on the use of natural resources such as water. With greenhouse technology, the water requirements of crops are very limited and easy to control.

Nelson has a great credit history. In 2010, he took a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) and successfully serviced it. He stated that this loan will change his life. Profits from this investment will be plowed back into the business to fuel further growth. There still remains so much space on his land for future growth. If ever there was an opportunity to invest a $25 loan in someone's future, this is it! You won't regret it!

loans.use: To build a greenhouse

loans.name: Mercedes  Yanira

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 38 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella es empleada de una empresa privada, con lo que gana en su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando puertas y balcones, pero no tienen de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para comprar laminas, hierro, balcones, vidrios para ventanas y pago de mano de obra, para ella y su familia puedan vivir cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: Mercedes is 38, she lives in a house she owns with her family, she is an employee at a private company.  With the money she makes at her job she is able to cover some of the home expenses.  She wants to improve her residence by installing doors and windows but she doesn't have sufficient capital, this is why she is requesting a loan to buy galvanized sheets, iron, windows, glass for the windows and to pay for labor.  This way her and her family will live comfortable and safe.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, iron, windows, glass for the windows and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 63 years old, married and lives at Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement. 

With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise a pig on her own as well. Through Pauglam MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglet & feed. Now, she requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy bags of feed. 

Teopista really hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To buy bags of feed for her growing pig

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

texts.en:

She found the business of selling ice easy and simple because all she needed to do is to fill water into plastic bags of different sizes and put it in the freezer to become ice and sell to her buyers. Nida lives in a coastal area and most of her buyers are fisher folks, which makes her ice salable. 

Nida plans to expand her business, so she applied to PMPC for a loan to purchase an additional freezer to produce more ice for sale. Nida smiles to see her family live with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase an additional freezer to produce more ice for sale

To obtain her goal in life, she is seeking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to be used in purchasing 15 sacks of rice to sell. She hopes that lenders will grant her requested loan. In this way, she could sustain her family's needs and supply all her customers.

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Eleuteria is very thankful when all her financing needs were supported by PMPC. She deeply wishes to live a happy and comfortable life with her family.

Oscar es agricultor, sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy pequeño, en ocasiones trabaja como cobrador de buses.  

Oscar necesita el préstamo para comprar instrumentos musicales, para el grupo de alabanza para la iglesia donde se congrega, un piano y un micrófono.

Oscar sueña tener un grupo  musical con sus amigos y algún día poder grabar un disco compacto.
texts.en:
.Oscar is 23 years old, single, and doesn't have any children. He had the opportunity to graduate from high school but couldn't afford to continue his education. He is a farmer. His parents taught him about working the land when he was young; he also works sometimes as a bus conductor.

Oscar now needs a loan to buy musical instruments such as a piano and a microphone for his church thanksgiving group. His dream is to start a musical group with his friends and one day record a CD.

loans.use: Buy a piano and microphone

loans.use: to buy groceries

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy plywood, paint, nails and other materials for her fishing boat maintenance.

Lucia has been in this business for 25 years. Lucia earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy plywood, paint, nails and other materials for her fishing boat maintenance

loans.name: Marlenis Veronica

texts.es:
Marlenis de 19 años de edad, está casada  y no tiene hijos, solo pudo estudiar hasta 9° grado de educación básica, su esposo es albañil. Únicamente vive con sus esposo.

Marlenis trabaja en una sala de belleza, realiza cortes de cabello a hombres y mujeres, es así como ayuda a su esposo a solventar los gastos de la casa. Con el tiempo ha ido adquiriendo experiencia y fue así que construyo su casa. Todos los días se levanta a las 5:00 am y después de hacer los oficios de la casa se va a su trabajo. 

El préstamo lo necesita para terminar de construir su casa, comprar los materiales y pagar la mano de obra que necesitará. Marlenis sueña con terminar su casa, formar una familia y tener una sala de belleza propia
texts.en:
Marlenis is 19, she is married and has no children.  She could only study to 9th grade, her husband is a construction worker.  She only lives with her husband.

Marlenis works in a beauty salon, she cuts hair to men and women, this is how she helps her husband cover their home expenses.  With time she gained experience and started building her house. Every day she gets up at 5 am and goes to work after getting her house work done.

She needs the loan to finish building her house, buy construction materials and pay for labor. Marlenis dreams to finish her house, form a family and have her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy sand, concrete, stone, bricks and labor.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,  posee una molino nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 8 años, tambien se dedica a la agricultura,con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa, la joven es madre soltera y vive en casa propia con su hija de 7 años de edad, ella solicita nuevamente un crédito pero esta vez para comprar lo necesario para el molino como fajas, discos, cuchillas, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This young woman whose face has been pixelated is 27 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has had a mill in her home for eight years and also works in agriculture. From sales of what she grows, she pays for household expenses. She is a single mother and lives in her own house with her 7-year old daughter.

She is now seeking another loan, but this time it is to buy items for the mill such as belts,  disks, and blades. Then she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: Buy belts, disks, blades etc. for her mill

loans.name: Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. santusa ella es soltera y tiene 46 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maiz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.


Las socias que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo. 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the communal bank “Siempre Adelante" [Always Forward]. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the Cusco province in the county of Cusco.

Santusa is one of the members. She is 46 years old and has 3 children. She sells grain for a living, including corn, wheat, and quinoa. She works from 8am to 5pm. She has been in this business for 4 years, and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a permanent location where she can sell the grain. She is requesting the loan to purchase wheat, corn, and quinoa.

The members' photo that is attached to the group photo was taken after the meeting because they requested permission for work reasons.

The other members sell fruit, chicha [a sweet drink made from purple corn], or animals for a living, or they run grocery stores.

loans.use: purchase wheat, corn, and quinoa

loans.name: Lordalita

texts.en:
"Hardworking and persevering mother" best describes Lordalita, who is 43 years old and resides in Plaridel, Philippines. Lordalita has three children and is married. From her desire to earn income, in addition to her husband's, Lordalita started a business, a meat shop. She buys one pig at a time and displays the pork in her stall in the market. Lordalita has been in the business more than four years now. 

She wants to expand her meat-vending business, and has decided to try selling beef and chicken. She wants to earn more profits and to have enough to sustain her family, especially for her children, so she can provide them with a good education. 

In order for Lordalita to make her wish possible, she needs 50,000 PHP in additional capital. She will use the money to expand her business. She intends to purchase more meat to sell in her meat shop to earn more profits. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell in her meat shop

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen has the skills and expertise in candle making, but she had no capital to start the business. As a mother from Lopez Jaena, she never gets tired of supporting her family in any way she can. She helps her husband by earning an income. She joined PMPC after she learned she could receive financial assistance, and she decided to venture into the candle-making business. The business has been doing well and she doubles her work time, perfecting the shape and quality of her candles. She has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. She applied for another loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC to purchase additional raw materials and needed equipment for her candle-making business, and to increase production for supplying her stocks. She hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family. Today, Helen is able to help others sell her candles and they earn for their own families as well.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials and needed equipment for her candle-making business, and to increase production for supplying her stocks.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arceli is 58 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Arceli has a food vending business in the Philippines. Arceli requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Arceli has been in this business for 30 years. Arceli would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Abra  Thèrèse

texts.fr: Demeurant à Lomé précisément au quartier adidogomé, ABRA est âgée de47ans, veuve  et mère de 2 enfants, elle fait le commerce des plats et gobeletsqu’elle achète au  grand marché de Lomé.  ABRA  s’approvisionne 2 fois par mois au  grand marché de Lomé, par vente ambulante, elle revend dans les  environs de son quartier de résidence.ABRA  sollicite un microcrédit pour augmenter  son activité de revenu afin de participer à la charge du foyer et aider son mari dans les dépenses du foyer, et aussi avoir beaucoup plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Living in Lomé, in the Adidogomé district, Abra is a 47 year old widow and the mother of two children. She sells plates and cups, which she buys in Lomé's Grand Market. Abra buys her stocks twice a month in the Grand Market - from mobile sellers - and resells the merchandise in the neighbourhood close to her home. Abra is requesting a microfinance loan in order to grow her income generating business; thus she can contribute to the household income and help her husband with the family's expenses, and also generate much more profit.

loans.use: to buy twelve dozen dishes.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is 41 years old and has four children. Celina is widowed and one of her children is in school.

Celina is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for 20 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Celina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años d edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,posee un taller de calzado ( repara y elabora calzado), su taller lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia,  posee mucha clientela por la calidad del producto, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el joven vive  en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cuero, hilo, pega, tela, etc. para seguir con su elaboración ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo  y así tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This young man whose face has been pixelated because he lives in a high risk area runs a shoe repair workshop where he also makes shoes. The workshop is located in his home. He has many customers because of the quality of his work. With the income from sales he manages to pay for household expenses. He lives in his own home with his family.

He is now seeking a loan to buy leather, thread, glue, fabric etc. so he can continue with his work which is his sole source of income. Then he and his family will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: Buy leather, thread, glue, fabric etc.

loans.name: Claudia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Doña Claudia se esfuerza mucho para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la condiciones de su vivienda, en  los créditos pasados ella ha realizado mejora en su casa.
este cuarto crédito lo esta solicitando para la realización de un muro en la parte trasera de su casa ya que por el momento esta tapada con laminas de zinc viejo y ella quiere mas seguridad para su familia. comprara piedra, cemento, arena, hierro, Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado y espera seguir en futuro adquiriendo mas prestamos para vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Claudia works very hard to improve her living conditions and the state of her home. She has used past loans to make improvements to her house.

She is requesting a fourth loan to build a wall in the back part of her house. Right now the back wall is made of old sheets of zinc, and she wants more security for her family.

She will buy stone, cement, sand, and iron.

She is grateful for the support of Kiva and Afodenic and hopes to continue receiving loans so she can live better.

loans.use: to construct a wall

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 54 years old, and she is a widow who receives pension each month from her late husband's insurance benefits. She lives in Tudela, Philippines, and she raised her children through the pension she received. Now, Lilia wants to renovate her house to provide her family with a decent and comfortable living. She applied for a loan amounting to 40,000 PHP from PMPC, of which she became a full-fledged member in 2013, to purchase materials for the renovation of her house. Lilia wishes nothing more than to provide her family with a decent and comfortable living.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the renovation of her house in order to provide her family with a decent and comfortable living.

loans.name: Papala

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Papala works hard to support her family.

Papala has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear clothes business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dry goods. Papala is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell at her business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Papala has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 48 years old and married with six children. Three of her children are in school, and Estelita works very hard to provide for them.

Estelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Estelita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Estelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, and brick to improve the floor in one room of his house

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Liezel has been in this business for three years. Liezel earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase laminate, iron, window grilles and glass, bricks, and cement; and to pay for labor

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en: Rose Ann, an industrious mother, requested a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos and variety of fruits to sell. In this way, she will be able to sell more fruits which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more kilos and variety of fruits to sell

loans.name: Paco Adriel

texts.es:
Paco es un padre de familia que lo da todo por sus seres queridos, tiene una hermosa familia conformada por su esposa que lo apoya en las buenas y en las malas y 3 hijos por quienes lucha para poder brindarles un futuro mejor. No pudo estudiar una carrera profesional debido a la baja economía que vivía en su casa, por ello desde muy joven se dedicó a la agricultura y hoy está cultivando plátano de distintas variedades para ofrecer a sus clientes. En sus tiempos libres le gusta practicar fútbol y jugar con sus hijos.
Paco está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar más plantas de plátano para ampliar su siembra, de esta manera sus ingresos mejorarán y así seguirá luchando por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Paco is the kind of father who will do anything for his beautiful family. He has a wife who helps him in good times and bad, as well as three children for whom he works hard to provide them with a better future. Paco wasn't able to get a professional job because of the poverty in which he grew up. So ever since he was young he has worked on the land. Nowadays he grows different varieties of bananas to sell to his customers. In his free time he enjoys a game of football and playing with his children.

Paco is very grateful to Kiva lenders as it is with their help that he will be able to buy more banana plants and extend his plantation. Then he will earn more money and continue working hard to improve the well being of his family.

loans.use: Buy more banana plants and increase production

loans.name: 30 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
Mileni es una mujer de 31 años de edad, soltera, madre de tres hijos de nueve, cinco y tres años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable, buena madre y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza de forma ambulante en la comunidad rural ‘La Angostura’ sitio caracterizado por la agricultura; donde se cultivan cereales, tubérculos, hortalizas, leguminosas y frutas, que principalmente están dirigidos al consumo interno. 
Mileni es de tez trigueña, estatura mediana, cabello castaño peinado a la moda, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por el comercio(sentada a la derecha con blusa celeste). Debido a la necesidad de ampliar su negocio formó una banca de personas con negocios similares como: tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de frituras, venta de busos, tienda de barrio, carnicería, para solicitar un préstamo.
Su vida la realiza sola junto a sus tres hijos, los dos mayores estudian en la escuela y viven en una casa de ladrillo que cuenta con el servicio de agua y luz, no cuenta con alcantarillado y la calle es de tierra. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos; productos para la higiene corporal o para mejorar la apariencia, especialmente del rostro, su comercio es de forma ambulante, ella se encarga de visitar (cargada de una maleta y varios catálogos) las comunidades y provincias cercanas para ofrecer sus productos a tiendas, oficinas, etc. Sus dos años de experiencia en el rubro y las necesidades de su familia le exigen la ampliación de su negocio, este es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución. Su sueño es lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales y desea darle una mejor calidad de vida ampliando su negocio; realizando la compra de cosméticos por mayor.
Es por esos motivos que Mileni solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para ampliar su negocio para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mileni is a 31-year-old single woman and the mother of three children who are 9, 5, and 3 years old. Her business is the sale of cosmetics. 

She is resourceful, independent, tenacious, responsible, hardworking, and a good mother. She carries out her work as a traveling salesperson in the rural community of La Angostura, a site characterized by agriculture. There, they grow grains, tubers, vegetables, legumes, and fruits, which are mainly destined for domestic consumption. 

Mileni is olive-skinned, of medium height, and has fashionably-styled brown hair. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish for business (she is seated on the right with a light blue top). Because of her need to expand her business, she formed a communal bank of people with similar businesses, like knitting baby clothes, selling fried foods, selling sweatshirts, running a neighborhood shop, and running a meat market, in order to request a loan.

She lives her life on her own, together with her three children. The two older children go to school, and they all live in a brick house that has running water and electricity. They do not have a sewage system, and they live on a dirt road. 

Her business is the sale of cosmetics: products used for personal hygiene and to improve the appearance, especially of the face. She makes her sales as a traveling salesperson, visiting nearby communities and provinces with a suitcase and several catalogs to offer her products in shops, offices, etc. Her two years of experience in the field and her family's needs demand the expansion of her business. 

This is her first lending cycle with the institution. Her dream is for her children to become professionals; she would like to give them a better quality of life by expanding her business and purchasing cosmetics at wholesale. 

For these reasons, Mileni is requesting a loan for the purchase of cosmetics at wholesale in order to expand her business so that she can pay for her children's educations.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics at wholesale to expand her business in order to pay for her children's educations.

loans.name: Dinora Esmeralda

texts.es: Dinora tiene 31 años de edad y es madre soltera de un hijo de 6 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. Dinora se gana la vida por medio de la venta de fruta desde hace dos años. Ella es una mujer visionaria quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Dinora desea construir un muro de perimetral para dar mayor seguridad a su familia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento  y así dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Dinora is 31 years old and the single mother of a 6-year-old boy who is in school.

Dinora has made a living selling fruit for the past two years. She is a visionary who does everything in her power to give her family better living conditions.

Dinora wants to construct a perimeter wall to give her family greater security. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to use to purchase cement, sand, brick, iron, etc.

She expects to receive the loan and start work on the construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, brick, iron, etc. to build a perimeter wall

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 36 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Leah is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice seeds and pay for laborer salaries.

Leah has been farming rice for 18 years and she also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice seeds and pay for laborer salaries.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising pigs and a general store. Virginia is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her business, which is buying and selling dried fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is from Oroquieta City. She is a mother who has strong determination, to pursue her goals for the benefit of her family, since she has always been known to provide the best for them. 

She makes a living in her retailing business. To generate more income, Jocelyn decided to expand her resources after she learned that she can avail of financial assistance in PMPC. Consequently, she requested a loan to purchase more bottles of food supplement to serve more customers and able to increase sales. Jocelyn smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her family with a good standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more bottles of food supplement to serve more customers and be able to increase sales.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Annie works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear clothes.  Annie is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy wood and other materials for her furniture making business.

Annie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy wood and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Pausia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Pausia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Pausia is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Pausia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net.

loans.name: Mather

texts.fr: MATHER, âgée de26 ans est de nationalité Togolaise. MATHER est célibataire et sans enfants habitant  à Lomé  dans le quartier adidogomé. elle est revendeuse de souches  et s’approvisionne 2 fois par mois au marché d'Assiyéyé. Dans le souci de réduire ces couts d’approvisionnement  et d’augmenter le résultat, MATHER sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter  son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices ; ce crédit sera très utiles au bien être  de toute la famille.
texts.en:
MATHER is 26 years old and of Togolese nationality. She is single, has no children and lives in Lomé, in the Adidogomé district. She sells tiger nuts and buys her supplies twice a month at the market in Assiyéyé. 
Hoping to reduce the cost of these supplies, and to grow her profit, Mather is requesting a loan to allow her to grow her business, and to make more profit. This loan will be very helpful for the wellbeing of the whole family.

loans.use: to buy 17 bowls of snacks.

loans.name: Las Concentidas Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos de ocho y nueve años, y su negocio es la venta de comida típica.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable, buena madre y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’, un lugar caracterizado por el crecimiento de su población; originaria de tribus Ayoreas del lugar y mineros relocalizados de occidente, de clima tropical con una temperatura constante entre 27-32 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Maria es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el guaraní y también habla español (sentada a la izquierda con blusa negra). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y sus dos hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia y cuentan con agua y luz. Su negocio es la venta de comida típica, cada noche prepara algunos ingredientes de sus comidas para dejarlas listas y cocinar a primeras horas del día, su especialidades son comidas al paso, como; el pacumutu (carne y yuca ensartadas en un palito de caña, a la brasa), sonso de yuca (yuca aplastada y amasada con queso a la brasa), majadito (arroz amarillo, huevo frito y plátano). Ya lleva un año de experiencia en el rubro y esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución. Su sueño es tener un negocio rentable con mucha clientela, y desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de mesas y una heladera, de esa manera tendría más espacio para atender a clientes y dejaría comida preparada en la heladera para su cocción en el momento, ahorrando tiempo y dinero.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y heladera para atender a más clientes y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a 24-year-old woman. She lives with her spouse, they have two children who are 8 and 9 years old, and her business is the sale of traditional food.

She is resourceful, independent, tenacious, responsible, hardworking, and a good mother. She does her work in the "Plan 3000" zone, a place known for the growth of its population, who come from the Ayoreas tribe or are miners relocated from the west. It has a tropical climate with a constant year-round temperature between 27 and 32 degrees Celsius.

Maria has dark skin and long black hair; she is of medium stature. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, and she also speaks Spanish (she is seated on the left with a black top). She shares her life with her partner, who works in construction, and their two children, who are in school. They live in a house that they own and they have running water and electricity.

Her business is the sale of traditional foods. Every night, she prepares some of the ingredients for her meals to have them ready to cook in the early hours of the day. Her specialties are meals to go, like "pacumutu" (skewered meat and cassava on a cane stick, grilled over hot coals), "sonso de yuca" (mashed cassava, mixed with cheese and grilled over hot coals), and "majadito" (yellow rice, fried egg, and plantain). 

She already has one year of experience in the field, and this is her first loan with the institution. Her dream is to have a profitable business with a large clientele, so she would like to expand her business by purchasing tables and a refrigerator. This way, she would have more space to serve her customers and she would leave prepared food in the refrigerator to be cooked to order, saving time and money.

For these reasons, Maria is requesting a loan for the purchase of tables and a refrigerator in order to serve more customers and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tables and a refrigerator in order to serve more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: Maria Esther comparte su tiempo entre sus estudios y su negocio de taxi que tiene en Chinandega hace siete años. Tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos. María Esther es egresada de la carrera de psicología. Su esposo es quien se encarga de conducir el taxi por las calles de Chinandega. Maria Esther ya culmino su carrera pero ahora necesita de un préstamo para obtener su título y desempeñarse como psicóloga en Chinandega. Requiere del préstamo para cubrir los gastos de la titulación de su carrera. El préstamo le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener una plaza y ejercer su profesión, dentro de sus planes futuros esta trabajar en el campo de la psicología contribuyendo en el área de la Salud mental en niños, adolescentes y padres de familia. Sus Metas próximas son tener su propio consultorio privado y crear un preescolar de estimulación temprana con bases apropiadas para un buen desarrollo de aprendizaje socio educativo.
texts.en:
Part of Maria Esther's day is spent on her studies and part on her taxi business in the town of Chinandega. She's had the business for seven years. 

Maria is 36 years old, married, and has two children. She's graduated as a psychologist, and her husband drives a taxi in the streets of the town. Although she has graduated, she now needs a loan to obtain the necessary certificate so she can practice as a psychologist.

The loan will be a great help in helping her get set up to work in her profession. Her future goals include contributing to the mental health of children, adolescents, and parents. Her next goals are to open a private clinic and create an early childhood program based on appropriate learning activities.

loans.use: Cover the cost of obtaining her professional psychology certificate

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 36 years old and has eight children. She is a married woman. Six of her children are in school. Margie has a rice mill business in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Margie has been farming for 4 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Margie would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy other materials for her rice mill business.

loans.name: Oroberesoromandi Group

texts.fr:
Mme SAFIORA représente le groupe OROBERESOROMANDI. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a30ans et le moins âgé a 20ans. 01 va à l’école. Personnes 03 en charge.
Mme fait la poterie depuis 40ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans une région  du Burkina.
Elle veut s’acheter 40charettes d’argile.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne toujours s’acheter un  motocycle et subvenir au besoin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Safiora represents the Oroberesoromandi group. She is in good health, and is married and the mother of five children - the eldest being 30 and the youngest 20 years old. One still attends school, and in total she has three dependents.
She has been a potter for 40 years. She buys her supplies in a region of Burkina. She wants to purchase 40 loads of clay, and plans to invest her profits into the business.
She has always had the goal of buying a motorbike, and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 40 loads of clay.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks, fodder and vaccines.

loans.name: Tindwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme RASMATA représente le groupe TINDWENDE. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. Tous vont à l’école. 
Mme vend des produits de beautés et d'habits depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés en villes. 
Elle veut s’acheter 03douzaines de boucle d'oreilles, 02douzaines de bracelets, 02douzaines d'habits et 01douzaine de pommade.
Mme veut  renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices  . Elle ambitionne agrandir  son champs d'activité et  mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Rasmata represents the Tindwende group. She is married and the mother of three children; the eldest is 15 and the youngest 7 years old. They all attend school. She has sold beauty products and clothing for the last four years. She buys her supplies from various town markets . She wants to buy three dozen earrings, two dozen bracelets, two dozen dresses and a dozen pots of lotion. She would like to strengthen her business with the profits. Her ambition is to develop the sphere of activity of her business, and to take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy three dozen earrings, two dozen bracelets, two dozen dresses and a dozen pots of lotion.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 44 años de edad, su estado civil es Conviviente y con carga familiar, vive en casa propia de material rustico en el Caserio La Ancajima del Distrito de La Matanza, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Pablo es la venta de ganado caprino, teniendo años en el negocio, vendiendo su ganado en la Ciudad de Piura teniendo clientela fija, además de tener ingresos por agricultura teniendo sembrado en la actualidad frejol Caupi. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de alimento de engorde balanceado para ganado. Con la inversión le ayudará a obtener mejores ingresos. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a es aumento demanda por carne de ganado caprino.
texts.en:
Pablo, 44, lives with his partner and family in his own house made of rustic materials in the rural community of La Ancajima in the district of La Matanza.  It is a place where the locals work in agriculture, livestock farming and commerce.  There are basic utilities such as water and electricity.  The community is in the district of Buenos Aires, province of Morropon in the Piura region along the northern coast of Peru.

Pablo sells sheep and has been in business for several years.  He has fixed customers in the city of Piura where he sells his livestock.  He also earns an income from agriculture and grows Caupi beans.  The loan will be used to buy balanced animal feed for his sheep.  With this investment he will obtain a better income.  The market is looking positive due the increased demand for lamb meat.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 20 years old and has one child who is in school. She is a married woman. Liezel is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 1,300 PHP through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

Liezel has been in the agricultural business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Liezel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of bananas to sell. Gloria has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Gloria would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 32 years old and has four children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Myrna is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 2,900 PHP through NWTF to purchase a solar lamp.

Myrna has been in the agricultural business for 2 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Glenda works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. 

Glenda is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: De nationalité togolaise, ABLA   demeurant à Lomé au quartier  adidogomé est âgée de 39ans ; elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. ABLA   vend  charbon de bois au  à domicile. ABLA  achète livraison à domicile par un grossiste et  elle s’approvisionne  3 fois par mois.
