ABLA  souhaiterait un appui financier pour plus soutenir son commerce afin de mieux vendre, faire des bénéfices et mieux épargner pour faire face aux diverses charges de son foyers.
texts.en: Of Togolese nationality, Abla lives in the Adidogomé neighbourhood of Lomé. She is 39, married and the mother of three children. Abla sells charcoal from her home. She receives the charcoal delivered to her home by a wholesaler three times a month. Abla is requesting financial support to help her business in order to sell more, grow her profits and to increase her savings in order to meet the various costs of her household.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Vit

texts.en: Vit is a 27-year-old widowed garment-factory worker with a small child in her care. She lives with her parents in Takeo province of Cambodia. She has been a worker since 2009 earning 5 USD daily. Now Vit would like to apply for a loan to buy a motorcycle to commute to work. With this loan, she will be able to reduce her traveling expenses. Talking about her future, she wants to have her own house and also take a clothes-designing course so that she will be able to have a small shop at home to use her skills in clothes designing.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute to work.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is married and lives in Lower Puntod, Lopez Jaena, the Philippines. For the past 30 years, both Alejandra and her husband have been engaged in farming activities. Alejandra earns 3,500 PHP each month which supports her family's needs.

As a new member of PMPC, Alejandra is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer to increase the crop yield of her growing rice. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase the crop yield of her growing rice

location.town: Plaridel-Lower Puntod, Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials such as gasoline, wood and a fishing net for her business.

Lea has been in this business for 4 years. Lea earns an income from buying and selling fish. She successfully repaid her previous loan and she has now requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lea has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as gasoline, wood and a fishing net.

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Airene works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. 

Airene has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Airene hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. Edna is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her business. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Edna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 32 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.

Alma has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Alma requested a 1,300 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

Alma has been in business for eight years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin is a 59-year-old married grocer with three children. She lives in Takeo province, Cambodia. Two of her children are garment factory workers. Her husband is a 62-year-old farmer who cultivates rice and fattens animals. Together, they can earn approximately $18 a day. 

Because her house is old, Sarin would like to request a loan to buy lumber to renovate her house. With this loan, she will have a nicer house. For her future plans, she is going to expand her business. When she has enough money, she also wants to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy lumber to renovate her house

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is married with three adult children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has now been in this business for 25 years. The business has helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. 

Pablita is still continuing the business because it provides a good income due to her loyal customers. Some day, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so her customers will be served well. 

Pablita is still planning for a business expansion for the benefit of her children and even her grandchildren. She has already taken out loans previously to purchase additional stock. Now, she is applying for a loan to purchase grocery items to increase the stock in her store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to increase the stock in her grocery store

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Jaime Artemio

texts.es:
Jaime Artemio tiene 42 años, es soltero, sin carga familiar, conocido en el medio, por su labor de crianza y venta de cerdos. Vive en casa propia. Jaime Artemio cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Vive en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Comunidad dedicada a la ganaderia y agricultura, habltada por gente sencilla y amable.

Jaime Artemio se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, cerdos, pollos, etc.cerdos, desde hace más 11 años aproximadamente. Adicionalmente trabaja prestando servicio como peón agrícola por zona de residencia y alrededores. Necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de un número mayor de animales, para poder aumentar su stock y diversificarlos, Jaime Artemio desea comprar animlaes tales como cerdos, patos y alimentos para estos, lo que le generará mayor ventas mensuales.
texts.en:
Jaime Artemio is 42 years old, single and has no children. He is known for his work raising and selling pigs. Jaime lives in a house that he owns and has good work and character references. Jaime lives in a community in the Saña district, Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast. Here the community works in farming and agriculture and is inhabited by simple and friendly people.

Jaime makes a living raising and selling small animals such as ducks, pigs, chickens and more. He has been doing this for over eleven years. In addition, he works as a farm labourer in the local area.

Jaime needs this loan in order to invest in more animals and increase and diversify his stock. Jaime wants to buy animals such as pigs and ducks, and feed for them. This will allow him to earn a higher monthly income.

loans.use: to invest in more animals and increase and diversify his stock.

loans.name: Conjucita

texts.en: Conjucita has mastered her swine production in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. This is how she earns an income and is able to help her husband in supporting their family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail of credit to fully support her business. She takes care of her membership with PMPC in the same way that she takes care of her swine production business. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so that she can always run to them for any financing needs. The loan she has taken of of 5,000 PHP will be used to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her piglets for commercial sale. This will help her build concrete pig pens that would enhance sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her piglets for commercial sale.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann, 32, is a resident of Coron, Palawan City, Philippines. She is married to Roberto, a businessman and she has two children. She manages her own household while operating her business. She works hard to augment their income for their daily household needs and for the schooling of her children.

Julie Ann has a direct selling business. She sells clothing such as men's and ladies blouses and polo shirts, and men's and ladies' pants of popular direct selling brands. Dealers buy the products at a lower price shown on the catalogue of the customers and sell them at a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. She earns a minimum of 12,500 PHP in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which she will use to buy more merchandise to sell to her customers. Part of the loan she will use for the renovation of her store to make it more comfortable and attractive to customers. Filipinos prefer to buy these branded personal goods due to their good quality. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return of her investment and for the financial help that will be given to her.   

Julie Ann aims to grow her business so she can send her children to the best schools. She dreams that all of them will finish college and that they live a quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes such as T-shirts, blouses and pants to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 37 years old and has two children. She is a married woman. Both of her children are in school. Maricel has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items like shampoo, canned goods and beverages to sell.
Maricel has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like shampoo, canned goods and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 57 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar and noodles to sell.

Erna has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish. She successfully repaid her previous loans and has now requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Erna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.en:
Eulogia is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a general store business in the Philippines for the past five years.

Eulogia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosa Cándida

texts.es:
Rosa solicito un crédito anteriormente y lo utilizo para comprar ropa y las ganancias de este una parte las ocupo para surtir el negocio y la otra parte para ayudarle a su hija que está cursando su último año de estudio en la universidad.

En esta vocación Rosa vuelve a solicitar un nuevo crédito, para comprar ropa usada y nueva, ya que en este mes son las fiestas patronales en el pueblo donde ella vive y es cuando vende más ya que las personas visitan la tienda de ella para comprarle el producto ya que los da más cómodos que las otras personas vendedoras del mercado.
texts.en:
Rosa had a previous loan which she used to buy clothing.  Part of the profit was used to stock her business and the rest is to help her daughter who is in her last year at university.

Now Rosa is seeking a new loan to buy used and new clothing for this month's patron saint holidays in her village.  It is a time when more people visit the shop to buy products that are better priced than elsewhere in the market.

loans.use: To buy used and new clothing for the upcoming patron saint holidays where she lives.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María de 31 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, estudio hasta quinto grado de nivel académico.  Esta acompañada el esposo se dedica a la albañilería,  en esta relación han procreado dos hijas los cuales están estudiando.

María además de realizar los oficios domésticos en su hogar,  también le ayuda a su padre a cultivar maíz, ya que desde pequeña el padre le enseño este trabajo porque en la familia la mayoría han sido hembras, entonces el padre siempre hacia los cultivos con la ayuda de ellas.

Todas la mañana maría le ayuda al papá antes de que las hijas se vayan para la escuela, ya que el padre siempre le da una parte de la milpa cuando sacan la cosecha, el trabajo le queda a una distancia de 15 minutos de donde ella vive y viaja a pie en un horario de las 7 a las 10 am.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar dos terneras, ya que tiene un terreno que el padre le ha heredado y no lo está usando, entonces quiere comprar dos terneras pequeñas para que se vayan engordando y en un futuro sean vacas y de ahí tener ese ingreso ya que el ingreso de la leche es bueno.

María tiene los sueños de sacar adelante a sus dos hijas y que Dios le preste vida para que a ellas no les falte nada y con las ganancias que estas dos terneras le den seguir adquiriendo más animales.
texts.en:
María is 31 years old and is a housewife. She has a fifth grade education. María is married; her husband is a builder. The couple has two daughters, both of whom are in school.

As well as taking care of the household chores, María also helps her father to grow corn. Since she was a girl, María's father has been teaching her this work. María's family is made up primarily of women and so her father always received help with the farming work from his daughters.

Every morning María goes out to help her father before her own daughters head off to school. María's father always gives her part of the harvest. The cornfield is 15 minutes from María's home; she works there from 7am until 10am.

This loan from CrediCampo will be used to buy two calves. María inherited a plot of land from her father but she is not using it. She therefore wants to buy two young calves to fatten up and raise to be cows. She can then make an income from their milk, which will be good.

María dreams of helping her two daughters to progress in life. She dreams that God will be good to her so that they need for nothing, and hopes that, with the profits from these first two calves, she will be able to buy more animals.

loans.use: to buy two calves as she has land that she inherited from her father that she is not using.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Matugga School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Farouk. He is the Head teacher of Matugga Mixed Secondary School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Matugga in Wakiso with 700 students. Matugga Mixed Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Matugga Mixed Secondary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Farouk ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: St. Noa Schools

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Eric. He is the Head teacher of St Noa Schools, a mixed Primary &girls Secondary school in the Peri-urban area of Zana in wakiso with 1900 students. St Noa Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.One system will be installed at the Primary section & another at the Secondary section The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment system with two 450 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St Noa Secondary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Eric ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: St. John Zana School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Beatrice. She is the Head teacher of St. John Nursery and Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Zana in Wakiso with 300 students. St. John Nursery and Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. John Nursery and Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Beatrice ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Ladybird School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Joseph. He is the Head teacher of LadyBird Day and Boarding Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Matugga in Wakiso with 698 students. LadyBird Day and Boarding Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

LadyBird Day and Boarding Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Joseph ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jes Johnny School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Geofrey. He is the Head teacher of Jes Johny Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Mukono with 600 students. Jes Johny Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Jes Johny Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Geofrey ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Potter's House School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Simon. He is the Head teacher of Potter’s House Nursery and primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Kawempe in Kampala with 150 students. Potter’s House Nursery and primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Potter’s House Nursery and primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Simon ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Summit School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Richards. He is the Head teacher of Summit Primary School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Njeru in Buikwe with 400 students Summit Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Summit Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Richards ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jesus Es El Camino Y La Verdad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JESUS ES EL CAMINO Y LA VERDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yanet ella es casada y tiene 28 años y tiene 2 hijos;La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva maiz,papa y trigo, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y semillas.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Jesus es el Camino y la Verdad”, which is located in the Anta district in Anta province in Cusco department.

One of the members is Yanet, 28, who is married and has two children.  She works in agriculture and owns land where she grows corn, potatoes and wheat.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  For seven years she has been in business and it is going very well.  Her dream is to expand her cropland.  The loan she is requesting is to buy fertilizers and seeds.

Yanet is grateful to everyone taking part in her dream through this loan and she is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Ma. Consuelo

texts.en:
Ma. Consuelo is grateful that she was granted a loan of 40,000 PHP which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for another loan of 40,000 PHP which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Ma. Consuelo dreams of putting up a grocery store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a bright future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ilyn works hard to support her family. She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store.

Ilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She successfully repaid her previous loans and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Ilyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs for her pig fattening business.

Ilyn hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Genevilla

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Genevilla works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Genevilla has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She has successfully repaid her previous loans and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Genevilla is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Rosie is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to  purchase more stocks of household goods to sell for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 49 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock of items such as soap, shampoo, canned goods and sugar to sell.

Alicia has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Alicia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items such as soap, shampoo, canned goods and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Maira

texts.en:
Maira is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and earns more income from her general store.

Maira has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She has successfully repaid her previous loans and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Maira is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell in her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has had a food vending business in the Philippines for the past three years. She earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Emelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like flour, cooking oil, sugar, margarine, etc. for her food vending business.

Emelita dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, cooking oil, sugar, margarine, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea, a 42-year-old married woman, lives in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo with her family of four children. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than a year now. Lea believes that fishing is a lucrative business so she decided to invest in it.

Lea is now requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets. This loan will enable her and her husband to improve their catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Lea wants to invest more in fishing to augment her income and profit. She adds that she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 47 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, she works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 21 years, Gina has run a general store in the Philippines which sells items such as soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, milk, juice, noodles, etc. 

Gina has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional grocery items like soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, milk, juice, noodles, etc. to sell in her store.

Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, milk, juice, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Gonzala

texts.en:
Gonzala, aged 43, is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gonzala has had a general store business in the Philippines for the past six years. 

Gonzala has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dolines

texts.es:
Dolines es un ejemplo de lucha constante. Ella estudió hasta la secundaria y cuando era joven se comprometió y tuvo 3 maravillosos hijos fruto de su relación, con el tiempo abrió una pequeña bodega y tuvo algunos problemas con su pareja por lo cual tuvo que cerrarla. Luego cuando las cosas ya iban mejorando su último hijo falleció lamentablemente. Para ella no ha sido fácil estos últimos años, tuvo que afrontar la pérdida de un ser querido..
Sin embargo ella sacó las fuerzas necesarias y ahora poco a poco está saliendo adelante porque tiene dos hijos por quien vivir. Con mucho esfuerzo está trabajando vendiendo pollos en un puesto en el mercado, ella cree que le está yendo bien porque está luchando día a día por su familia.
Dolines está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mayor cantidad de pollos para atender la demanda de sus clientes. Con esto ella espera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y más adelante verlos convertidos en grandes profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dolines is an example of continual struggle. She studied as far as secondary education and when she was young she got engaged and had three wonderful children from the relationship. After a while she opened a small store and then she had some problems with her partner so she had to close it.

Then when things were getting better her youngest son unfortunately died. These last few years have not been easy for her as she has had to deal with the loss of a loved one. However, she found the necessary strength and now she is gradually making progress because she has two children to live for. 

She puts a lot of effort into selling chickens from a market stall. She thinks it is going well for her because she is working hard every day for her family.

Dolines is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because the support they have given her will enable her to buy a larger quantity of chickens to meet the demand from her customers. By doing this she hopes to improve her family's quality of life and see her children become successful professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her business.

loans.name: Claudia Crolina

texts.es:
De 31 años de dada  y  con grandes aspiraciones en el futuro, casada que cuenta con 3 hijos que son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad ella es una gran mujer emprendedora que está dispuesta a enfrentar los obstáculos de la vida.

Claudia se ha dedicado a una de las profesiones más solemnes que existen en toda sociedad como lo es la docencia.  Es maestra en Sololá desde hace más de ocho años, pero lo ha sentido desde pequeña.  Sus alumnos lo esperan siempre cada mañana para que  les imparta el saber de la vida. La segunda actividad que ella realiza es la siembra de maíz y frijol para tener un ingreso extra para el sostenimiento de su familia. 

El uso respectivo que ella le dará al préstamo es para la compra de una computadora para la realización de su trabajo con eficacia y exactitud en la institución pública donde ella labora en enseñar a sus alumnos en la escuela de su comunidad.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de ella es seguir enseñado a los niños de su comunidad  el saber de cada día para que ellos sean profesionales en un futuro no muy lejano y dar estudio a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales en la vida y construir casas para sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia is 31 years old and has great hopes for the future. She is married and has 3 children who are excellent students at the community primary school. She is a very enterprising woman who is ready and willing to take on life's challenges.

Claudia works in one of the most serious professions in the whole of society, which is teaching. She has been a teacher in Sololá for more than eight years but has wanted to do this since she was little. Her pupils always wait for her every morning so she can share her knowledge of life with them. Her second job is growing corn and beans so she can have an extra income for her family's upkeep.

As for the loan, she will use it to buy a computer to carry out her work effectively and accurately at the public institution where she works, teaching her pupils in the community primary school.

One of her great ambitions is to continue teaching the children in her community their everyday knowledge so that they can become professionals in the not-too-distant future, and to educate her children so that they can become professionals in life and to build houses for her two sons.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Los De Tigo Group

texts.es:
Rosario es una joven mujer de 21 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos de seis y tres años, y su negocio es la venta de teléfonos celulares.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, trabajadora, constante y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en un mercado de la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por el crecimiento constante de su población proveniente de tribus nómadas del lugar como ‘Los Ayoreos’ y mineros relocalizados del occidente del país que hicieron de este sitio su hogar y generaron un comercio constante en todas las áreas.
Rosario es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, viste a la moda, su lengua nativa es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (de pie, la primera de la derecha). Debido a las necesidades de su familia y su negocio, formó una banca de personas con negocios como; tienda de videos, venta de comida, artesana en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería, panadería y carnicería, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus actividades comerciales. Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica al transporte como chofer asalariado y sus dos hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia de chapa y ladrillo que cuenta con los servicios de agua, luz y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de teléfonos celulares en un pequeño quiosco ambulante. Su labor la realiza de lunes a sábado porque el domingo se dedica a sus hijos. Su quiosco es un pequeño mostrador donde pone en exivición todos sus productos y se acomoda cerca del mercado donde existe un gran número de personas que transitan y compran. Ya lleva tres años de experiencia en el negocio y este es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución. Su sueño es llegar a tener un puesto en un mercado y abrir un centro de llamadas. Ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando una inversión en la compra de mayor cantidad de teléfonos, debido a las fiestas de fin de año sus ventas mejoran.
Es por esos motivos que Rosario solicita un préstamo para la compra de teléfonos celulares por mayor para aprovechar las ventas en las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Rosario is a 21-year-old young woman who lives with her partner and has two children aged six and three years. She has a business selling mobile phones. She is a good mother and is independent, hard-working, steady and very responsible. She works in a market in the "plan 3000' area which is characterised by the constant growth of its population due to nomadic tribes from places such as 'Los Ayoreos' and miners who have relocated from the west of the country and have made this place their home, generating a steady trade in the whole area.

Rosario has a dark complexion and long dark hair, is of medium height, and dresses fashionably. Her native tongue is Spanish and she knows Guaraní because of her family background. She is on the right in the photo.

Because of her family and  business needs, she set up a communal bank of people with businesses such as a video shop, food sales, plastercraft, soft drinks sales, a bookstore, bakery and butcher's, in order to ask for a loan and prosper from their businesses.

She spends her life with her partner, who works as a salaried driver, and their two children. The oldest goes to primary school. They live in their own house which is made of brick and sheet metal and has water, electricity and sewage services.

Her business is selling mobile phones from a small mobile kiosk. She works from Monday to Saturday because she devotes herself to her children on Sundays. Her kiosk is a small display counter where she has all her products on display and she sets up near the market where there are a lot of people passing by and buying. She already has three years' experience in the business and this is the first loan cycle with the institution.

Her dream is to have a stall in a market and open a call centre. She wants to expand her business by investing in a larger quantity of mobile phones, since her sales improve with the end-of-year holiday season. This is why Rosario is asking for a loan to buy mobile phones wholesale so she can take advantage of the sales in the end-of-year holiday season

loans.use: to buy mobile phones wholesale to take advantage of sales during the end-of-year holiday season.

loans.name: Margarita De Tusuyo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARGARITAS DE TUSUYO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Florencia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de mantas, venta de leche, artesanía en ponchos.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Florencia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, mismo que fue un negocio familiar, con el pasar del tiempo decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de forraje para los animales) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad, posteriormente a la crianza de sus ganados elaborará sus productos de comercio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The group “MARGARITAS DE TUSUYO” (Daisies of Tusuyo) initiates its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Copacabana Focal Centre. The group comprises eight members and is directed by a board, which is headed by Florencia, who is the president. The members of this communal association run various businesses, including cheese sales, blanket sales, milk sales and artisanal poncho sales.

The loan they are requesting will benefit these small microempresarios where Florencia is a member. She tells us that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago, after being invited by an associate of the institution, who came to visit her at her home. Currently, she has a business producing and selling cheese; she learned this business from her parents as it was the family business. After some time, she decided to start her own independent business.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her business capital to buy fodder for the animals, after she raises the animals she will produce the cheese to sell. This type of work permits her to generate resources to take care of her family, as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the loans offered by the institution.

loans.use: buy fodder for the animals.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 30 years old and has three children who are in school.

Gemma is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a 6,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gemma has been farming for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 47 years old and has four children. She is a married woman.

Monica has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been doing this for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Monica has requested a PHP 1,300 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Hường

texts.en:
Hường is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hường works in agriculture, farming for food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2013,  Hường joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business, and she has successfully repaid 1 loan from them.

The main hardship that Hường faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine, so she is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, she hopes to maintain a successful business and to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita is 47 years old, married and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. 

Estrellita has a retailing business selling gasoline in her neighborhood. She has had this business for 3 years and uses her good income to meet the daily needs of her family. 

With a desire to expand her business, Estrellita has requested a loan to buy more liters of gasoline to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. 

In the future, she hopes to see all her children finish their studies and get stable jobs.

loans.use: to buy more liters of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 33 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

Letecia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Batan Orcco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “BATAN ORCCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huaro, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Luisa ella es conviviente y tiene 69 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio, siendo este un grupo que cumple dichas características

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agrocultura, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal Bank “Batan Orcco,” located in the district of Huaro, which belongs to the Quispicanchis province in the Cusco department.

Maria Luisa, one of the members, is 69 years old and has six children. She works raising and selling animals such as guinea pigs and hens. She fattens them and sells them at different marketplaces. Thanks to this small business, she is able to get ahead with her children. Her dream is to have an establishment where she can sell the guinea pigs and hens.

Maria Luisa is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and hens, and feed for them.

The photos that are attached to the original one were taken after the meeting took place. Those members could not come due to work-related issues.

This loan is part of one of the lines of credit offered by Asociación Arariwa, called “Credi Yapa.” This line of credit is extended to borrowers with a good record, which is the case with this group.

The remaining members work in agriculture, sell animals, or have grocery stores or restaurants.

Maria Luisa wants to thank those who share her dream through this means and promises to pay the loan according to plan.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, hens, and feed for them.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 33 years old and married with three children who are in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like coffee, sugar, milk, can goods, chips, etc.

Melanie has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like coffee, sugar, milk, can goods, chips, etc

loans.name: Honoria

texts.en:
Honoria is 57 years old and married with five children. 

Honoria is a farmer, and specializes in pig fattening in the Philippines. Honoria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Honoria has been pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Honoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 53 years old and is a married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Emelda has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 49 years old and married with five children. 

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for 9 years and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon and Natasha products. 

Marissa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.  

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Donalyn

texts.en:
Donalyn is 20 years old and is the 4th of 4 children in the family. Her mother, Ellen, supports the family through her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Donalyn is studying to get her Bachelor of Science in Pharmacy and is currently in the 4th year of this 4-year course.

Donalyn is borrowing Php 40,000 to pay for tuition fees of the Second Semester of the school year 2014-15.

When she graduates, Donalyn plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha works hard to support her family. Juditha is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Juditha requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell in her fruit stand.

Juditha has been in this business for 5 years now.

Juditha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Norelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Norelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs.  Norelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Norelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gina works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  

Gina is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, potato chips, milk, spices, etc. for her general store business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, potato chips, milk, spices, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to add concrete flooring to the corridor of his house.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas
Fray Casiano Puntarenas

	Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas presenta la solicitud de crédito de 2 integrantes,  quienes han trabajan en una comunidad de Puntarenas (Fray Casiano) con altos niveles de pobreza. El  grupo de mujeres en la zona mantiene un  ahorro y participan en las actividades grupales para la generación de ingresos.  Tienen 8 años de trabajar en sus actividades, han solicitado préstamos y conocen la modalidad de trabajo grupal.  Se forma la Junta Directiva y se levanta el acta No.4 de solicitud de crédito del Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas, en esta oportunidad la  presidenta es Katia.

	Su trabajo y esfuerzo,  les ha permitido tener su  actividad consolidada como es el  comercio en general (venta de ropa, zapatos, perfumes y otros).  El préstamo va a contribuir a mejorar las condiciones de trabajo de su grupo,  les va a permitir invertir para la temporada de navidad y principio de  año, incrementando su inventario y cubriendo pedidos para esta  época de vacaciones de verano que se extiende hasta el mes de Abril, en la región costera del pacífico de Costa Rica.

	 Realizan la recuperación de la cuota en forma semanal lo que les permite tener un margen más amplio del pago a realizar, la cual se comprometen a cancelar en un plazo de 12 meses. 

Algunas de ellas son mujeres jefas de hogar, tal es el caso de Katia, ella tiene una hija de 10 años,  se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos en la zona, está incursionando en la venta de acero. Estos productos  los va a traer a San José y realiza viajes a la frontera con Panamá, tiene 35 años,  es una mujer trabajadora y de respeto en la comunidad. Además de atender sus actividades económicas por las tardes, también ve  a su hija y  cumplen con  las reuniones grupales. 

	El objetivo es mejorar las condiciones de sus empresas, obteniendo un financiamiento acorde con sus necesidades y apoyar el desarrollo de la zona  y por su puesto  mejorar la calidad de vida  de las familias. El nombre del grupo las motiva a ser mejores cada día, Mujeres Esforzadas.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas [Hardworking Women]
Fray Casiano Puntarenas

Banco Mujeres Esforzadas presents the loan request of two members who work in a community in Puntarenas (Fray Casiano), where the poverty levels are high. The group of women in the area keeps some savings and participates in group activities to generate income. They have been working with these activities for eight years and requested loans, so they are familiar with group work. They formed the board of directors, where Kattia is the president, and wrote the fourth loan request from Banco Mujeres Esforzadas.

Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to have a stable economic activity. She is a businesswoman who sells clothes, shoes, and perfumes, among other things. With this loan, she will be able to improve her group’s working conditions, by making it possible to invest in increasing their stock levels and fulfill their orders, now that the Christmas and New Year celebrations are coming. The summer break lasts until April in the Pacific Coast region of Costa Rica.

They collect the payments weekly, which allows them to have a larger payment margin, and they commit to paying off the loan within twelve months.

Some of the women are heads of household. This is the case of Kattia. She has a ten-year-old daughter and sells clothes and shoes in the area. She has recently started to sell steel jewelry, which she will bring to San José from her trips to the border with Panama. She is 35 years old and is a hardworking woman, respected by her community. Besides working in the afternoons, she spends time with her daughter and attends the group’s meetings.

The goal is to improve the conditions of their businesses through a loan that is appropriate to their needs. Also, to contribute to the development of the area and of course to the improvement of their families’ living conditions. The name of the group, i.e. Hardworking Women, motivates them to be better every day.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and steel jewelry.

loans.name: Suma Sartawi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUMA SARTAWI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alfoncina es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de productos medicinales caseros, servicio de construcción, venta de artefactos electrodomésticos, venta de papa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alfoncina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitar a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artefactos electrónicos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de una amiga quien viajaba a la compra de los mismos, cuando aprendió la dinámica decide emprender un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de artefactos electrónicos por mayor) que adquirirá de la ciudad de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Suma Sartawi" will begin its first loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer.  They are part of what is called the Focal Center of Santiago II, and the group is comprised of 8 members and is directed by a board with Alfoncina as the secretary.  The businesses that group members run are varied and include the following: selling food, selling homemade medicinal products, offering construction services, selling electrical appliances, and selling potatoes.  

The loan will be used to benefit these micro-businesses, including that of which Alfoncina is a part.  She indicates that she recently joined Pro Mujer, and she joined because of an invitation from a promotor who visited her home.  Currently she has a business selling electrical appliances. She learned this business from a friend who worked buying the same products, and once she learned the ropes she decided to start her own independent company. 

The loan will be used to increase capital (to purchase electrical appliances in bulk) which will be purchased in the city of Oruro and later sold via her stall.  This job allows her to generate support for her family, since she lives with her life partner and has a child.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the consultations and trainings offered by the organization.

loans.use: To purchase electrical appliances in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Nelson Ivan

texts.es:
Nelson de 29 años de edad. Es una persona trabajadora que lucha todos los días para ganarse el alimento. Es soltero y tiene dos hijos pequeños a los que quiere mucho. Tiene casa propia pero prefiere vivir con sus abuelos para hacerles compañía.

Desde pequeño Nelson aprendió de su abuelo lo que era trabajar la tierra, sembrando principalmente maíz y maicillo. Actualmente, también se dedica al engorde de ganado bovino.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar cuatro terneros que piensa engordarlos y venderlos en la época donde el precio de los animales aumenta. De esta forma, obtiene mejores ingresos que lo benefician a él y a su familia.

Nelson sueña con mejorar sus ingresos  para así casarse y formar un hogar próspero junto con su actual novia.
texts.en:
Nelson is 29 years old, he is a hard-working person who struggles every day to earn his food. He is single and has two young children who he loves very much. He has his own house but he prefers to live with his grandparents to keep them company.

Since he was young, Nelson learned from his grandfather what it was to work the land, growing principally corn and sorghum. Currently, he also works fattening cows. 

The loan that he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to purchase four calves that he plans to fatten and sell in the season when the prices for animals increase. In this way, he will get more income which will benefit him and his family.

Nelson dreams of increasing his income to be able to marry and make a prosperous home with his current girlfriend.

loans.use: to purchase four calves that he plans to fatten and sell in the season when the prices for animals increase.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.es:
Melvin es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, soltero y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, actualmente trabaja como Asistente de Abastecimiento en el Municipio de su ciudad natal, San Martin. Día a día se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia, no pudo estudiar una profesión debido a la poca economía en su familia pero eso no fue un impedimento para que se rindiera, por el contrario hoy más que nunca está aumentando su experiencia y tiene un buen desenvolvimiento en su labor.
Melvin tiene muchos deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos, por ello piensa utilizar el crédito para poder hacer mejoras en su vivienda como pintarrajear las paredes de su casa. Él se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esto su familia gozará de mayor bienestar y así seguirá luchando para conseguir un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Melvin is a very hard-working and responsible person, he is single and has great desire to get ahead. He currently works as an supply assistant in the municipality of his hometown of San Martin. Day after day he works hard to get his family ahead. He couldn't study for a degree due to his family's limited economic resources but this was not an obstacle which would cause him to give up; on the contrary, today more than ever he is increasing his experience and has a good development in his work. 

Melvin has great desires to improve his loved ones' quality of life, and so he plans to use the loan to be able to make repairs in his house such as plaster the walls of the house. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity and he wants them to know that, with this, his family will enjoy a better well-being and he will continue fighting to achieve a better future.

loans.use: to plaster the walls of his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to bring potable water to her house.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RENACER” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosario es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos, venta de chompas, servicio de fotocopias, librería, venta de chocolates.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosario es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de librería y servicio de internet; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace tres años, cuando volvió a Bolivia, ya que viajó a trabajar a otro país y no fue muy productivo; es por ello que al contar con un poco capital decidió emprender este negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de material escolar por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en a las unidades policiales. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es divorciada y tiene dos hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las el área de salud, las capacitaciones y el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “RENACER” will begin its eleventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of which Rosario is the president. The businesses of the communal bank members are varied and among them are blanket sales, food sales, cosmetic sales, sweater sales, a copy service, a bookstore, and chocolate sales. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small business-owners of whom Rosario is one. She says that two years ago, she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a bookstore business and an internet service. She explains that she opened this business three years ago, when she returned to Bolivia since she had traveled to work in another country and it wasn't very productive. For this reason, when she had a little capital, she decided to undertake this business. 

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (purchase school supplies in bulk) that she will get from wholesalers in the city of La Paz, and later will sell to the police units. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is divorced and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health center, training, and loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Sandra Yamileth

texts.es:
Sandra de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo año de bachillerato, esta separada de su pareja desde hace 4 años tiene un hijo.  Ella vive con unos sobrinos que cuida ya que los padres de ellos están en  Estados Unidos, antes tenia un negocio de venta de pupusas pero ahora a decidido dedicarse al comercio de ropa de manera ambulante, ya que por medio de una señora que es comerciante aprendió.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar camisas, blusas, pantalones, faldas, short, cosméticos, lociones, etc. para surtir su negocio. Ella  sueña con que su hijo sea un profesional de mucho éxito.
texts.en:
Sandra is 29 years old, she studied to to the second year of secondary school. She separated from her partner 4 years ago and has a son. She lives with some nephews who she takes care of since their parents are in the United States. Before, she had a business selling pupusas but now she has decided to work selling clothing as a street vendor since she learned how from a woman who is a saleswoman. 

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, shorts, cosmetics, lotions, etc. to stock her business.She dreams that her son will become a very successful professional.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, shorts, cosmetics, lotions, etc. to stock her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 63 años de edad es una mujer que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante al lado de su nieto de 13 años de edad y su hijo. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida elaborando y vendiendo antojitos típicos en su domicilio, entre los productos que distribuye se encuentran: yuca frita y sancochada, pasteles de carne, nuégados, empanadas, etc. dicha actividad Rosa tiene 30 años de realizarla por lo que ya es muy reconocida en su cantón, por la higiene y el buen sabor con el que cuentan sus productos. Como se observa en la fotografía el techo de la cocina de Rosa se encuentra bastante deteriorado, por lo que ella desea repararlo, ya que además de servirle para uso de la familia, también le sirve para preparar sus ventas por lo que están importante para ella que se encuentre en el mejor estado posible, por lo que Rosa ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reparar el techo de la cocina de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa at 63 years old is a woman who always looks for ways to get ahead along with her 13 year old grandson and her son. She is a hard-working woman who makes her living making and selling snack food at her house. Amongst the products that she distributes are fried and boiled yucca, meat pies, nuégados ( traditional sweet snack), empanadas, etc. Rosa has been doing this for 30 years and is well known in her canton for the cleanliness and good taste of her products.

As you can see in the photo the roof of Rosa's kitchen is in bad shape and she wants to repair it. Besides using it for her family, she also uses it to prepare her sales. So it is important for her to have it in the best condition possible. So Rosa has taken the decision to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized laminate, wood and nails to repair the kitchen roof.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, wood and nails to repair the roof of the kitchen in her house.

loans.name: 74-La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer de 37 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos de diecisiete y diecinueve años, y su negocio es la atención de una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, activa, buena madre, solidaria paciente, constante y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘Mutualista’ un lugar en el centro de la ciudad abarrotado de tiendas comerciales en todas la áreas, de clima tropical con una temperatura promedio de 27-32 grados centígrados durante todo el año. 
Elizabeth es de tez morena, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el guaraní que ya no utiliza y habla español (a la derecha, sonriendo, blusa blanca con puntos negros y pantalón verde). debido al constante crecimiento de su negocio se vió con la necesidad de formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de fruta, venta de tomates, taller de costura, tejido de mantas, venta de pescado, servicio de construcción. Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que trabaja como transportista y sus dos hijos; uno está terminando la escuela y el mayor está intentando cursar estudios superiores, toda la familia vive en una casa de ladrillo alquilada que cuenta con los servicios de agua, luz y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como; arroz, fideo, pan, leche, azúcar, refrescos y algunas verduras, en una tienda de barrio ubicada en su mismo domicilio. Su tienda es muy visitada por los vecinos y clientes casuales que auguran el éxito de su negocio. Esta es la cuarta secuencia de préstamos con la institución en un año que lleva con el negocio. Su sueño es consolidarse en la zona y ser la tienda preferida por los vecinos. Ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor para surtir la tienda y ser la favorita de la zona.
Es por esos motivos que Elizabeth solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor para surtir su tienda y ser la favorita de la zona.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 37-year-old woman; she lives with her partner and has two children ages seventeen and nineteen and her business is running a neighborhood store with staple foods.

She is enterprising, independent, active, a good mother, compassionate, patient, dependable, and very hard-working. She does her work in the "Mutualista" zone, a place in the center of the city full of commercial stores in all the areas, with a tropical climate with an average temperature of 27-32 degrees Centigrade throughout the year.

Elizabeth is tanned, short, has a robust physical build, and dark black hair. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she doesn't use anymore, and she speaks Spanish (she is on the right, smiling, with a white blouse with black spots and green pants). Due to the constant growth of her business, she saw the need to form a communal bank of people with businesses such as food sales, fruit sales, tomato sales, a tailor shop, blanket weaving, fish sales, and a construction service. She makes her live with her partner who works as a driver, and their two children. One is finishing school and the older one is trying to finish higher education. The whole family lives in a rented brick house that has water, electricity and sewer services. Her business is selling staple products such as rice, noodles, bread, milk, sugar, soft drinks and some vegetables, in a neighborhood store located in her home.  Her store is frequented by the neighbors and occasional customers who foretell the success of her business. This is the fourth loan cycle with the institution in the year that she has had the business. Her dream is to become established in the zone and be the preferred store for all the neighbors. She wants to expand her business, purchasing staple food products in bulk to stock her store and be the favorite in the zone.

For these reason, Elizabeth asks for a loan to purchase basic staple foods in bulk to stock her store and be the favorite in the zone.

loans.use: to purchase staple foods in bulk to stock her store and to become the favorite one of the zone.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, wood, nails and tiles to replace the roof on her house.

loans.name: Blanca Ester

texts.es: Blanca de 41 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que habita en vivienda humilde pero propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 17 y 14 años de edad. Ella buscando siempre la forma de salir adelante con su familia decidió hace mucho tiempo dedicarse a la venta de tamales de gallina, los que prepara en su domicilio para luego salir a venderlos de forma ambulante por todo el cantón, este negocio le ha permitido a Blanca no solo salir adelante sino también poder estar cerca de sus hijos por lo que se siente muy feliz. El techo de la vivienda de Blanca está hecho de tejas, y estas se están quebrando lo que ha provocado que aparezcan filtraciones de agua, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI con el que pueda cambiar las tejas del techo de su vivienda por lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca is 41 years old and is a hard-working woman who lives in a humble home, but one which she owns, along with her partner and her two children, who are 17 and 14 years old. She is always searching for ways to move forward with her family, and decided a long time ago to work selling chicken tamales, which she makes at home and later sells them on the street throughout the whole area. This business has allowed Blanca not only to move forward, but also to be close to her children, which she is very happy about.
