Blanca's roof is made of tiles, which are breaking, leading to leaks appearing. For this reason she has decided to apply to FUSAI for a loan so that she can change her tiled roof for one made of galvanized steel sheets, wood and nails.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized steel sheets, wood and nails, in order to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleada de una tienda de consumos diarios.  Era lo que ella esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que ella quería ser. De 36 años de edad casada originaria del departamento de Suchitepéquez que tiene tres hijos el primero casado y tiene ya su familia, el segundo y tercero estudian en la comunidad donde viven. Ella realiza un impresionante esfuerzo a pesar de su edad, ella es una mujer emprendedora y dice que nunca es demasiado tarde para empezar a desarrollar y tener una visión en el futuro.

La actividad que ella dignamente a desempeñado durante 5 años es la compraventa de abarrotería en la comunidad ya que es por medio de ella puede obtener un ingreso económico para su familia y una ganancia para mejora su condición de vida.

El uso respectivo que Elena le dará al préstamo que ella solicita es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotería para así tener surtida su tienda para no perder la clientela con que ella cuenta.  

Los sueños de ella es que las condiciones de su familia sean las adecuadas para un futuro y es por eso que quiere compra dos molinos de nixtamal y instalarlas en su comunidad y ver crecer a sus hijos en los campos de la educación y que sean profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Life gave Elena an opportunity to work as an employee in a store selling everyday items.  It was what she was waiting for—not only an open door but also what was on the other side of this door.  And what she found was something that came to define what she wanted to be.  

She is thirty-six years old and married.  She comes from Suchitepéquez department.  She has three children.  The oldest is married and already has his own family, while her second and third children are students in the community where they live.  She puts forth a great effort in spite of her age.  She is an enterprising woman and says that it’s never too late to begin to develop and have a vision for the future.

The work that she has carried out well for five years now is buying and selling groceries in the community.  It is by these means that she can earn an income for her family, with earnings to improve their living conditions.

The use that Elena has for the loan that she has requested is to buy grocery store merchandise in order to stock her store, so that she doesn’t lose her customer base.

Her dream is that her family’s living conditions would be adequate in the future.  And so, because of this, she wants to buy two nixtamal [limed corn] mills and install them in her community.  She also dreams of seeing her children grow in their education and become professionals in their lifetime.

loans.use: to buy grocery store merchandise

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is 48 years old and married. She has two children. Elina works very hard to provide for them.

Elina runs a general store in the Philippines. Elina has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

Elina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future Elina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 35-year-old fisherman from Concepcion, Iloilo. 

He has been in the fishing business for more than 15 years now. This is his source of income. Alex is a hardworking man.

Alex wants to take a loan to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets. A loan will enable him to augment his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.
 
In the future, Alex dreams of making his fishing venture more stable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.name: Niza

texts.en:
Niza, 53, is a married woman with three children who are all still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Niza has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. Niza has been in this business for 10 years. 

Niza requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell. 

In the future, Niza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita works hard to support her family. Paulita is married and has a cattle raising business in the Philippines. Paulita has been in this business for five years now.

Paulita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

In the future, Paulita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

loans.name: Grace

texts.fr: Demeurant à Lomé précisément au quartier adidogomé, GRACE est âgée de33ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle fait la restauration en vendant deCon(préparation à base  du maïs) qu’elle achète au  marché d'Assiyéyé.  GRACE  s’approvisionne 5 fois par mois au  marché d'Assiyéyé. GRACE  sollicite un microcrédit pour augmenter  son activité de revenu afin de participer à la charge du foyer et aider son mari dans les dépenses du foyer, et aussi avoir beaucoup plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Living in the Adidogomé neighborhood in Lomé, Grace is 33 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is in the restaurant business, and sells Con (made from a corn base) that she purchases from the market in Assiyéyé. She stocks up 5 times a month at this market; She is asking for a loan in order to increase her level of activity in order to participate in taking care of the household needs, and helping her husband with daily expenses, and to increase her profit.

loans.use: purchase 67 bowls of corn

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 49 years old and married with two children. 

Teresita is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been farming corn for four years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies so as to provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Rosvilla

texts.en:
Rosvilla is 44 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are currently in school.

Rosvilla is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She has been raising cattle for two years now, and she has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Rosvilla requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

In the future, Rosvilla would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 28 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school. Rebecca works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca runs a buy and sell coconut business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more coconut to sell.

In the future Rebecca would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 48-year-old married woman who has six children of whom three are still in school.

Susan is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Susan has been buying and selling livestock for five years now, and she has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Susan requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Joevina

texts.en:
Joevina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Joevina is 42 years old and her two children are in school.

Joevina has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Joevina has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 58 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Rosa has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig raising.

Rosa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Claudia Luisa

texts.es:
Claudia es una joven muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, está estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad en su ciudad natal, Calleria. También es trabajadora de una cadena de supermercados. Ella diariamente se despierta temprano, se va a trabajar y por las noches continúa con sus estudios, obviamente trabajar y estudiar es un poco agotador, pero a ella no le importa, es más es un desafío que lo toma con mucho entusiasmo porque quiere convertirse en una gran profesional para apoyar a sus padres.
Claudia está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprarse una motocicleta para poder transportarse a su centro laboral y sus clases y así pueda ahorrar en pasajes. Con esto ella seguirá esforzándose para salir adelante y más adelante culminar su carrera profesional con honores.
texts.en:
Claudia is a hard-working young woman who really wants to move forward in life. She is studying Accounting in her native city, Calleria. She also works in a supermarket chain. She wakes up early every day, goes to work and then studies in the evening. Obviously working and studying is quite tiring, but she doesn't mind; in fact, it is a challenge which she takes on enthusiastically because she wants to become a great professional so that she can support her parents.

Claudia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because the support they are offering her will allow her to buy a motorcycle which she will be able to use to travel to her workplace and her classes, meaning she can save on tickets. She will continue putting in the effort to move forward and in the future complete her professional degree with Honours.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to use to travel to work.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 25 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are in school.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Rosemarie has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. Rosemarie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. Edna has been in this business for five years. Edna earns additional income from farming rice and running a general store.

Edna successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and fastening pins to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Carlos Horacio

texts.es: Carlos de 25 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 15 meses de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 3 años. Él es un hombre que se esfuerza por salir adelante al lado de su familia, por medio de su trabajo como jornalero el cual realiza desde hace 3 años. Carlos siente que su vivienda es bastante pequeña por lo que buscando la manera de darle mayor comodidad a su familia ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y lamina para ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en: Carlos is 25 years old. He is a hard-working man who lives with his life companion and his 15 month old daughter in their own house where they have lived for the past 3 years. He is a man who makes an effort each day to get ahead with his family through his work as a day labor which he has done for 3 years. Carlos feels that his house is too small so he is looking for a way to make his family more comfortable. He has taken the decision to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, re-bar and laminate to expand his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand. gravel, re-bar and laminate to add on to his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corrugated sheets, wood and nails so he can change the roof to his home.

loans.name: Lorena Guadalupe

texts.es: Lorena de 30 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas de 12 y 14 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que se esfuerza por salir adelante al lado de su familia, por medio de su negocio de compra, crianza y venta de pollos, actividad que tiene 5 años de realizar, gracias a ello ya cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan sus productos, por su accesibilidad en los precios y buena calidad. Lorena desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que esta se encuentra deteriorada, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lorena, 30, lives in this house with her partner and her two daughters aged 12 and 14.  

She is a woman who makes a lot of effort to get along in life together with her family, using her business in which she buys, raises and sells chickens.  She has been in this business for five years.  Thanks to her experience, good price and quality of product, she has a loyal set of customers who always come to her to buy.  

Lorena would like to change the roof to her house as it has deteriorated.  However, she does not have the necessary financial means to do it.  Therefore, she has asked FUSAI for a loan to buy corrugated sheets, wood and nails so she can change it.

loans.use: to buy corrugated sheets, wood and nails to change the outside roof of her home.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO DE POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Elena; la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica  al negocio de venta de chicha blanca y a la venta de ropa como medias, la socia lleva buta tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de medias para damas, niños entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Elena belongs to the “TRES DE MAYO DE POROY” communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco, Cusco department. Elena is married and has 3 children. She works selling chicha blanca (a fermented drink made from corn and other grains) and selling clothing like socks. She has been working in this business for some time and things are going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business each day. She wants to continue to work in this way to continue to support her family. She is requesting the loan to buy socks for women and children amongst other things. Elena feels grateful for the loan and promises to pay the installments of her loan.

loans.use: to buy socks for women and children amongst other things.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO DE PORORY”.
La socia es la Sr. Luz Marina, la socia tiene 35 años de edad y tiene 03 hijos, La socia se dedica  al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros a todos sus clientes que le solictan, la socia lleva buen  tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina belongs to the Tres De Mayo De Porory communal bank.  She is 35 years old and has three children.  Her business is a grocery store where she sells different types of products like rice, sugar, and milk, among others that all of her customers request.  She has been in her business for a good amount of time.  It is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  She wishes to be able to continue working and, in this way, continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, and milk, among others.  She is grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and milk, among others.

loans.name: Azucena Del Carmen

texts.es: Azucena está casada tiene 56 años de edad, es de oficio comerciante vende mercadería en general, el primer préstamo que obtuvo le ayudo a incrementar su inventario y obtener mejores ganancias. Ella cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar perfumes, pinturas labiales, cremas del cuerpo entre otros. Después de cancelar el crédito desea seguir ampliando su negocio para brindarles a los clientes mejores productos.
texts.en:
Azucena, 56, is married and is a trader.  She sells general goods.  The first loan she asked for helped her to increase her stock and generate more income.  

She can count on the unconditional support of her husband.

She is asking for a new loan to buy perfumes, lip-sticks, body lotions and other things.  

After paying off the loan she hopes to continue expanding her business so she can offer her customers better products.

loans.use: to buy perfume, lip-sticks and body lotions among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer for her university classes and her job.

loans.name: Carlos Mauricio

texts.es:
Carlos de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado debido a que no pudo tener la oportunidad de seguir estudiando, vive solo en casa ya que sus padres se fueron del lugar a vivir a otro lugar, y él se quedo en casa viviendo solo.

Carlos se dedica a cultivar frijol y maíz dese hace nueve años,  su abuelo le enseño a trabajar y hoy en día lo hace por si solo, los abuelos de él viven un poco cerca que es de quien recibe apoyo cuando lo necesita, ahorita tiene en mente instalar una granja de pollos,  ya casi saca sus granitos y quiere quedar trabajando ya que siente que con este nuevo trabajo él podra obtener mejores ganancias.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar pollos y el concentrado, ya que el lugar donde los tendra ya lo esta terminando de preparar.

En el futuro desea que su negocio sea grande para obtener asi mejores ingresos economicos, si se le otorga el préstamo se le facilitara para implementar sus ideas de prosperarse y con esto poder ayudar a sus abuelos.
texts.en:
Carlos, 21, studied until sixth grade only as he did not have the opportunity to continue studying.  He lives on his own at home as his parents left the house to go and live somewhere else.  

He grows frijoles beans and corn, an activity that he has been doing for nine years.  He learnt this trade from his grandfather and he now does it on his own.  His grandparents live a little closer to him, so they are the ones who help him when he needs it.  

At the moment, he is planning to build a chicken coup.  It is nearly time for him to finish with his grains, so he wants to carry on working.  He feels that this new business venture will give him a better source of income.  

He is asking for a loan to buy chickens and chicken feed.  He is just finishing off the area where he is going to keep them.  

In the future he hopes that his business will be successful so he can earn a better living.  If he is granted this loan he will be able to put his ideas into practice and if he prospers, he will be able to help his grandparents.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed as he has nearly finished the area where he is going to keep them.

loans.name: Las Malvinas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Las Malvinas” está formado por 10 socios dinámicos y emprendedores. Livia de 50 años de edad es casada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanías. Así mismo como actividad secundaria se dedica a la compra y venta de lana de alpaca. Su mayor anhelo es comprarse un terreno para ampliar su negocio. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de piel de alpaca y lana. El grupo “Las Malvinas” agradecen a todas las personas que facilitaron este crédito. Livia se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo floreado.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Las Malivinas' is made up of ten dynamic and enterprising people.  Livia, 50, is married and has one son who is now independent.  She makes and sells crafts.  As a second source of income she also buys and sells alpaca fur and wool.  

Her greatest desire is to buy some land so she can expand her business.  She is asking for a loan to buy alpaca fur and wool.  

The group 'Las Malvinas' are grateful to all those who help them with these loans.  

Livia is standing up at the back, the second on the left, wearing a flower-patterned top.

loans.use: to buy alpaca fur and wool.

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Net is 21 years old, a teacher and a second-year student at a university from the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She has been a teacher since 2012, earning approximately $3.33 a day to support her studies. 

Due to a shortage of finances, Net decided to secure a loan to pay her university fees. This loan will help her to get through the second year successfully. In the future, she is going to find another better job with a reasonable salary.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Julie Ann has been in this business for six years. Julie Ann earns additional income from selling fish and vegetables.

Julie Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is 39 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Laila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, beers, etc., to sell.

Laila has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, beers, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, beers, etc., to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros. She is grateful for the loan assistance that she received, and she was able to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, educational, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 21,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan for her to buy additional hogs and feeds needed for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Milagros hopes to have a bigger farmland that she could use for expanding her business. She desires to have a stable source of income so she could always provide for the needs of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs needed for her business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 51 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, chips, etc.

Violeta has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, chips, etc.

loans.name: Lyzel

texts.en:
Lyzel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lyzel is 34 years old, and three children are in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Lyzel requested a 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Lyzel has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lyzel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Vigie

texts.en:
Vigie is 52 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Vigie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Vigie has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from a restaurant.  Vigie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Sokhlun's Group

texts.en:
Sokhlun’s Group live in a rural village in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Sokhlun makes a living cultivating rice and raising chickens and ducks.  She also does extra work as a construction worker and factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Ne's Group

texts.en:
Ne’s Group lives in a rural village in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia.  Ne makes a living cultivating rice and raising chickens to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Justino Nicolas

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleado de una sastrería de su comunidad.  Era lo que el esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que el quería ser. El es Justino de 35 años de edad y con grandes aspiraciones en superar en la vida el tiene 2 hijos que son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad.

La actividad que el dignamente realiza en la comunidad donde el vive es modista y costurero, el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 5 años el aprendió esa actividad gracias a que una gran mujer que tenía una confección de ropa en la comunidad, lo contrato y el aprendió y se decidió a emprender el  también dicho negocio ya que deja muy buena ganancia para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso que el dará al crédito realizado es para la remodelación de su vivienda ya que las condiciones de vida que el tiene no son las adecuadas para habitar y es por ello que se ha decidido a realizar un préstamo para remodelar su casa así tener las condiciones de vida adecuada para ella y su familia. Una de las grandes aspiraciones de el es instalar un local en el centro de su comunidad para tener ventas mayores son las que ahora realiza y dar estudios a sus hijos para que ellos sean profesionales en los diferentes campos laborales de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Life gave him an opportunity to work as an employee at a community tailor shop. It was just what he had been waiting for, not only an open door, but also what was behind said door. What he found defined what he wanted to be. He is Justino, 35 years old, and has big aspirations of succeeding in life. He has two children who are excellent students in the community school.
The activity he worthily performs in the community where he lives is as a dressmaker and tailor. He has been doing this for the past five years. He learned thanks to a great woman who had a dressmaking shop in the community, she hired him and he learned and decided to also embark in the business since it produces good profits for the betterment of his family's life conditions. 
He will be using the loan to remodel his home because the conditions that he currently has are not adequate for living and it is due to this that he has decided to take out a loan to remodel his home and be able to have adequate living conditions for him and his family. 
One of his big aspirations is to put up a shop in the middle of his community in order to increase his sales beyond where they are now and be able to provide his children with education so they can go on to become professionals in different career fields in his community.

loans.use: remodel his home

loans.name: Mceun'sgroup

texts.en:
Mceun’s Group lives in a rural village in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Mceun makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this man and woman to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Flavia; ella tiene 46 años de edad  y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de  comida, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia es técnica protesista, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros. 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the "Vigen Asunta" community bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province and department. The partner is Mrs. Flavia, she is 46 years old and has six children. She alternates her daily activities with her food sales business. She has been in this business for some time now and does well thanks to the hard work she puts in each day. At the same time she works as a technical prosthetist. She hopes to continue working in this manner in order to continue supporting her family. 
The partner requested the loan to purchase ingredients such as oil, rice and others. The partner is happy for the loan and is committing herself to paying the repayments on time.

loans.use: purchase ingredients such as oil, rice and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Evelyn Elizabeth

texts.es: Evelyn tiene 21 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas de 8 años y 3 años de edad. Evelyn se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo como: cremas de mano, cuerpo, cabello; champo, maquillaje, etc. Este negocio es muy importante para mantener el equilibrio de su economía dado que con los ingresos de su compañero de vida no logran cubrir todas los gastos del hogar. Evelyn desea invertir en su negocio por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos como: variedad de cremas, champo, jabones, cosméticos, lociones, etc.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 21 years old and lives in her own home with her partner and their two children, who are 8 and 3 years old. Evelyn makes a living by selling beauty products from a catalog, like creams for hands, body, and hair, shampoo, makeup, etc. This business is very important for maintaining their financial status because her partner's income does not cover all of their household expenses.

Evelyn would like to invest in her business, so she has requested this loan from FUSAI. She will purchase a large quantity of products like: a variety of creams, shampoo, soap, cosmetics, lotions, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of creams, shampoo, soap, cosmetics, lotions, etc.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos, vive con su familia en este una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Raul se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 11 años de experiencia en el negocio, sus servicios los brinda en el mismo distrito y alrededores, Raul solicita préstamo para compra de insumos agrícolas y para mantenimiento de equipos y/o herramientas. De esta forma podrá ofrecer un servicio confiable y de mayor calidad; dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio; Raule piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
Raul is 40 years old, he is single, has no children and lives with his family in Este, a rural zone in the Oyotun district of the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of the north coast of Peru. His community is basically dedicated to agriculture, cattle raising and commerce. 
Raul is a day laborer, he has his own tools and has more than 11 years of experience in the business. He offers his services in his own district and in the surrounding ones. 
Raul is requesting this loan to purchase agriculture materials and for the maintenance of his equipment and/or tools. In this way he will be able to offer a reliable service with better quality. Said investment will help him to improve the conditions of his equipment and tools which will have a big influence on the business. Raul hopes to improve the productivity of his services and in doing so be able to take care of the diverse needs of the clients in the zone.

loans.use: purchase agricultural materials and maintenance for his equipment and/or tools

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo, en casa propia, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Cayalti y goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Nelida se dedica a la actividad de servicio de transporte en mototaxi, desde hace más de 5 años, este servicio lo brinda en todo su distrito y alrededores. Solicita préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi. De esta manera asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo, y poder seguir generando ingresos para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nelida is 42 years old, is married, and lives with her husband in their own home in a small community in the rural area of Cayalti. She has good personal and work references from her neighbors. Her community is mostly dedicated to agriculture, commerce, and ranching. It is located in the district of Cayalti in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

Nelida has made a living by providing transportation services in her mototaxi for the past 5 years. She serves all of her district and the surrounding areas. She requests this loan to maintain and repair her mototaxi. This way, she will be able to certify that it is functioning correctly so that she can continue to earn money to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain and repair her mototaxi.

loans.name: Neda

texts.en:
Neda previously received a loan for 21,000 PHP, which she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials needed to manufacture doormats that she sells. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household, and business expenditures.

Neda requested another loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from her business will help her sustain her family’s daily needs. She wants for her business to flourish and she desires to help her children finish their studies. 

Neda meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week in a place where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, needles ,and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr: De nationalité togolaise, ADJOAVI demeure  à Lomé au quartier d’adidogomé. Elle est âgée de 36ans mariée et mère de 2enfants .ADJOAVI   vend  du savon dans les environs de son quartier. ADJOAVI  achète au marché d'Assiyéyé et  elle s’approvisionne  3 fois par mois. ADJOAVI    est logé  dans un bâtiment construite en dur, et dont le toit est en tuile. ADJOAVI  souhaiterait un prêt  pour plus soutenir son commerce afin de mieux vendre, faire des bénéfices et mieux épargner pour faire face aux diverses charges de son foyers.
texts.en:
Adjoavi is from Togo and lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood of Lomé. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children.

Adjoavi sells soap in the areas around her neighborhood. She purchases her supplies at the market in Assiyéyé and she stocks up 3 times per month.

Adjoavi lives in a building made of steel, with a roof made of tile. Adjoavi is requesting a loan to be better able to support her business and do better, to earn more profit and increase her savings to meet the various needs of her household.

loans.use: to purchase 5 boxes of soap

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. María; la socia tiene 44 años d edad y es conviviente, la socia tiene 4 hijos ,la socia continua dedicándose a la negocio de venta de frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio9 el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son naranjas, manzanas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solcitan,al socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de naranjas al por mayor.
La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the “Ascended Virgin” Communal Bank, located in the province and  department of Cusco. She is 44 years old and lives with her life's companion. Maria has four children. 

She continues with her business of selling fruit as she has done for a long time.  Business is going well, thanks to her efforts every day. She sells oranges and apples, among other fruit, to all who request them. Maria wishes to continue with this work, and to go on helping her family in this manner.

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase more oranges at wholesale.

She is grateful for this offer of help and she promises to comply with her scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy oranges at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna has been operating a service-based business, providing motor transport in her community for over five years, aside from earning from her farm.  She had successfully repaid her previous loan, used for buying tires and she is now confident of the safety of the services. With her activities, she was able to support the needs of her children's education. 

Recently, Edna took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients and to improve her farm to have a more productive harvest. In her future, she wants to see her children's success and to have more improvements to their house, for a better living.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients and to improve her farm to have a more productive harvest.

loans.name: Atawa

texts.fr: ATAWA âgée de  33  ans est de nationalité Togolaise. ATAWA est  célibatairesansenfant habitant  à Lomé  dans le quartier adidogomé. elle est revendeuse  de produits d'alimentation générale et s’approvisionne 6 fois par mois au marché d’adidogomé. elle   a  un niveau d’étude secondaire. Elle désire augmenter le commerce donc elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter  son  commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
ATAWA, age 33, is a Togolese woman who is single without children. She lives in the district of Adidogomé, in Lomé. She is a reseller of grocery items, and she stocks up 6 times a month at the Adidogomé market. She has a secondary level education. 


Atawa is seeking a loan to bolster her commercial activity and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy 4 boxes of spaghetti and one jug of oil.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
As a married mother of 7 children, Celsa works hard to support her family.

Celsa has a fishing business in the Philippines, but she also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Celsa is borrowing 19,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation so she can purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Celsa has been sustaining her business with help from her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Analyn also earns additional income from working in a restaurant. 

Analyn has requested an 11,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation so she can buy ingredients for her food stall business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. 

Analyn hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to both expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 46 years old and married, with four children, one of whom is in school.

Jesusa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jesusa has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Jesusa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy, in greater quantity, candy and a variety of soft drinks and drinks made from natural ingredients.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Teresa, la socia tiene 3 hijos y es conviviente; la socia alterna sus actividades  diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, menestras entre otros.
La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Communal Bank 'Tres de Mayo'. The group is located in the Province of Cusco and the Department of Cusco.

The member is the Señora Teresa. She has 3 children, and lives with her husband. She alternates her daily housework with her business of selling food, which she has been doing for many years, and which does well thanks to the effort that she puts in to her business every day. She hopes to be able to continue working in this way to support her family. 

She asks for a loan to buy rice, oil, and lentils, among other things. 

She is grateful for the support that she has asked for, and she is committed to fulfilling the terms of the repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, lentils, among other things.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 26,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation so she can buy ingredients for her business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 10 years. However, she also earns income from running a general store.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of growing and expanding her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mardiana

texts.en:
Mardiana is a 34-year-old woman who is married to Sajidaula, her 34-year-old husband. Their marriage has been blessed with 3 children: Chandra, 11 years old, is an elementary school student; Siti is 3 years old; and Tri is a 2-month-old baby. 

Mardiana and her husband have been running a kiosk business, selling everyday items, since 2012. The initial capital of about 1,000,000 IDR to start the business came from their savings. Now their business has improved and done well. 

In addition, Mardiana has another business selling "sate" (pieces of roasted meat with peanut sauce or soy sauce). 

Currently, Mardiana needs more capital to purchase stock for their kiosk. Thus she is applying for an individual loan of 4,000,000 IDR from Tanaoba Lais Manekat Foundation to be able to source more products to stock their store.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her kiosk business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lydia works hard to support her family. She has a rice mill operator business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell fruits and farming rice. 

Lydia is borrowing PHP 50,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill, for her rice mill operator business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 35 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгуль успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Бактыгуль есть 1 корова и 10 овец. Также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 0,96 Га и 7,68 Га арендованной земли, где она выращивает ячмень для реализации. Ежемесячный доход Бактыгуль составляет 20,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота.  Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Baktygul has successfully repaid her prior loan having used it as intended. She is really grateful to Kiva and to all who has helped her with financing. At present Baktygul owns one cow and 10 sheep. She also owns 0.96 ha [2.3 acres] and leases 7.68 ha [19 acres] of land, where she grows barley for sale. Baktygul’s monthly revenue is 20,000 KGS. Inorder to develop her business further she has turned to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 45,000 KGS to buy animal feed. She plans to invest the resulting revenue in a further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock.

loans.name: Seyha's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Battambang province, Seyha is 25 years old and a father of a young child. To support his living, he grows rice and works as a construction worker. Moreover, he works for others for a fee, to earn extra income. 

This is Seyha's first time with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). He is a group leader of group three members. He will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees, to support his farmland. He hopes that he can improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees, to support his farmland.

loans.name: Llapanchispac Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Tadea, la socia es casada y tiene 05 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras como zanahorias, lechugas, tomates entre otros, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zanahorias, tomates entre otros.
  Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de cabinas de internet, negocio de restaurant, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de ropa.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Communal Bank 'Llapanchispac'. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is the Señora Tadea. She is married and has 5 children. She works at her business selling vegetables such as carrots, lettuces, tomatoes, among others. She has spent years working in this business, and it is doing well because of the effort that she puts into it every day. She also works raising small animals. She wants to be able to keep working in this way to continue supporting her family. 

She asks for a loan to buy carrots, tomatoes, among other vegetables.

The other members work in businesses such as internet cafes, restaurants, grocery stores and clothing stores. 

Señora Tadea is grateful to those who help her achieve her dream through this means, and she is committed to complying with the repayments over the established time.

loans.use: to buy carrots and tomatoes, among other things.

loans.name: Belkis De Los Angeles

texts.es: Belkis es una mujer emprendedora  exitosa tiene la edad de 35 años de edad, soltera, y madre de dos hijos quienes son su deseo de superación. Ella se dedica a la venta de lotería y ropa usada desde hace tres años, el crédito lo solicita para la inversión en la compra de raspaditas, cartones de loterías y pacas de ropa usada como sabanas, fundas, pantalones, chores, camisas, etc. Con el fin de satisfacer la demanda insatisfecha de su localidad.
texts.en:
Belkis is an enterprising and successful woman. She is 35 years old, single and the mother of two children, who are the reason she strives to succeed in life. 

She has been selling lottery tickets and used clothing for three years. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase "scratch-and-win" and other lottery tickets, as well as bales of used clothing such as pants, shorts, shirts, as well as sheets and pillowcases.This is in order to satisfy demand in the area where she lives.

loans.use: To purchase "scratch-and-win" and other lottery tickets, as well as bales of used clothing such as pants, shorts, shirts, as well as sheets and pillowcases.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Teresita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Loydith

texts.en:
Loydith is 39 years old. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years. She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, shampoo, soft drinks, noodles, etc. 

Loydith requested her second loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María de 31 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo que está estudiando 8° grado de educación básica, Su esposo es agricultor y la apoya con los gastos de la casa. Ella solo pudo estudiar hasta 6° de educación básica, tuvo que dejar la escuela para trabajar con sus 3 hermanas y ayudar a su padre a mantener el hogar.

María es comerciante, administra una tienda desde hace 3 años, aprendió por iniciativa propia al analizar con su esposo de que en la zona donde vivían no había tiendas cercanas y fue entonces cuando decidieron iniciar con esta actividad.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar dos estantes para poner sus productos y dos refrigeradoras, ya que la que tiene no funciona bien.

María sueña con tener su tienda bien abastecida, su esposo le aporta granos básicos y verduras porque él mismo las cultiva, pero también quiere vender muchas cosas más.
texts.en:
María is 31 years old, she is married and has one son who is studying in the 8th grade of basic education. Her husband is a farmer and supports her with the household expenses. She could only study until the 6th grade of basic education, she had to leave school to work with her three sisters and help her father to look after the house.

Maria is a shopkeeper, she has been running a shop for the last three years. She learned by her own initiative, by analysing along with her husband that in the area where they lived there were no shops nearby, and they decided to set up their own shop.

The loan will be used to buy two shelves for her products and two refrigerators, as the one she has is not working well.

Maria dreams of having her shop well stocked, her husband provides her with staple grains and vegetables because he grows them himself, but she would also like to stock many more items.

loans.use: to buy shelves and two refrigerators.

loans.name: Santos Alberto

texts.es: Don Santos en la actualidad necesita comprar muchos insumos y fertilizantes para su cosecha de Piña y Piña ya que dentro de algunos meses la plantación de Piña estará produciendo y desea antes de esto darle su optima limpieza y abonarla, este crédito lo solicita par ala compra de Abono, Agradece el apoyo que recibe de Kiva y Afodenic ya que para el ha sido de gran ayuda tanto en el bienestar familiar como en el laboral, sus condiciones han mejorado mucho.
texts.en:
Santos currently needs to buy a lot of supplies and fertilizers for his pineapple crop. His pineapple plantation will be producing fruit in a few months’ time, and before this he wants to make sure it is clean and fertilized. 

He is asking for this loan to buy fertilizer. He is grateful for the support he is receiving from Kiva and Afodenic, as for him it has been of great help as much for his family’s wellbeing as for his work, and his conditions have improved a lot.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Martin Diomedes

texts.es:
Martin de 74 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo que está acompañado y tiene su propio hogar. Solo pudo estudiar hasta 5° grado de educación básica debido a que sus padres por razones económicas no pudieron seguir dándole el estudio. Con él únicamente vive su esposa y solo ella depende de él.

Martin es comerciante, tiene 6 años de administrar una tienda, la idea surgió por iniciativa propia y después de analizar que no había ninguna tienda cercana en la zona. Martin también es agricultor, trabaja 20,000 mts cuadrados de terreno sembrados con maíz, además tiene 5 vacas en ordeño que le dan leche para vender y consumo propio.

El préstamo será invertido en la tienda, comprando productos de canasta básica y de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, papel higiénico, aceite, bebidas, golosinas y demás,  también necesita comprar unas láminas para reparar el techo de su casa.

Martin sueña con tener una tienda que le de muchas ganancias y así no tener que trabajar en la agricultura, pues a su avanzada edad, le cuesta mucho realizar ese esfuerzo físico.
texts.en:
Martín, 74, is married and has a son who's married and has his own home.  He only managed to study up to fifth grade because his parents didn't have the economic resources to keep on sending him to school.  Only his wife lives with him, and she's his only dependent.

Martín's a merchant.  He has run a store for six years.  The idea occurred to him on his own initiative after analyzing that there was no other nearby store in the area.  Martín is also a farmer.  He farms 20,000 square meters of land planted with corn and he has five dairy cows that provide milk for sale and for his own consumption.

He's going to invest the loan in the store and buy basic staples and necessities such as rice, sugar, beans, toilet paper, oil, beverages, snacks, and other products.  He also needs to buy some metal sheeting to repair the roof of his house.

Martín dreams of having a store that will yield a lot of profit so he won't have to work in agriculture, because the physical effort is very difficult at his advanced age.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, toilet paper, oil, beverages, snacks, and other products

loans.name: Heidy Arely

texts.es:
La señora Heidy es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio, se  levanta muy temprano para atender  a sus clientes y cuenta con una pulpería desde hace 4 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su casa de habitación.
Doña Heidy vende productos de la canasta básica y sus ventas las realiza todos los días de la semana, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra pollo, manteca, café, arroz, queso, azúcar, margarina, mantequilla, etc. espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su negocio y poder seguir apoyando a su familia con los gastos del hogar.
Doña Heidy sueña con poder tener un molino para maíz, porque en el lugar  donde vive no hay molinos cercanos.

Danlí, Honduras – Octubre del 2014
texts.en:
Heidy is an entrepreneurial woman and is dedicated to her business. She gets up very early to attend to her customers and has had her grocery store for 4 years, which is situated within her home.

She sells basic groceries and is open every day of the week. She is asking for the loan to buy chicken, lard, coffee, rice, cheese, sugar, margarine, butter etc. She hopes that this investment will allow her to forge ahead with her business and enable her to continue supporting her family with the household expenses.

Heidy dreams of having a milling machine for corn, as in the area where she lives there are no mills nearby.

Danlí, Honduras – October 2014

loans.use: to buy chicken, lard, coffee, rice, cheese, sugar, margarine, butter etc. for her business.

loans.name: Nordita

texts.en:
Nordita is 40 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like oil, soap, sugar, coffee, milk, canned goods, etc.

Nordita has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice gains and raising livestock.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like oil, soap, sugar, coffee, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Manchita

texts.en:
Manchita is 56 years old and married, with six children.

She earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines. Manchita is borrowing PHP 19,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Manchita has been pig-fattening for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a married woman with two children. Jean is 43 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jean has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jean requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Jean has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Jean would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling banana in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and tricycle transportation. Amalia is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of banana to sell to customers.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of banana to sell.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano tiene 37 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto a su esposa y sus 03 hijos. El domicilio del cliente se ubica en el Caserío Chumbicate, en la provincia de Cutervo, de la regíon Cajamarca. La comunidad donde vive el Luciana es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se conocen y dan buenas referencias tanto personales, como laborales. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Luciano es la de sembrar café variedad Catimor. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en mantenimiento del terreno cultivable(abonos, fertilizantes, entre otros). Esta inversión le permitirá mejorar sus ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Luciano is 37 years old and lives in his own home, built of rustic materials, with his wife and their three children. This is situated in Caserío Chumbicare in the Cutervo province of the Cajamarca region.

The community where Luciano lives is a small rural area where the inhabitants know each other and are known for their good personal qualities and being good workers. The activities in this area are basically agriculture, animal farming and commerce.

Luciano earns a living growing coffee of the Catimor variety. He will use the loan to invest in the maintenance of the cultivated land (organic and chemical fertilizers for example). This investment will allow him to increase his profits to improve his economic situation and thus invest in better living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his cultivated land (organic and chemical fertilizers for example).

loans.name: Phebie

texts.en:
Phebie is 47 years old and married with four children. 

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, milk, etc.

Phebie has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, milk, etc.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael de 69 años de edad, está acompañado, tiene 3 hijos y los todos están estudiando. Él solo pudo estudiar hasta 4° grado de educación básica. Con él solo viven su esposa y sus hijos y solo ellos dependen de él.

Rafael es carpintero, aprendió de su padre quien también era carpintero y le enseño a trabajar la madera desde los 12 años de edad. También es agricultor, trabaja 10,000 mts cuadrados de terreno y por lo general con maíz.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar fertilizantes, pesticidas y herbicidas para lograr sacar sus cultivos, porque el dinero que tenía lo invirtió en la elaboración de unos muebles que después va a vender. Rafael espera obtener la cosecha esperada y piensa seguir apoyado de la institución para proyectos futuros.
texts.en:
Rafael, 69, is married and has three children, all of them in school.  He was only able to study up to fourth grade.  His wife and children live with him and are his only dependents.

Rafael's a carpenter.  He learned the work from his father, who also was a carpenter and taught Rafael to work with wood from the age of 12.  He's also a farmer.  He farms 10,000 square meters of land, generally with corn.

He's going to use the loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and herbicide to harvest his crops, because he invested the money he had in making some pieces of furniture he's going to sell later.

Rafael hopes to get the harvest he expects, and he plans to keep on receiving support from the institution for future projects.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and herbicide

loans.name: Abra  Pauline

texts.fr: Demeurant à Lomé précisément au quartier d’adidogomé,  PAULINE est âgée de34ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle fait le commerce desbananes  plantains qu’elle achète au  marché d'Assiyéyé.   PAULINE  s’approvisionne 3 fois par mois au marché d’asiyéyé. elle habite dans une maison en  location dont le toit est en tôle, avec  un niveau d’étude primaire; ayant mesuré la lourdeur de la responsabilité qui lui fait face,  PAULINE  sollicite un microcrédit pour augmenter  son activité de revenu afin de participer à la charge du foyer et aider son mari dans le dépenses du foyer, et aussi avoir beaucoup plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Pauline, age 34, is the married mother of four children. She lives in the district of Adidogomé, in Lomé, where she resides in a rental unit with sheet metal roofing. She sells plantains, which she buys at the market of Assiyéyé three times per month. She has a primary level education. 


Aware of the burden of her responsibilities, she is seeking a loan to bolster her commercial activity. This will allow her to contribute to her household and help her husband to cover their expenses. It will also help to increase her profits significantly.

loans.use: to buy 5 bunches of plantain bananas.

loans.name: Reun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Kampong Speu province, Reun is a mother of four children. 

Currently she can earn income to support her living expenses via rice cropping. She earns about 28,000 KHR per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is the group leader in this group of four. 

Reun will spend her loan portion on buying a water filter, and she hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions by having clean water to use.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Ronela

texts.en:
Ronela is from Ozamiz City. She is 30 years old and married, with two children. She grows and sells seaweed, aside from their fishing business. She earns a good income from business that enables her to support her children's education. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, used for buying seaweed seedlings and twine. 

Ronela is now taking a new loan to buy new fishing nets to be used for fishing. She hopes to improve the business as well as to be able to repair their house for her family's safe and comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets to be used for fishing.

loans.name: Sokim

texts.en:
Sokim is 30 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She lives in Takeo Province of Cambodia. She is a garment factory worker in a private factory, which she has been doing for four years. She earns $4.00 per day, on average.  

Sokim wants to improve the general living conditions of her family by having a latrine to use. At this time, there is no latrine in her house. Sokim requested a loan from HKL, which she will use to build a latrine. By doing so, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help lessen environmental deterioration.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Rodela

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Rodela works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling crabs. Rodela is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional baskets of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Rodela has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional baskets of fish to sell.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Candelaria is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Candelaria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en:
Navy, a local resident from Kampong Speu province, is 30 years old and a mother of two schoolchildren. She secures the basic needs of the family via rice cropping. 

For Navy, this is her first time with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of eight to get a new loan. As a group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family has clean water to use.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia used her previous loan for 15,000 PHP to buy fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her doormat-making business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 
 
Lilia requested another loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed for weaving doormats. Doormats are a household item in every Filipino's home where people can wipe the bottom of their shoes. It is changed regularly for a different look. She earns a minimum of 6,000 PHP a month for selling doormats. She also sells fruits on weekends and earns at least 10,000 PHP a month. 

Lilia hopes to be able to expand her business. She hopes to give her family a good future through all her hard work.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials for her doormat-making business.

loans.name: Ngoeurn

texts.en:
Ngoeurn, who is 52 years old, lives in a community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has three children, one is a student and two are garment factory workers. He is a rice farmer on a small rice farmland, located near his house. So far, he has been in this career for 26 years. On average, he can generate earnings of USD 2 per day.
 
Ngoeurn wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

He is thankful for the loan granted through Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 29 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rona is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetable seeds and fertilizers.

Rona has been farming vegetables for eight years and also earns additional income from selling bananas and vegetables, and motorcycle transport services.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetable seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ruthly

texts.en:
Ruthly is a hardworking entrepreneur who operates a rice grinder services business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Ruthly requested a loan from NWTF for 24,000 PHP, which she will use to buy an additional rice grinder machine for her rice grinder services business. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a rice grinder machine

loans.name: Uor's Group

texts.en: Living in rural area in Kampong Speu Province, Uor is a mother of two school age children. To support her living, she grows rice as her main source of the income and earns her about 30,000 KHR per day. This is the first cycle for Uor with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner). In a seven-member group, she is a group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family can have clean water to support their healthy living.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Sokea's Group

texts.en:
Sokea, 20, lives with her husband and two children in a rural village of the Koh Sotin District, Cambodia. Both of her children are too young to go to school. To feed the family, Sokea earns a living as a farmer who has been growing cassava, while her husband is a house construction worker. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day. 

Sokea is on her first cycled with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy piglets to raise in order to earn additional income for this family. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income for supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Cheu's Group

texts.en:
