A resident living in Kampong Speu province, Cheu is 50 years old and a mother of six children. Nowadays, she can earn income to improve her living condition via rice cropping, and this earns her about 11,000 KHR per day. 

This is Cheu’s first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader of a group of three, she will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. 

She hopes that her family has clean water to use and her farmland can have a good yield.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van, who is 49 years old, lives in a community in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has two dependent children and two married children. To make a living, he opens a stall and sells rice with food. His stall is located in front of one garment factory. So far, he has been in this career for 14 years. On average, he can generate an earning of USD 3 per day. 

Van wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 50 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Lucena has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food and fruit vending. Lucena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Kon's Group

texts.en:
Kon is 38 years old and married with five children. Her family lives in a village in the Thong district of Kampong Spue province and she and her husband earn a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current businesses earn her about 20,000 KHR per day.
 
Kon is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. Kon, who is the leader, will use her portion to build a latrine for use by her family. She hopes to have a clean latrine for use by her family.

loans.use: to build a latrine for use by her family

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Khemrin

texts.en: Khemrin is a 20-year-old student taking an IT major at the university in the city. He is from a village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Because of a lack of financial support, Khemrin would like to request a loan to pay his university fees for the third and fourth year. With this loan, he will graduate successfully with a skill. To build his future, he is going to find a good job. He also wants to own a proper house.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is a widowed woman with nine children. She is 68 years old and eight of her children are still in school.

Marianita is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for six years. Marianita has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

In the future, Marianita would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Maria Evelyn

texts.en:
Maria Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling purchase order cards in the Philippines.

Maria Evelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Maria Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, maize, baking flour, etc.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika lives in Danghara district. She is 41 years old. Malika is divorced from her husband and she brought up her daughter alone. She endured hard times and raised her only daughter. Her daughter is 19 years old. She graduated from medical school like her mother. Malika is also a nurse by profession. During 17 years of her life, she worked in this profession. Malika wants to ensure her daughter has a good future.
 
For the last three years, Malika has been engaged in sewing women's clothes. She provides her services at home. Malika likes her new profession. She spends a good time at the sewing machine. For sewing professionally and increasing the number of customers, Malika needs to improve the quality of her work. So she wants to buy an overlock machine for the seams on clothes. For this reason, she is asking for a loan. She is going to buy fabric and sewing supplies with the rest of the money.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock machine and fabrics

loans.name: Ma. Emelda

texts.en:
Ma. Emelda is a widowed woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Emelda is 48 years old, and three of her children are still in school.

Ma. Emelda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients and materials for her food production business.

In the future, Ma. Emelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 51 years old. She is married and has four children who are all in school.

Marichu is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marichu has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Marichu has been raising pigs for 12 years now and has borrowed from NWTF five times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Marichu would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: Ma. Fe is 51 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Ma. Fe works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, sugar, soy sauce, salt, seasonings, etc. to sell. Ma. Fe has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Samon's Group

texts.en:
Samon, 55, is married with six children. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Kampong Speu province’s Phnom Srouch district. The main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice. She has been running her business for 37 years, earning about KHR 22,000 per day. She is able to save about KHR 12,000 each day. 

This is Samon’s first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy a water filter for her family to use. She hopes that this loan will enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a water filter for her family to use.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Sreymuch's Group

texts.en:
A young mother of one child living in Kampong Speu province, Sreymuch is 19 years old. For her living, she grows rice as her single source of her income. She can earn income, about 10,000 KHR per day, to support her family’s condition. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to buy a water filter. She hopes that her house can have clean water to use.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn, 59 years old, is a married woman who lives in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a mother of two children, one is a rice farmer and one is a garment factory worker. She is an active farmer on a small rice farmland, which is located near her house. By growing rice and selling the crop to local dealers, she can make a decent income to support her family. So far, she has been involved in this career for 34 years. 

Sorn wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans, cheese, tomatoes, cabbage, oil, salt, etc.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia has been operating her retail store for many years and was able to sustain the business. She had to support her family, and paid for some home improvements for a comfortable living. 

She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for the business. She is now aiming for an increase of sales, and with this, she took a new loan to purchase grains and livestock feeding supplies to sell in addition to her inventory. 

She hopes to expand her store by making some renovations for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase grains and livestock feeding supplies to sell in addition to her inventory.

loans.name: Malo

texts.en: Malo works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store. Malo has been in this business for six years now. Malo would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: José Joel

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, sus estudios realizados fueron hasta sexto grado, esta acompañado tienen un hijo de cuatro meces de edad, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domesticos y a cuidar los animales que tienen en casa como gallinas, patos y un cerdo que posee.

José lleva 8 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, esto lo aprendio de su padre, quien fue el que le enseño este trabajo donde él cultiva no le queda tan retirado, ya que le queda a unos dos kilometros de su casa y viaja caminando ya que es el unico medio que él tiene para transportarse.

 Con el prestamo que esta solicitando comprara unos muebles para la casa y unos pliegos de lamina que necesita, ya que en tiempo de invierno se le moja la casa ya que tiene rota la lamina. 

Su mayor deseo es que su esposa y su familia tenga buena salud, ademas de esto que su familia tenga lo mejor siempre y con el tiempo poder comprar un terreno para tener un lugar propio donde ir a vivir.
texts.en:
José is a 28 year old who went to school until the sixth grade. He is married with one child who is four months old. His wife is a home maker and she takes care of the animals they have at home such as hens, ducks and a pig.

José has worked as a farmer for the past eight years, which he learned from his father, who taught him in the area where the farm was not as isolated. The farm is located about two kilometers from his house and he gets there by walking since it is his only mode of transportation.

The loan he is requesting will allow him to buy some furniture for the house and some pieces of sheeting that he needs, since the house gets wet in the winter because the current sheeting is broken.

His biggest dream is that his wife and his family have good health. He also hopes that his family always has the best and that with time, they are able to buy land to have their own place to go and live.

loans.use: to buy some furniture for the house and some pieces of sheeting that he needs, since the house gets wet in the winter because the current sheeting is broken.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a kind, polite and nice person at the age of 36 years. She lives in Bohtar District. She has a small family. Zarina lives with her mother and daughter. Zarina's mother is a pensioner and her daughter is a high school student. Zarina provides for the family herself. She works as a seamstress. 
    
Zarina spent a lot of time gathering capital to renovate their house. She began the repairs, but could not calculate the costs and has run out of money. Now it is necessary to complete the repairs before the coming winter. Currently, Zarina sees only one way out. This is getting a loan. Zarina sincerely hopes for your help.

loans.use: to finish repairs on her house before the coming winter.

loans.name: Jose Santiago

texts.es:
José de 40 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 16 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad estudiar debido a que cuando apenas tenía 10 años de edad, su padre los abandono  y su madre tuvo que trabajar muy duro lavando y planchando ajeno para mantenerlo a él y a su hermano, después ella se enfermó y él tuvo que trabajar a los 14 años de edad.

José es agricultor desde los 14 años, tuvo que aprender para ayudar a su familia, cultiva maíz y ajonjolí, necesita el crédito para cosechar el ajonjolí, es tiempo de cosecharlo y si se espera demasiado perderá gran parte de la cosecha porque la semilla se cae.

José sueña con aumentar el área de siembra y con las ganancias dar el estudio a sus hijos y mantener a su familia para que sufran lo que él sufrió en su niñez.
texts.en:
José, 40 years of age, is married and has two children ages 19 and 16. He didn't have the opportunity to study, since when he was just 10 years old, his father left them. His mother had to work very hard taking in washing and ironing to support him and his brother. Then she got sick, and he had to work at the age of 14.

José has been a farmer since he was 14. He had to learn in order to help his family. He grows corn and sesame, and he needs the loan to harvest the sesame. It is the season to harvest it, and if he waits too long he will lose a large portion of his crop because the seeds will fall.

José dreams of increasing the area where he plants, and using the profits to send his children to school and to support his family so they don't suffer what he went through in his childhood.

loans.use: to harvest sesame

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es:
Milagro de 36 años de edad está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 15 y 12 años de edad y los 3 están estudiando, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar porque sus padres no tenían la capacidad económica para mandarla a la escuela por lo que no le dieron importancia a su estudio. Su esposo es albañil y ambos trabajan para sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Milagro es comerciante, tienda una pequeña tienda en su casa, también vende tamales y yuca, esto lo aprendió trabajando con su madre desde que era muy pequeña. Por ser una persona muy emprendedora, aprendió a leer y escribir gracias a programa de alfabetización que llegaron a su comunidad y ella no dejo de aprovechar, gracias a eso es mucho más fácil administrar su tienda.

El préstamo será invertido en la tienda, comprando productos de canasta básica y de primera necesidad para abastecerla, ya que pierde mucha clientela por no tener el producto que le demandan. Comprará condimentos, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, arroz, frijoles, maíz, maicillo, 
Golosinas, bebida entre otros para tener una tienda repleta de productos.

Milagro sueña con una tienda estable que ofrezca todo lo necesario para el consumo del hogar y que sus clientes siempre se vayan satisfechos.
texts.en:
Milagro is 36 years old, married, and has three children ages 18, 15 and 12. All three are in school. Milagro didn't have the chance to study because her parents didn't have the economic resources to send her to school, so they didn't make her schooling a priority. Her husband is a builder and they both work to advance their children.

Milagro is a business owner; she has a small store in her house, and she also sells tamales and yucca. She learned this from working with her mother since she was very small. Since she is a very enterprising person, she learned to read and write, thanks to a literacy program that came to her community and of which she took full advantage. Thanks to that, it is much easier for her to run her store. 

The loan will be invested in the store, to buy basic necessities and staples to stock it, since she loses a lot of customers because of not having the product they want. She will buy seasonings, oil, sugar, toilet paper, rice, beans, corn, sorghum, sweets, drinks, and other items so that she can have a store brimming with products.

Milagro dreams of having a stable store that will offer all the necessary items for household needs, and that her clients will always go away satisfied.

loans.use: to buy seasonings, oil, sugar, toilet paper, rice, beans, corn, sorghum, sweets, drinks, and other items

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and lives in Misamis Occidental with her family. She earns a better income from her transportation business and she was able to support her child's education. She also bought some home appliances out of her generated income. 

Her previous loan was used to buy new tires for her vehicle and it was successfully repaid. 

To make her services more comfortable and safe, Jocelyn recently took a new loan to purchase spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle and to pay for repair costs.She plans to used her profit to buy a sidecar for improvement of her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle and to pay for repair costs.

loans.name: Marcela Beatriz

texts.es: Marcela tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 11 años y 7 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida por medio de la venta de productos por catalogo. Marcela es muy dedicada y responsable. Cuenta con muchos clientes quienes cada día demandan aun más sus productos. Marcela desea invertir en su negocio en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos como: cremas, lociones, desodorantes, cosméticos, champo, etc. Espera poder mejorar sus ventas y de esta forma dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Marcela is 28 years old and lives in her own home with her two children ages 11 and 7. She earns a living by selling catalog products. Marcela is very hard-working and responsible. She has many customers who each day ask for even more of her products. 

Marcela wishes to invest in her business by purchasing, in greater quantity, products such as creams, lotions, deodorants, cosmetics, shampoo, etc. She hopes to be able to improve her sales and in this way provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy creams, lotions, deodorants, cosmetics, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza has been operating her retail store for many years and was able to sustain the business. She supported her family and bought some home improvements for comfortable living. She also provided and supported the education of her children. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business.

She is now aiming to increase her sales, and with this in mind, she has become engaged in another business selling Palamig (refreshment) in the surrounding villages. She has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, cheese and other flavors needed for her Palamig. She hopes to cater to the needs of her customers and increase her income as well.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, cheese and other flavors needed for her Palamig (refreshing beverages)

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 46 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Melchora has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients for her food production business, like meat, fish, spices, and noodles.

Melchora has been in this business for six years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business, like meat, fish, spices, and noodles.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en: Melodina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Melodina has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. Melodina has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en: Sharifan is age 49; she is mother of two children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband works and sells dairy products like milk, curd, and butter. He owns a small dairy farm consisting of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his earnings from the milk sales. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He is in need of one buffalo to increase his income through the milk sale business. So, Sharifan requested a loan. In this way she can support to her husband’s business.  She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance in her husband's milk sale business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia has repaid her previous loan which she used for her sari-sari store. She also has been operating a market stand for years that she earns well from.  Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially those of her children, so Lilia and her husband have had to work hard to increase their earnings with the goal of providing their children with a better education. 

Lilia is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan to purchase more quantities of meat products and other items needed to expand her inventory. She expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Lilia hopes to grow her business, as she desires to become a successful entrepreneur someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for meat and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Pheara

texts.en:
Pheara is a 24-year-old married garment factory worker with a small child. She lives in Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. Her husband is a 33-year-old carpenter. Together, they can earn approximately $11 per day.

Now Pheara would like to request a loan to buy a motor for her brother to commute to work. This loan will help her have enough money to buy a motor for her brother. In the future, she wants her husband to have his own business, build a new house, and help her child to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motor for her brother to commute to work

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own rug-making business for years, and she earns well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She has had to work hard, with the determination to have a better income, to provide her children with better education. 

To improve her profit, Cristy would like to apply for a new loan. With PHP 8,000, she could already purchase more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Cristy hopes to grow her business as well as improve the living condition of her family and give her children better education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of their work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her rug-making business

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
María Rosario tiene 59 años de edad, su estado civil es casada, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge en el distrito de La Matanza. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente debido a que en lo que respecta al negocio u a otra actividad que se desarrolla sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza María Rosario es a la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza y crianza de animales. La actividad la realiza desde hace 20 años en el distrito de La Matanza. El destino del crédito será para realizar la compra de materia prima(maíz) y compra de activo fijo(mesas,sillas,ollas), así como para el arreglo de local de atención para poder mejorar el servicio a sus clientes, dicho local esta ubicado en la parte delantera de su domicilio. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Rosario is 59 years old and married.  She lives in her own house with her husband in the La Matanza district.  Life in the district goes on peacefully.  The inhabitants’ businesses are agriculture, livestock, and raising animals.  Her community is located in the La Matanza district, Morropón province, Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.

María Rosario’s business activity is selling ‘chicha de jora’ [traditional corn liquor] and beer and raising animals.  She has been engaged in these business activities for 20 years in the La Matanza district.

The loan will be to buy raw material (corn) and to buy fixed assets (tables, chairs, pots).  This is to fix up the place in order to be able to improve her customer service.  This place is located in the front part of her house.  This will allow her to, in the short term, improve profits, increase her earnings, and, therefore, improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw material (corn) and to buy fixed assets (tables, chairs, pots).

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of 11 children from Concepcion, Iloilo. For the past 27 years, Mae and her husband's fishing business has provided them with the income that they need. 

Mae now wants to expand their fishing venture but she lacks the capital to do so. She has requested a loan from CEVI to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets. This will help both Mae and her husband to augment their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Mae believes that their business will improve soon and that it will generate more income. She wants to save more money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes, 41 years old, has a live-in partner and four children, all currently in school. Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

For the past 4 years, Lourdes has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as chocolate drink, cereals, coffee, shampoo, detergent, soap, cooking oil, noodles, etc. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of these items. In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as chocolate drink, cereals, coffee, shampoo, detergent, soap, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 3 years, she has operataed a food vending business in the Philippines. Merlyn has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of chicharon (fried pork rinds), etc. to sell. Merlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of chicharon, etc. to sell

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.es:
Bonifacia de 50 años de edad, es madre de 7 hijos esta casada, y junto a su esposo van saliendo adelante. Ella se levanta desde muy temprano para ir a trabajar, su esposo tambien colabora con los gastos del hogar y juntos han logrado mucho, de sus 7 hijos solo 3 viven con ella de los cuales 2 trabajan y uno estudia.

Ella se levanta a las cinco de la mañana para tomar el autobus para llegar a su destino.

Ella necesita el credito para comprar materiales para empezar a construir su casa, ya que en este momento no tiene buenas condiciones de vivienda. ella espera que mejore su calidad de vida y ofrecer un mejor hogar a sus hijos su principal necesidad es construir su vivienda y lograr asi tener una vivienda digna.

los sueños de ella es que sus hijos siempre esten bien apoyandose y que se esfuersen porque esta convencida que lo que se propone en la vida se puede cumplir y asi salir adelante.
texts.en:
Bonifacia, 50, is married and the mother of seven children.  Only three of their seven children live with them; two of them work and the other one is in school.

Bonifacia and her husband are getting ahead.  She gets up very early, at 5 in the morning, to go to work; she takes the bus to get to her destination.  Her husband also helps with the household expenses, and together they have achieved a lot.

Bonifacia needs the loan to buy supplies to start building her house, because currently she doesn't have good living conditions.  She hopes to improve her quality of life and offer her children a better home.  Her main need is to build her house so she can have a decent home.

Her dreams are for her children to always be well and support each other, and for them to work hard.  She's convinced that one can achieve what one sets out to do in life, and so get ahead.

loans.use: to buy supplies to start building her house

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle, 37 years old, has a live-in partner and three children, all currently in school. Michelle works very hard to provide for them. For the past 4 years, Michelle has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as noodles, cereals, coffee, fabric conditioners, detergent, soap, shampoo, etc. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more of these items. In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as noodles, cereals, coffee, fabric conditioners, detergent, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.en:
Rukhshona is 26 years old. She lives in a small town named Tursunzoda. 

Rukhshona is divorced from her husband and now she lives with her parents. Also her brother lives with them. Rukhshona returned home to her parents and does not want to be a burden. Rukhshona is engaged in household chores and, at the same time, manages to earn money. 

Rukhshona is able to cut and sew women's dresses. She takes orders for dresses at home. Rukhshona has sewn for about six years. She likes to work in this field and she wants to continue this activity. 

Now, Rukhshona needs to buy a new, computerized sewing machine because her current machine is completely outdated. Rukhshona needs to buy a machine in a short period of time, but she does not have enough money to purchase one, so she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cattle.

loans.name: Union  Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Unión Por El Progreso” y está formado por 07 socios solidarios y emprendedores. Rosa de 45 años de edad es casada con 03 hijos independientes. Rosa se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir. Producto a su constante esfuerzo ha logrado comprarse sus herramientas de trabajo. El crédito que solicitó es para la compra de hilos, telas y botones. Su mayor deseo es contar con un puesto de venta en el emporio comercial de gamarra. El grupo “Unión Por El Progreso” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Rosa es la tercera del lado derecho y viste casaca negro.
texts.en:
This is the group “Unión Por El Progreso” [Union for Progress], and it is made up of 7 supportive and entrepreneurial members. 

Rosa is 45 years old and is married with three independent children. Rosa makes a living making clothing. Thanks to her persistent efforts, she has managed to buy herself work tools. The loan that she has requested is for the purchase of thread, fabric, and buttons. Her greatest wish is to have a stand in the Gamarra shopping center. 

The group "Unión Por El Progreso" is grateful to the Kiva lenders for making this loan possible. Rosa is the third from the right and wearing a black coat.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, and buttons.

loans.name: Nanie

texts.en:
Nanie is thankful that she was granted an 8,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed for her sewing business. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

Nanie would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan to buy more fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business. Filipinos prepare quite early for the Christmas season. They love to decorate their homes as early as the first week of December. Nanie has to meet her customers' demands for new curtains, bed sheets and other home trappings for Christmas. Nanie earns a minimum of PHP 600 a day. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Nanie hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a bright future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa, a 42-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has been operating a general store business in the Philippines for six years.

Nimfa is requesting a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her store. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia, who is married, works hard to support her family. She has had a food vending business in the Philippines for 10 years now.

Portia has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as meat, fish, noodles, vegetables, etc. for her enterprise. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, noodles, vegetables, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 46 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 6 years, Nida has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as body spray, toothpaste, canned goods, pasta, seasonings, detergent, soap, etc. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of these items. Nida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as body spray, toothpaste, canned goods, pasta, seasonings, detergent, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en: James really appreciates his previous loan that improved his living standards and expanded his business. He is still working hard to improve his life further, and so is requesting another loan to purchase more material and sewing equipment for his tailoring business.

loans.use: to purchase more material and sewing equipment

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina, de 35 años y madre de dos hijos, aprendió a ser chofer mientras vivía con sus padres en su comunidad y al casarse  con sus ahorros compró un vehículo y se dedicó a este servicio público de transporte que le ha generado un ingreso económico favorable para su familia y apoyar a su comunidad para el desarrollo.

Ella ha solicitado un préstamo para darle el mantenimiento requerido para su vehículo y poder servir de esa manera a su ciudad, además que su actividad laboral es una fuente de ingresos para su familia.

Dentro de sus metas es lograr comprar otro vehículo y ampliar su negocio.  Y como resultado darles un mejor panorama económico a sus hijos y educación para que sean buenos profesionales en la vida. 

Mientras los pasajeros de suben y bajan en su vehículo llevan sus propias vidas como Catarina la suya hacia el desarrollo en un futuro menor y a una condición de vida favorable.
texts.en:
Catarina, aged 35, is the mother of two children. She learned to be a driver while she was living with her parents at their community. After she got married, she bought a vehicle with her savings and started to make a living offering public transportation services. This business has generated a good income for her family and to support her community's development.

She has requested a loan to give her car the required maintenance and, in this way, be able to serve her city. In addition, her work is a source of income for her family.

Among her goals are being able to buy another vehicle and expanding her business. As a result of reaching these goals, she will give her children a better economic outlook and education so that they become good professionals.

As passengers get on and off her vehicle, they lead their lives—as does Catarina—towards the development of a better future and favourable living conditions.

loans.use: to maintain her vehicle.

loans.name: Entrepreneurship Grp Group

texts.en:
Isaac is a businessman who manages a retail shop selling different items. He has three years experience in this enterprise, working from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily. Isaac is able to make a very good monthly profit. He dreams of going further with his business, to the extent of selling at wholesale prices. Isaac is 37 years old and married.

Isaac is now at Tujijenge Tanzania, seeking financial support to capture the rising demand at his shop. He wants to replenish his shop with plenty of products: sacks of rice, buckets of cooking oil, sacks of maize and baking flour, sweets and others. This is Isaac's first credit request and he promises to repay this loan successfully. Isaac will share this loan with his group "ENTREPRENEURSHIP", consisting of five members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy shop stock: rice, cooking oil, maize, baking flour, sweets, candles and other items.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a dried fish vendor from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has eight children. Ruth has sold dried fish for more than 15 years. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Ruth wants to expand her business and has decided to take out a loan from CEVI to buy more fish for drying. This will enable Ruth to sell more dried fish to the market for a good price. Ruth dreams of a better future with her family. She also wants to save money to finance her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more fish for drying

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, a 45-year-old resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines, is married to Feliciano, a businessman, and they have three children. She manages the household while operating her business, working hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her children to school. 

Lilia has operated a general store for 14 years already. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo,  Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also buys "taho" (cooked soya beans) from a wholesaler, selling it at a profit by the cup.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 2000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store, Lilia is requesting a Php 25000 loan to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery items. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Lilia hopes to maintain and grow her business so they can have a better life. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years, and earns additional income from a general store. Patricia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and to pay electric bills for her business.  

Patricia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to pay electric bills

loans.name: Dúo Los Claveles Group

texts.es:
DUO LOS CLAVELES
El dúo los Claveles está integrado por las señoras Valentina ella es originaria de Sumpango, tiene su propio negocio que es la elaboración de fajas típicas así como también se dedica a la crianza de pollos todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para poder realizar sus labores diarias que es la alimentación de los pollos que tiene, luego se dedica a tejer fajas típicas , ella necesita capital para poder invertir en sus tejidos es el tercer crédito que solicita y promete pagar puntualmente en cada pago correspondiente, ya que sabe que trabajar con kiva es de gran ayuda para ella y para su familia.
texts.en:
The group Dúo los Claveles [Carnation Duo]

The duo includes Valentina who is originally from Sumpango and has her own business that produces traditional woven belts. She also makes a living raising chickens. Every day, she wakes up very early to be able to carry out her daily tasks.  This includes feeding the chickens that she has, then working to weave the traditional belts. 

She needs capital to be able to invest in her weaving. This is the third loan that she has requested and promises to make each payment punctually, since she knows that working with Kiva is a great help to her and her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make and sell traditional woven textiles

loans.name: Zamirkul

texts.ru: Замиркул успешно погасила предыдущий кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Замиркул есть 2 коровы и 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Замиркул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец для увеличения поголовья, 20,000 сом (KGS) будет потрачено на покупку сена для скота. Доходы от кредита Замиркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, она хочет накопить средства на покупку автомобиля для ее семьи.
texts.en: Zamirkul has successfully repaid her previous loan, using it as directed. She is grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone, who had helped her with the financing. Today, Zamirkul's business contains 2 cows and 10 sheep. The monthly profit amounts to 5,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Zamirkul requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 20 sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount, 20,000 som (KGS) out of which will be spent on buying hay for the livestock. Zamirkul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock quantities and wants to save money to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep and hay for livestock

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Norma works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Norma also earns additional income from a general store and direct sales of Avon and personal collection products. Norma is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy domestic appliances to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.name: Yawa  Déla

texts.fr: DELA âgée de  30  ans est de nationalité Togolaise.  DELA est  mariée  et mère de 1enfant  scolarisé, habite à Lomé  dans le quartier d’adidogomé. elle est revendeuse  de maïs et s’approvisionne 3 fois par mois par livraison à domicile d'un grossiste. elle   a  un niveau secondaire. Dans le souci de réduire ces couts d’approvisionnement  et d’augmenter le résultat, elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter  son  commerce.   DELA ne disposant pas de foyer à gaz et les moyens nécessaires pour prendre soins des enfants, ce crédit sera très utiles au bien être d’Elodie et de toute la famille.
texts.en:
DELA, age 30, is a Togolese woman and married mother of one child who goes to school. She lives in the district of Adidogomé, in Lomé. She is a reseller of maize, and she stocks up 3 times a month through home delivery by a wholesaler. She has a secondary level education. 


Looking to reduce purchasing costs and to increase profits, she is seeking a loan to bolster her activity. 


Since Dela doesn’t have a gas-burning fireplace and lacks the means necessary to fully take care of her child, this loan will prove very helpful in ensuring the well-being of Elodie and the whole family.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of maize.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 58 años de edad, el es una hombre emprendedor y decidido para poder superar en la vida, el no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino el alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, el tiene tres hijos que mantener el primero ya trabaja para ayudar en los recursos económicos de su familia y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad. 
	
El obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de bananos en la comunidad donde el vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 25 años, el realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para el mantenimiento de banano, ya que para el es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de bananos produzcan frutos de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de el es la siembra de más plantas de bananos y ver crecer a sus hijos en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Manuel, 58, is an enterprising man who is determined to improve in life.  He doesn't give up because of life's obstacles; instead, he achieves all his goals and dreams.  He has three children to support.  The oldest is already working to help with the family finances, and the other two are excellent students in the school in the community.

Manuel earns his income growing banana plants in the community where he lives.  His parents taught him this work 25 years ago.  He sells his own crops in the market and in the areas surrounding his community.  That way he has an income to improve his family's living conditions.
	
He's going to use the loan to take care of his banana plants, because it's very important for his plants to produce top-quality fruit so he doesn't lose his customers.

One of his greatest desires is to plant more banana trees and see his children grow in their education and become professionals in life.

loans.use: to take care of his banana plants

loans.name: G.s Esfuerzo Teupasenti Group

texts.es:
La Joven Iris es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio propio que es venta de ropa interior, productos de catalogo y cobertores, cuenta con 1 año de experiencia de dedicarse a su negocio y sus ventas las realiza de forma ambulante todos los días de la semana.
Iris solicita el préstamo para la compra de blúmeres, braseares, bóxer, cobertores de cama, etc. espera que de las ganancias que obtenga mejore un poco su calidad de vida y a su vez seguir apoyando a su familia.
Iris sueña con poder expandir mas su negocio, esta solicitando el préstamo de forma grupal y al igual que sus compañeras de grupo esperan que esta inversión les ayude en sus negocios.
Doña Ercilia se dedica a la cría y venta de carne de cerdo, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años.
Doña Rosalinda se dedica a la venta de tortillas y venta de charamuscas, actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años.

 Danlí , Honduras -Octubre del 2014
texts.en:
The young Iris is a hard-working woman. She is dedicated to her business. She sales underwear, catalog products, and bedspreads. She has been doing this for a year. She sells her products in the streets, every day of the week.

Iris is requesting the loan to buy panties, bras, boxer shorts, bedspreads, etc. She hopes to improve her life thanks to the profits. She also wants to keep helping her family. 

Her dream is to expand her business. She is requesting this loan as a group loan. She and the other members hope this investment will help them with their business. 

Ercilia raises and sells pork. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Rosalinga sells tortillas and charamuscas (frozen juice or coconut milk). She has been doing that for 6 years.

Danli, Honduras - October 2014

loans.use: to buy panties, bras, boxer shorts, beadspreads, etc, for her business.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of eight children, Marlene works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Marlene is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like dozens of eggs, sugar, soap, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy addtional items like dozens of eggs, sugar, soap, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 54 years old and has two children who are still in school. Susan has a live-in female partner with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Susan has a buy and sell spare parts business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of spare parts to sell.

Susan has been in this business for six years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of spare parts to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with three children who works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear clothing business and  earns additional income in a general store. Susan requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

Susan has sustained her business through her previous 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Sabira

texts.ru: Сабира, 54 года, замужем, воспитала 3 детей. Сабира в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1984 года начала заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес с покупки 2 овец, благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Сабира имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы, 1 лошадь и 10 овец. На земельном участке мерою 1,50 Га она выращивает ячмень, вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Сабира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита Сабира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее хозяйства.
texts.en: Sabira is 54 years old, married and raised 3 children. To provide the primary source of income for her family, Sabira has been involved in raising livestock and farming since 1984. Having started this business with a purchase of 2 sheep, today, thanks to hard work, Sabira has 2 cows, 1 horse and 10 sheep in her business. She grows barley on 1.50 hectares of land. The business yields a monthly profit of 10,000 som (KGS). After deciding that this is a profitable business, Sabira requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a dairy cow. Sabira plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to generate more profit and increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima has operated her business for more than 10 years and she earns a good salary. She has a big family and it requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her grandchildren. She works hard and is determined to earn a better income to provide her grandchildren with a better education.

In order to increase sales, Fatima requests 45,000 PHP to purchase additional clothing items and home products to sell. These include more quantities of garments, underwear, chairs, pails, dippers and other supplies needed in her business. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Fatima hopes to increase her inventory and product sales. She also wants to help save  for her grandchildren and give them a better future. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work  and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 
	
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase clothing items and home products.

loans.name: Zarnigor

texts.en:
Zarnigor is the mother of three children. She has two daughters and one son. Her husband works in Micro credit Deposit Organization. Zarnigor is a nurse and has worked for 10 years at the hospital of her village. She is 40 years old. 
 
Her elder daughter is a student who studies in a second year of Technological University of Isfara. Zarnigor wants all her children to receive a higher education. Her daughter's tuition at the university is due, Zarnigor needs a loan to pay it. She needs $ 400 and hopes on your responsiveness.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's higher education tuition.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 49-year-old married woman from Iloilo, Philippine.  Helen has made a living with her fishing business for 20 years. She helps her husband in their fishing venture which is their main source of income.

Helen requests a loan to buy nylon and new fishing nets. This will help Helen and her husband to improve their catch give them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Helen hopes to improve their standard of living and live a happy and abundant life with her husband and four children.

loans.use: to buy nylon and new fishing nets.

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita is 36 years old and is a married woman with six children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Renita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Renita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Renita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Renita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Susana requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials for her business, like shells, nylon threads, and wire.

Susana has been in this business for nine years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business, like shells, nylon threads, and wire.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married, hard working entrepreneur with two children. Vilma is 41 years old and has two children who attend school.

Vilma has had a food vending business for 5 years and requests 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Vevirly

texts.en:
Vevirly has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her sari-sari store. She has also been operating a market stand for years and she earns well from this. She is applying for a new loan to improve her profit in this business. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her child. The couple had to work hard with the determination of having a better income to provide their child with a better education.

She is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan for she wants to purchase more meat products and other items needed to expand her inventory. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Vevirly wants to expand her business. She also desires to improve their general living conditions. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for meat and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
This is Ma. Linda. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase grocery items and products for her business. The earnings were a big help for her personal, household and business expenditures.

She is now applying for a 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. Ma. Linda wants to display and sell more items as it will result in more profit. The profits from her business will help Ma. Linda pay for her family’s daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ma. Linda dreams that her business will grow bigger and improve her living standards. Every week she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business as well as draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a hardware supply business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional supplies like wood, paint, plumbing, chains, hinges, utensils, and other hardware supplies. for her business.

Nora has been in this business for 10 years. Nora earns additional income from a general store.

Nora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items  like wood, paint, plumbing, chains, hinges, utensils, and other hardware supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and pay for labour to finish up her house.

loans.name: Candelaria De Jesus

texts.es:
Candelaria, de 28 años, inicio con un negocio de alquiler de lavadoras hace aproximadamente 2 años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En sus hijos, encontró su motivación para trabajar incansablemente y así ofrecerle lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.

Solicita un préstamo para la realización del mantenimiento a su lavadora actual, además de poder comprar una lavadora adicional para aumentar su cobertura de servicio y así poder llevar el sustento para su hogar.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener  a sus hijos brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor.

Apoya a Candelaria para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Candelaria, 28 years old, started a washing machine rental business approximately two years ago with the desire to search for an occupation that would generate income in order for her to survive. In her children, she found her motivation to work tirelessly in order to offer them the best for their lives and development.

She is asking for a loan to maintain her current washing machine, as well as be able to buy an additional washer to increase her service coverage so that she is able to sustain her home. With this loan, she will be able to sustain her children, providing them with a better quality of life.  

Support Candelaria so that she can continue with her occupation!

loans.use: to carry out maintenance on her current washing machine, as well as be able to buy an additional washing machine.

loans.name: St Eva United Group

texts.en:
Levania is a 38-year-old female married with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. She is is thankful for her pevious Kiva loan, with which she was able to start up a retail shop of general merchandise and get daily incomes along side the fish business to increase on her income. She still has a dream of educating her children. 

Levania is faced with bad weather and competition as major challenges. She is requesting a new loan to to buy sugar, salt, cassava flour and other general merchandise for her retail shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cassava flour and other general mecherdise for selling.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a 36-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is a mother of four children.

For the past nineteen years, Chona has run a fishing business with her husband. In addition to taking good care of her children, Chona also finds time to support her husband in their fishing business. 

Chona is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights. This loan will help Chona and her husband in improving their daily catch, which will provide them with more fish to sell at the market. In the future, Chona hopes to make her business a success and save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Yiriwa vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Siguila de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment, de grains et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  13eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Assitan (la 2eme  femme debout  de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment de tout genre dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de condiment de tout genre et à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Assitan  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 15 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petites dépenses familiales  et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five members of the Yiriwa group are all women living in nuclear families. On the average, they are 34 years old, with four children. They all live in the Siguila village of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other as neighbors, relatives by blood or marriage, or through their work in the village. They work as vendors selling condiments, grains and cooked dishes. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 13th solidarity loan cycle.

Mrs. Assitan (the second woman standing from left to right in the photo) is a vendor of various condiments, well-known in her village and nearby region. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of various condiments in Ségou. She sells for cash and often on credit, at the market and out of her home, to a mixed clientele. With this loan, Mrs. Assitan hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 15,000 West African francs, which will be used to cover minor household  expenses and also strengthen her working capital. She would like to continue her collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Tulibamu Farmers Kayanja Group

texts.en:
Ferdinado is a hardworking married Ugandan man who lives in Kagadi.  He is the one in the photo with his hand raised. Ferdinado is a member of the Tulibamu Farmers Group where each member guarantees that the others will repay their loan since they don’t pledge securities.

Since 2009, he has been selling produce, in particular maize and beans, to earn a living. He hopes to have a modernized agricultural farm despite the challenges of price fluctuation and bad weather. Ferdinado is requesting a loan to buy herbicides to spray his crops.

loans.use: to buy herbicides to spray his crops

loans.name: Maksatkan

texts.ru: Максаткан 36 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей, все дети школьники и помогают по хозяйству. Образование у Максаткан высшее, она уже много лет занимается сельским хозяйством, а именно полеводством и животноводством. По характеру она очень приятная и отзывчивая женщина, она очень общительная и трудолюбивая. В хозяйстве Максаткан есть 6 коров, 5 лошадей и 10 овец.  Также Максаткан вместе со своими детьми выращивает ячмень, который реализует оптовым покупателям. Совокупный доход семьи составляет около 8,000 (KGS) в месяц. Максаткан обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. На прибыль от кредита она планирует построить большой сарай для скота.
texts.en: Maksatkan is 36 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  All her children go to school and also help her at home.  Maksatkan has a higher education but she's been involved in agriculture for many years already, growing crops and raising livestock.  She is a very nice and friendly woman.  She is also very sociable and hardworking.  She currently owns six cows, five horses and 10 sheep.  She and the children also grow barley, which they sell to wholesale buyers.  The family makes a total income of about 8,000 som (KGS) per month.  Maksatkan has contacted Bai Tushum Bank CJSC to request a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy livestock.  She plans to use the profits from her loan to build a large barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a hardworking married man with one child. He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling maize and beans. He hopes to expand his business and educate his child. 

Like other produce dealers, he usually complains of unpredictable weather changes, mainly rainfall that makes roads almost impassable. Micheal will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a recurrent borrower at UGAFODE, applying for a loan of UGX 5,000,000. She is a resident of the outskirts of the city of Bombo. Despite being disabled, Sarah has not laid back in self pity. She operates a retail shop in her residential area that helped her meet all her loan installments for the previous loan on time as well as meet her household needs. Her shop has not much working capital and this has always left her not serving all her customers fully. 

To overcome this challenge, she opted to take a new loan to add stock to her business which sells daily households items. Sarah has dreams of expanding her shop and also acquiring a car as a way of easing her distant movements.

loans.use: To buy daily household use items to sell in her retail shop

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 36 years old and married with four children ages three, five, seven, and nine. All of his children attend school at the moment. Robert is a farmer who grows tea. He works six hours a day, six days a week. Robert started farming in 2009 to have a source of income. He also sells matooke (cooking bananas) as an additional business. His farm is in his rural town in the Bushenyi district and his customers are tea traders who have helped him to remain and thrive growing tea. 

Robert is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer in the form of cow dung and dry grass for his tea plantations. He hopes to be financially stable in future through his hard work although he is faced with the challenge of poor weather in the dry season. Robert hopes to produce high quantity tea after buying fertilizer for his tea plantation using the loan money.

loans.use: to  buy cow dung and dry grass

loans.name: Gilda

texts.pt:
A Sra. Gilda de 43 anos de idade, viuva  e mae de 2 filhos que estao a frequentar a escola no ensino secundario. Ela è empacotadora de banana na empresa de producao de Banana a mais de 4 anos
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, area, janelas, portas e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para iniciar com a contrucao da sua casa.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao e a dieta almentar.
texts.en: Gilda, age 43, is a widow and mother of two children who both go to high school. She has worked as a packer at a banana company for more than four years. She will put this loan toward building materials (cement, gravel, windows, doors) and to pay construction workers to start work building her house. Her main challenges are in improving her living conditions and diet.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, gravel, windows, doors) and to pay construction workers.

loans.name: Nhóm 01-Phố 6-Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền has a retail business selling sim cards. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sim cards to resell.

Hiền is 35 years old and married with three children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 01-Phố 6-Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with three dependents

This is Hiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more sim cards to resell

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah lives in Kaplolo village, situated in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, near Eldoret town. Land in Kaplolo is extremely fertile for agriculture. Most families in Kaplolo practice agriculture. 

Leah, and her husband, Joseph, own a small piece of land in this region. They live together with their four children. They have been doing dairy farming for the last six years to earn a living. Her primary income source is milk.

Leah is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. As her children grow older, the upkeep and educational expenses keep rising. In order to meet these needs, Leah needs to boost her milk production to earn more income. 

With your loan, she will be able to afford a high-yielding dairy cow. She will use the additional income from milk sales to pay the loan installments and, later on, school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hauwa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her 3 children. She is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hauwa can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Hauwa like other Babban Gona members, expressed her desire to use the additional income to educate her children, and to make more money for herself and her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and food

loans.name: Nyakabungo Twetungure Group

texts.en:
Venensio, who is 22 years old, is a new client and a member of the Nyakabungo Twetungure group. He is married with 2 children, who are 3 years old and 6 months old.

He runs a car wash bay and a restaurant, earning a daily income. He is a hardworking man who works 10 hours a day and 6 days a week. He runs his businesses from his local area of residence, which is Nyakabungo, in the western Mitooma district.

He began his businesses in 2012 after starting his family, with the aim of supporting his family. He wants to use the loan money to buy equipment for a second wash bay. His clients are taxi and motorcycle drivers.

He hopes to be financially stable for a better future. He is, however, faced with the challenge of water breakups, which he has learned to manage. He and the group members are grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a car wash bay

loans.name: Nhóm 01 - Thôn 4 - Thọ Vực Group

texts.en:
Phương has a service business repairing motorcycles. She is applying for a loan to purchase motorcycle parts for her repair service. 

Phương is 37 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 - Thôn 4 - Thọ Vực solidarity group, which consists of nine members. 

In 2013, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phương has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Phương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts for her repair service

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 66-year-old man. He is married to Egra, and they are blessed with four children. Simon adds additional income to support their family, operating a retail shop. He has been in this business for 10 years and earns an income of 10,000 KES every month.

Simon is servicing his third loan of 20,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy more stocks of sugar, rice, cooking fat, wheat flour, maize flour and detergents to sell to his customers daily.

Simon plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cooking fat, wheat and maize flour, and detergents
