loans.name: Tumusiime

texts.en:
Tumusiime is a married male Ugandan. His main business is the sale of agricultural cereals such as maize, groundnuts and beans. He also is a small-scale farmer and sells local brew (knows as waragi) to supplement his income. He has been doing these activities since 2002.

He has applied for a loan to complete his house; he will use the money to buy cement and iron sheets. He hopes to have the house complete using this loan so that he can embark on rebuilding his business. His challenges include seasonality and price fluctuations.

He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy cement and iron sheets to complete his residential house

loans.name: Dceun's Group

texts.en: Dceun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Dceun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as the village coordinator to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 36 years old, married with two children. Both his children are in school. George deals in selling corn, millet and beans which he complements with a retail shop as his side source of income. He has managed to look after his family and provide the basic necessities of life.

George has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to help him buy millet and corn for his retail shop so that he can increase his sales and cash flow. He also wants to use the rest of the money to pay school fees for his children.

His major challenge is competition from his fellow traders and lack of enough capital to run his business. Despite these challenges, George is a very honest and hard-working man. He hopes to construct a permanent home for his family.

loans.use: to buy millet and corn

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Una oportunidad era lo que el esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que el quería ser. De 44 años de edad casado originaria del departamento de Suchitepéquez que tiene cinco hijos el primero es casado y tiene familia aparte y los cuatro últimos son estudian en la comunidad donde viven. El realiza un impresionante esfuerzo a pesar de su edad, el es una hombre emprendedor y dice que nunca es demasiado tarde para empezar a desarrollar y tener una visión en el futuro.

La actividad que el dignamente a desempeñado durante 12 años es la compraventa de abarrotería en la comunidad ya que es por medio de ella puede obtener un ingreso económico para su familia y una ganancia para mejora su condición de vida.

El uso respectivo que José le dará al préstamo que el solicita es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotería para así tener surtida su tienda para no perder la clientela con que el cuenta para así tener mejores ingresos económicos.  

Los sueños de el es que las condiciones de su familia sean las adecuadas para un futuro y dar estudios a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales en la vida y que ellos mejoren sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
An opportunity was what he was waiting for. Not just an open door, but also what was behind that door. And what he found was something that defined what he wanted to be.

He is 44 years old, is married, and comes from the department of Suchitepéquez. He has five children: his firstborn is married and has his own family, and the other four children go to school in their community. He puts in a great deal of effort. Despite his age, he is an enterprising man and says that it is never too late to start to develop and have a vision for the future.

His business, which he has run with pride for 12 years, is buying and selling groceries in the community. It is through this business that he is able to earn an income for his family and generate a profit to improve his living conditions.

José will use the loan that he is requesting to buy merchandise in order to stock up his grocery store, keep his customers, and generate a better income. 

His dreams are for his family's living conditions to be suitable in the future and to provide education for his children so that they become professionals and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ayuba joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his 3 children.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Ayuba said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children; and ultimately, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community."

loans.use: to pay for urgent expenses (school fees, food) and make better profits by storing his harvest

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is a hardworking farmer from Rukindo. She is 52 years old and a widow. She has been struggling to pay tuition for her children who are between 14 and 26 years old.

Being the sole breadwinner, she practices agriculture as well as livestock farming. She is a shepherdess, and with the help of some well-wishing relatives, has been able to raise her children, whose father died at a young age.

She approached UGAFODE for financial assistance previously, and she got a loan facility of 2,000,000 UGX, which she used to construct wells from which her cows could quench their thirst. This has helped her to produce high yields of milk and quality animals.

Now she wants to improve on her banana plantation and is requesting 3,000,000 UGX to help her buy farmyard manure and fertilizers so as to improve the soil of her banana plantation to yield highly, so that she can compete favorably on the market. Moreover, her children are progressing to higher education, where the tuition fees are high. She will therefore use a portion of the money to pay tuition for the children.

Her plight is real, and any assistance rendered to her is highly appreciated.

loans.use: to buy organic manure

loans.name: Naren's Group

texts.en: Naren’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Naren makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en: Sokhorn’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokhorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a construction worker to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate needs for food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yahaya said “ I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: To pay for urgent expenses such as school fees and food, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his harvest fast at low prices

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Usman joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his 3 children.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Usman would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Usman can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Usman said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community."

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses such as school fees and food, eliminating the pressure to sell her crops at low prices soon after harvest

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rahila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her 3 children.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rahila would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rahila can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Rahila said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses like school fees and eliminate pressure to sell corn at low prices right after harvest

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Bitrus joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his 3 children. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bitrus had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bitrus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Bitrus said: “ I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: To pay for urgent expenses like school fees and food, eliminating pressure to sell his harvest at low prices

loans.name: Saem's Group

texts.en:
Saem’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Saem makes a living cultivating rice, planting watermelon and repairing wood to support her family. 

Their village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is grateful for his previous loan. It has really improved his business and living standards.

His women's and men's clothes business is doing well. He is requesting a new loan to purchase more bales of clothes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine needs a loan to buy sugar, soap, water and juice to sell. She lives in Masindi, Uganda, and runs a retail shop that sells general merchandise such as sugar, soap, water and juice. 

Christine started the business to support her family and wishes to educate her children. Competition hinders her business; however, she is a hardworking woman and endeavors to struggle with it.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, water and juice to sell.

loans.name: Maku

texts.en:
Maku is a married woman and staying together with her husband and eight children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a firewood selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rahab had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rahab can now store her maize at harvest and sell it for up to 40% higher than the prices at harvest time. 

When asked, Rahab said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses such as school fees and food, and store her harvest to sell it later for greater profits

loans.name: Mai-Anguwa

texts.en:
Mai-Anguwa Gwani is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mai-Anguwa Gwani had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs for food and clothing.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mai-Anguwa Gwani can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Mai-Anguwa Gwani said “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses like school fees and food, and store his harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
Nicanor tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa familiar; en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Nicanor se dedica a brindar servicio de jornaleria; desde hace 12 años, su servicio lo ofrece en todos su distrito y alrededores, Nicanor solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; pues desea realizar la compra de herramientas para su trabajo(palanas, barriletes, entre otros); esto le servirá para mejorar sus servicios a los agricultores ya que le dará un valor agregadoa este servicio, lo que le permitirá captar un número mayor de clientes, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nicanor, 27, is single and lives in the family house in a rural area of the Oyotún district of the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.  The people in his community work mainly in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

Nicanor earns a living offering services as a day laborer.  For 12 years he has provided services throughout his district and the surrounding area.

Nicanor's requesting a loan to invest in fixed assets.  He wants to buy shovels, clamps, and other tools for work.  This will help him improve his services to farmers because it will give his labor added value and he'll be able to attract more clients.  In the short term, this will allow him to improve his income, increase his profits, and, consequently, improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools to give added value to his services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bulk products such as rice, beans, lentils, among others; and in this way meet the needs of the customers.

loans.name: Sao's Group

texts.en:
Sao is 26 years old and married. He is a father of three children. To make a living, he and his wife have been farming rice for 8 years and also supplement their family’s income by working for others for a fee. Their current business earns them about 20,000 KHR per day.

Sao’s group consists of three members who live in the same village in the Thporng district of Kampong Spue province. Nan is a first-cycle client and is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he is going use his portion to build a decent latrine for use by his family.

loans.use: build a latrine for his family

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Maryamu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her 3 children. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Maryamu had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to pay for school fees, food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.  

When asked, Maryamu said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses such as school fees and food, and store her harvest to sell it later for greater profits

loans.name: Ngim's Group

texts.en: Ngim’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Ngim makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: buy a water filter

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en: Nan’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Nan makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help the members of this group safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: buy a water filter

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 53-year-old mother of two children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband owns a wooden stall in which he sells pieces of wood for fuel. In his area there is a lot of shortage of cooking gas problem and at times the people like to burn these pieces of woods for cooking. 

Razia's husband continues his business on the corner of his residence.  His business is running well but the income generated by his current business is not sufficient to cope with the demands of his family. Therefore he decided to increase his business. Therefore, Razia requested a loan from Kvia’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to increase his business.

Razia is thankful to KIVA and Field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Saret, 28, comes from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She is an experienced and active farmer. By operating a farming business on a small rice field which is located near her house, she can earn around USD 4.00 per day to cover her family's daily expenses. She is a lovely mother of two dependent children who are enrolled in the primary school.

To keep her rice growing well and provide more profit, she wants to use some natural fertilizers. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a KIVA loan to buy fertilizers. She hopes that this loan will help her rice grow well as well as bring her in more harvest.  She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to keep her rice growing well and bring her a bigger harvest

loans.name: Naida

texts.en:
Naida, 42, is a married woman and a mother of four children. She lives with her family in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. 

Naida and her husband are engaged in a fishing business. For more than 19 years now, fishing has been their main source of livelihood.

As of now, Naida wants to avail herself of a loan to buy a new boat engine, fishing nets and a petromax lamp. Naida is optimistic that this loan will help them in making their fishing business more profitable and sustainable.
 
Naida wants to improve their way of living. She is also saving some money for her children's school fees.

loans.use: buy a boat engine, fishing nets and a lamp

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is thankful that she was granted a 20000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

Marivic would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items such as rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods, etc. which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment for the financial help that will be given her. 

Marivic dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education for a bright future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Thporng district, Thorn is a 42-year-old mother of four children. The main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice and working for others for a fee. She has been in this business for 24 years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 16,000 per day to spend for daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Thorn with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a decent latrine for use in her family. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: buy a latrine for her family

loans.name: Sovan's Group

texts.en:
Sovann is 29 years old and married.  She lives in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Thpong district of Kampong Spue province.  She and her husband have two children.  They earn a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee and they have been in this business for almost 11 years.  With her current businesses, Sovann is able to earn approximately 20,000KHR per day to support her family. 

This is the first loan for Sovann with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sovann wants to use her portion to buy a decent latrine for use in her family.

loans.use: buy a latrine

loans.name: Roen's Group

texts.en:
Roen, 50, lives in a rural area of the Phnom Srouch district of Kampong Spue province.  She is married with nine children. The family’s main source of income is from farming rice. The current business earns Roen about 15,000 KHR per day.  

Roen is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a water filter for use in her family. She hopes to have clean water for drinking in her family.

loans.use: buy a water filter

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 37, a mother of six children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by trade, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the  income generated from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other income sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the vegetables. Therefore, Parveen asked for a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more vegetables for selling.

Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to expand her husband's vegetable shop

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiru is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his 3 children. Before joining Babban Gona, Kabiru had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to meet immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Kabiru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later at prices up to 40% higher than aroung harvest time.

When asked, Kabiru said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: To pay for urgent expenses such as school fees and food, and store her harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: David Otieno's Group

texts.en: David, Gilbert and Kenneth are independent distributors of energy-efficient cookstoves in informal settlements in Nairobi. Through their ventures, they are able to earn an income while delivering a much-needed solution to low-income communities. This loan will enable them expand their inventory and supply stoves to more communities in Nairobi.

loans.use: to buy improved cookstoves for sale in informal settlements

loans.name: Nhy

texts.en:
Nhy is aged 61 and married. She lives in a rural village of Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province and she has one child. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day. 

Nhy just joined VisionFund this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her farming business. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to support her farming business so she can improve her standard of living

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sunday's Group

texts.en:
Sunday is 51 years old and a father of 5. He is also known as “small man” because of his disability. Because of his deformed legs, he faced discrimination during his school days from fellow students and teachers didn't support him. 

Today he is a professional artist but he faces another serious challenge since the introduction of computers for designing. Lack of job at his shop has finally moved Sunday to embrace farming. At his home, he processes palm oil annually for the local market, rears local chickens, pigs and also cultivates vegetable for the local market. His major problem is finance to enable him utilize his wisdom to generate more income. 

As a full member of Nke-Anyi Farmers Multipurpose Cooperative Society, he is presently volunteering as a zonal head of the cooperative. Sadly at his age, his kids are still young because it took him too long to get a wife due to his nature. Income he hopes to generate from this loan will help him built more chicken house, stock more birds and also support his family especially that of paying his children school fees.

Sunday and all his group members appreciates all Kiva lenders that support this loan.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Erick Gwaliamba's Group

texts.en:
Erick, Florence and Joel are independent distributors of energy-efficient cookstoves in informal settlements in Nairobi, Kenya. Through their ventures, they are able to earn an income while delivering a much-needed solution to low-income communities. 

This loan will enable them expand their inventory and supply stoves to more communities in Nairobi.

loans.use: To purchase energy efficient stoves for sale in informal settlements

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a 30 year-old married man. Him and his wife are blessed with one child. Dominic has been running a welding shop for a period of seven years, earning himself an income of 8,000 KES at the end of every month.  

Dominic is now requesting a second loan of 22,500 KES. He intends to use this amount to buy a new welding machine to offer better services to his customers.

Dominic plans to use the anticipated income to open a metal shop within his hometown and hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success.

loans.use: To purchase a new welding machine.

loans.name: Luisa Fernanda

texts.es:
Luisa es una madre responsable de sus tres hijos que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia. 

Vive felizmente con su esposo y sus hijos en una finca en el municipio de Chigorodo.

Hace un tiempo montó su venta de huevos, para lo cual tiene una cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener muy buenas ventas. 

Es por esto que busca que un préstamo le permita comprar más gallinas para poder incrementar su capacidad de producción de huevos y así responder a la demanda de sus clientes por los huevos.

De esta manera sus ventas se incrementarán considerablemente, además de que su negocio resurgirá y podrá salir adelante. 

Además, Luisa espera que con mayores ingresos sus hijos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y el acceso a una mejor educación. 

Luisa sueña con tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda la capacidad que pueda para sacarlo adelante y así ofrecerle a sus hijos un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Luisa is a responsible mother to her three kids. She has had to overcome many difficulties through her life; however, she has always found the strength to move forward and to keep growing in her life.

She lives happily with her husband and children in a ranch, in the municipality of Chigorodo. She has been selling eggs for awhile. She has a number of hens that allow her to make good sales. She is looking to get another loan so she can buy more hens to increase the eggs production, and to cover the request for eggs by her clients. Her sales will increase considerably, furthermore, her business will come back and she'll be able to get ahead.

Luisa also hopes that her kids will have a better life and have access to a better education if her income improves.

Luisa dreams of having a big business where she can focus to get ahead, and offer her children a steady future.

loans.use: to buy more hens to increase the eggs production.

loans.name: Hilary

texts.en: Hilary is an enterprising independent man distributing energy-efficient cookstoves in informal settlements in Nairobi. Through his ventures, he is able to earn an income while delivering a much-needed solution to deprived communities. This loan will enable him expand his inventory allowing him to supply stoves to more communities in Nairobi.

loans.use: To purchase energy efficient stoves for sale in informal settlements

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en: Jesse is an enterprising independent man who distributes energy-efficient cookstoves in informal settlements in Nairobi. Through his ventures, he is able to earn an income while delivering a much-needed solution to low-income communities. This loan will enable him expand his inventory allowing him to supply stoves to more communities in Nairobi.

loans.use: To buy energy-efficient stoves to distribute to poor communities

loans.name: Raul Antonio

texts.es:
Raul es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo. 

Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.

El tiene un cultivo de caña de azucar el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Frontino.

Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción.

El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas de plátano y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa.

Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores.

Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras!
texts.en:
Raul is a veteran with a lot of experience in the field. He is humble and unassuming. He is good with people, and he has sufficient energy to be able to produce any crop. 

He has a planting of sugar cane where he works every day in order to sell his crops in the plaza of the market in the town of Frontino.

Thanks to his years of experience and the teachings of his father that he received as a boy, he has full ability to work and to advise other farmers in the zone on these subjects when they need help with their production.

He is applying for the loan in order to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, banana seedlings, and pesticides. In this way he will inject capital into his business and will improve his harvests in a significant manner.

He has a lot of faith in his business and great hopes in the caring people who support the working farmers.

Help a humble farmer so that he can move forward with his land!

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, banana seedlings, and pesticides.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is a young and brilliant independent distributor of energy efficient cookstoves in informal settlements in Nairobi. Through his venture, he is able to earn an income while delivering a much-needed solution to deprived communities. This loan will enable him expand his inventory allowing him to supply stoves to more communities in Nairobi while earning a living for himself.

loans.use: To purchase energy efficient cookstoves for sale

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Julius, a hardworking, dedicated and honest 60-year-old dairy farmer. As the key breadwinner of his family, with a wife and children, he farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kapsowar, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. For the past 10 years, he has been practicing mixed farming and his primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs and tea. He also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income he earns through farming. 

Julius passionately loves dairy farming but the biggest challenge he faces is feeding his cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. He is seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter and another quality breed of dairy cow.

The chaff cutter will assist Julius in cutting hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forage to feed his cow. Also, it will aid the animal’s digestion and prevent the animals from rejecting any part of their food. Julius also intends to buy not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 15-25 litres of milk a day. This will enable he will be making USD 11 per day. 

Before Julius joined Juhudi Kilimo, a Kenyan microfinance institution supporting smallholder farmers with technical and financial solutions, he considered dairy farming to be a mediocre fallback occupation that did not have a future promise for income generation. After training, he now believes that dairy farming is the business to go into if you want a rather less rough way into the “millionaires club”. 

An increase in income will allow Julius to improve his living conditions and secure the future of his children. His dream is to continue improving his dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Julius fears that his dreams might not be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders cease to provide its reliable market channel, credit facility and services that he requires to grow his dairy enterprise.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter and another quality breed dairy cow

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is 43 years old and married with four children, and all are able to acquire education. He does cattle fattening to be able to sustain his family.

He desires to build a permanent house for his family, but inadequate capital and prolonged droughts affect his cattle, thus leading him to less yield and lower income.

He is requesting a loan to buy cows for fattening.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening.

loans.name: Franca's Group

texts.en:
Franca is a 54 years-old woman. She lives with her husband and their 5 children. Although she is a nurse by profession and presently serving in the rural health center, she still spends her weekends at the local palm oil mill were she engages in palm oil processing. Extra income from the palm oil sales helps her to balance her small salary. She is very excited to have been among those to benefit from Nke-Anyi Ndu-Oma loan product.

A portion of this loan will help her store more product this season and also make more income to support her husband in caring for their last 2 sons who are presently studying at the university. She thanks all the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Chanthoen

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village in the Ksach Kandal district of Cambodia, Chanthoen is a 39-year-old married mother of three. She has been farming rice for 19 years, while her husband is a construction worker. The current business earns her about US$12 per day. 

Chanthoen has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She is now requesting another loan to pay for her son's university tuition fee. She hopes to keep him there until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition fee

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a bodaboda (motorcycle taxi) cyclist from Kahama, Uganda. He is 29 years old and is happily married with two children. He never went to school because his parents could not pay for his tuition fees.

Despite the fact that he never went to school, he is supporting his younger brother with school fees for his secondary school education. He rents a motorcycle from a well wisher. The business would be profitable, but almost all the profits are taken by the owner.

Day-by-day competition is very high, and at times he is forced to pay even when he has not worked. He has looked at this as being exploited, yet he has the capacity to push himself.

He approached one of UGAFODE's staff and requested an asset-acquisition loan with the objective of buying a motorcycle.

He intends to save enough to create a small business for his wife, given that the transport business he runs is a risk to his life due to the prevalence of accidents in the area.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle-taxi

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children, and four children attending different schools. She owns a boutique that sells ladies' clothing and materials in a rural trading center, where she works for seven days a week and 14 hours a day.

She also does agriculture and owns rentals from where she gets an additional income to support her family. She was motivated by the desire to earn income and be self reliant. 

She hopes to use the loan to restock her clothing business and sell her goods to people from around her place and the neighboring areas. Her hopes and dreams are to have a textile shop and build more rentals.

She is described as an honest woman in business and she appreciates the services of Ugafode.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the shop.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María Esperanza, es soltera, vive en casa familiar con su madre. Ella tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su familia es unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. La misma que está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

María Esperanza se dedica a la venta de animales (patos,pavos y chanchos) en el distrito de Cayaltí y también se dedica al servicio domestico(lavado de ropa) desde hace más de 05 años aproximadamente. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de animales y alimentación balanceado. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Esperanza is single and lives in the family home with her mother. She has good work and personal references. Her family is close-knit. She lives in a community where people are engaged in farming, livestock-raising, and have small businesses. It is located in Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of Peru's north coast.

María Esperanza sells animals (ducks, turkeys and pigs) in Cayaltí district, and has also been working as a housekeeper (washing clothes) for approximately 5 years. The purpose of the loan is to buy animals and balanced feed. This will allow her to improve her income in the short-term, increase her earnings, and consequently improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To buy animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a maize farmer from Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Yusuf had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf can now store his maize and sell it a few months later at prices 40% higher than around harvest time.

When asked, Yusuf said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs".

loans.use: To pay for urgent expenses such as school fees and food, and store his harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu is a maize farmer from Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Saidu had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saidu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later at prices up to 40% higher. 

When asked, Saidu said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community."

loans.use: To pay for urgent expenses such as school fees and food, and store his harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Candelario

texts.es:
Candelario tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 04 hijos dependientes; vive con su conyugue y sus 04 hijos aún dependientes. Candelario vive en el caserío de Shin Shin distrito de Cañarís, el caserío de Shin Shin es un caserío mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, el cual se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de distrito de Cañarís, provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está básicamente dedicada a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Candelario se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de café, de variedad Catimor de 05 y 06 años de edad, cuenta con fincas fruteras de café en buen estado, dichos cultivos se encuentran ubicado a unos metros de su domicilio, además se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y cultivo de pan llevar, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El destino del crédito es para invertir en el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, comprando abonos, fetilizantes, insecticidas, entre otros. Invirtiendo en su negocio y podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Candelario is 34 years old. He has a partner and four dependent children. He lives with his spouse and four minor children. He lives in the village of Shin Shin in the Cañaris district. Shin Shin is a medium sized village with aspirations to excel. It is located in the district of Cañaris, in Ferreñafe province, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. The community is basically dedicated to agriculture, trade and livestock.

Candelario is a farmer.  He has coffee plants of the Catimor variety, which are 5 and 6 years old. He has a fruitful coffee plantation at a good stage of growth. Said plants are located a few meters from his house.

In addition, he also raises cows and basic grains. He has had more than 10 years of experience in agriculture. He has very good personal and work references.

He will use the loan to invest in the maintenance of his coffee crop by purchasing compost, fertilizer and insecticide, among other items. By investing in his business he will be able to make an acceptable profit in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his coffee crop.

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Sarun, 43, comes from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She is an experienced and active farmer. By operating a farming business in a small rice field that is located near her house, she can earn around USD 3.50 per day to support her family’s daily expenses. She is a lovely mother of two dependent children and one married child.

To keep her rice growing well and provide more benefit, she wants to use some natural fertilizers. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers. 

She hopes that this loan will help her rice grow well, as well as bring her more crops.  She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to help her rice grow well.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders, meet Thomas. Thomas is a charismatic, active and attentive man. 

Being a father of two lovely children has been his main motive for fighting tirelessly day to day, seeking alternatives to earn a living and support his children. For the last six years, he has been practicing mixed farming to support his family. 

Thomas makes money selling milk and a variety of food crops, such as maize, from his farm. Thomas is seeking a loan because he wants to get his hands on poultry. This is a diversification from dairy and crop farming. He enjoys dairy farming as much as he does crop farming. However, the region usually experiences long dry spells which inevitably affects crop harvests negatively. 

For this reason, Thomas is seeking a loan to buy poultry. Poultry will serve both subsistence and commercial purposes. There is a high demand for poultry products in the developing town of Eldoret, which is the nearest town to Thomas's village. Proceeds from the sale of eggs will help Thomas cope with the rising farm expenses that is putting many farmers in the region out of business. His long-term plan is to free his family from the chains of poverty.

loans.use: to buy poultry to diversity his farming business

loans.name: Amira Rosa

texts.es:
Amira está casada y es madre de 3 hijos, a los que ha sacado adelante con arduo esfuerzo y dedicación. 

Durante 3 años ha trabajado como comerciante independiente, inicialmente fue vendedora ambulante, pero contó con la suerte de que las autoridades de espacio público le adjudicaran un puesto fijo; allí trabaja todos los días de 9:00 am a 6:00 pm y ha logrado generar los ingresos para solventar las necesidades familiares.

Expresa que su interés con el crédito es invertir en la compra de surtido al por mayor como ropa, computadores y celulares para abastecerse lo suficiente y poder satisfacer los gustos de su clientela con la variedad que ofrecerá; esto le ayudará a mejorar las ventas  y los ingresos que recibe, con los que podrá seguir solventando las necesidades de su hogar y además le hará frente a su mayor desafío que es sostenerse frente a la competencia desleal que se presenta en el sector. 

Amira manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener su negocio en un local comercial en el que pueda atender más cómodamente a sus clientes y así evitar los riesgos a los que se expone trabajando en la calle; además tendría la capacidad para brindar mejor bienestar, educación y condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Amira is married and the mother of three children she has supported with arduous effort and dedication.

For three years she has worked as an independent businesswoman. Initially she was a street vendor but she was lucky and the community space authorities allotted her a permanent location. She works there every day from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm and has been able to generate enough income to meet her family's needs.

She is interested in investing the loan in the purchase of wholesale supplies such as clothing, computers and cell phones, stocking up sufficiently to be able to satisfy her customers' tastes with a variety of items for sale. This will help her to improve sales and the income she receives and continue meeting the needs of her household and to confront her biggest challenge of persevering in the face of the unfair competition present in the area.

Amira expresses that her greatest wish is to have her business at an establishment where she can serve her customers more comfortably and avoid the risks associated with working on the street. Additionally she would also have the capacity to provide improved well-being, education and living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies such as clothing, computers and cell phones.

loans.name: Paix De Jesus 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Duquene est le coordinateur de son groupe Paix de Jesus 1, 2, 3 & 4. Il n'est pas marie. Il a 3 enfants. Il habite dans la région nord Haïti ou l’électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limite. Il dirige son commerce de vente de produits alimentaire pendants les 7 derniers années.

Duquene espère que ce emprunt`l’aidera a grandir son commerce. Des autres membres de Paix de Jesus 1, 2, 3 & 4 ont besoin d’un emprunt pour les commerces tel que ventes produits cosmetiques, nourriture, boissons gazeuses, charbon, etc. Il dit que son défi principal est de devenir un plus grand commerçant.
texts.en:
Duquene is the coordinator of his group Paix de Jesus [Peace of Jesus] 1,2,3, & 4. He is not married, and has three children. He lives in the Nord region of Haiti, where electricity is rare, and drinking water is very limited. He has run his business of selling food products for the last seven years. 

Duquene hopes that this loan will help grow his business. He says that his main challenge is becoming a better merchant. 

Other members of Paix de Jesus 1,2,3, & 4 need a loan for businesses such as selling cosmetic products, food, sodas, coal, etc.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Fifty-four-year-old Adelfa engages in fishing. She catches and sells fish to the people in the community. She is married woman and has five children. Her youngest child is 15. She lives in Dulag, Leyte. 

Aside from fishing, Adelfa is also into food vending. She sells puto (rice cakes) and chocolate rolls. To be able to have a sustainable income, Adelfa has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, and also additional capital for items for her food vending, such as rice flour, sugar, leavening agent, and many other items. With these, she can now improve her catch as well as cater to more orders from customers. Thus, she will create higher earnings and eventually she can provide her children with nutritious food.

Adelfa would like to expand both her businesses to be successful and for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, and additional items for her food vending such as rice flour, sugar, leavening agent, and many other items.

loans.name: Okerio

texts.en:
Okerio is a hardened dairy farmer who lives in Masige West, a location found in the Kisii area of Kenya. The 74-year-old farmer is able to sustain his family's livelihood by selling milk at a local market.
 
Okerio is seeking a loan to purchase a water tank. Masige West location is so remote that it does not have a water piping system. Farmers from this area get water from fetching it from a spring or lifting it from a borehole or harvesting rainwater with troughs and buckets. The major problem these sources have in common is that a farmer will fetch in small quantities every other time.
 
With a Kiva loan, Okerio will be able to store a huge volume of water that will serve both his domestic and commercial interests for an extended period of time. This investment his save him a lot of time and energy that he greatly needs in his old days.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Prince Group

texts.en:
Prince is 45 years old man and a father to 6 children. He is a farmer. Prince produces cassava which he locally reprocesses into garri, a local Nigerian dish. His major setback is inadequate land to farm more cassava. He also harvests and process palm fruits into palm oil which his wife sells at the local market. For him, farmers make more money when they are able to convert their farm products into finished product and make it available to consumers rather than when they sell raw materials. 

He hopes that if he processes, sells and stores more palm oil products this year, he will be able to save towards purchasing a land to increase his cassava production.  

Although he never had the opportunity to go to school, his 6 children are in school and he is ever determined to see them graduate someday. 

Prince and all his group members thank all Kiva lenders in advance for supporting this loan.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: St Clare 111 Group

texts.en:
Stella is a 47-year-old female, married with four children. She is the new group leader of the St Clare 111 Group  from Kasese, Uganda. Stella is a farmer and grows crops such as rice, beans, cotton, maize and tomatoes. She has been in commercial farming since 2000, and it has enabled her to earn a living. 

Stella has a dream of educating her children, but she is faced with a challenge of debtors, which affects her cash flow. 

Stella is requesting the loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is married with two children, both of whom attend school. Her husband is a carpenter and he supports the family financially. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  

Zawadi operates a clothes-making business, selling women's and gentlemen's suits in a shop. She cites seasonality and stiff competition as her major challenges. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase material to make clothing. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for her haberdashery business

loans.name: Molmol

texts.ru: Молмол 47 лет, дети взрослые и самостоятельные, только младший живет с родителями. Образование у Молмол средне-специальное. Она в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав много лет назад с покупки 2 овец. Благодаря упорному труду Молмол, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, 10 овец и 3 лошади. На собственном участке, мерою 1,38 Га она выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Молмол обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Молмол планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Molmol is 47 years old.  Her children are all adults and have left the home already.  Only the youngest one still lives with his parents.  Molmol has a specialized secondary education.  She is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute an additional source of income for her family.  She started in this field many years ago with the purchase of two sheep.  Thanks to her very hard work, Molmol now owns two cows, 10 sheep and three horses.  She also grows barley on her own piece of land, which measures 1.38 hectare.  She makes a monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy livestock.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in Kabumbi, Uganda. She has four children who have finished school. She operates a retail shop, which is located in a local trading centre.

Irene is requesting a loan of UGX 4,000,000 in order to purchase more items for her business to meet the needs of her customers in the market, and also to overcome the competition of neighboring retail shops. Irene’s major customers are mostly neighbors and passersby. 

She has all the experience to succeed in this business, and successfully repay her loan.

Irene’s dream is to become a big trader through acquiring more loans.

loans.use: to buy items to stock and sell.

loans.name: Yurany

texts.es:
Yurany ha sido ama de casa desde que se casó, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia pero, vive sola; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía por catálogo pues era responsable de su sostenimiento y necesitaba generar los recursos para hacerlo. 

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja sola todos los días, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productiva como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (perfumería, cremas corporales, cosméticos, accesorios, entre otros), esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de navidad, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Yurany manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder seguir creciendo como empresaria y tener unas oportunidades de progreso mejores.
texts.en:
Yurany has been a housewife since she got married. She is always watching out for the care of her family, but she lives alone. She has always liked to work as an independent merchant. She started selling merchandise via catalog because she was responsible for her support and she needed to generate resources to do it. 

Her customers are her neighbors, relatives and friends from the area. She works alone every day and is able to be productive as a merchant.

Right now, she is asking for a loan to buy inventory wholesale (perfume, body creams, cosmetics, accessories and more). This will allow her to meet demand that is growing for this Christmas season, bringing the result of more income for her family.  

Yurany says that her biggest wish is to be able to keep growing as a businesswoman and have better opportunities to progress.

loans.use: to buy inventory wholesale (perfumes, body creams, cosmetics,and more).

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a maize farmer from Zaki, Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, she had to sell her maize at low prices soon after harvest in order to pay for immediate necessities such as food, school fees and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu can now store her maize at harvest and sell it at prices up to 40% higher than during harvest season. 

When asked, Maryamu said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses such as school fees and food, and store her harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a hard working resident of Nyamityobora, Uganda. He is 32-years-old and never went to school, but is happily married with four children. He has been struggling to earn a living and to support his family. He has worked as a bodaboda cyclist but that business was not supportive enough given that he pays tuition for his younger brother.

Currently, he is in the business of cattle fattening. He also works as a butcher. As a result of high competition and the need for quality services, he has run out of cash to support his business. This is why he approached UGAFODE.

This is not his first loan and he is really good at repaying his loans. He intends to buy a meat freezer to improve the quality of his meat which will also help him to keep it longer without going bad especially on days when the sales are low. This will help him very much in boosting his business.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for his cow fattening business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es viuda, tiene 67 años de edad. Vive en casa propia, junto a sus hijos y 01 nieto en Cayaltí. Ella es una persona de buenas referencias personales y laborales. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; la misma que está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Margarita se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, aves de corral(patos, cuyes, pollos, entre otros) para negocio, desde hace 15 años. Además vende eventualente alimentos preparados(comida al paso). Inversión será destinada en la compra de alimentos de engorde para cerdos y alimentos balanceados para lechones recien nacidos. Con ello generará mayores ingresos y una mejora de calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Margarita is a widow. She is 67 years old. She lives in her own house with her children and 1 year old in Cayaltí. She is a person with good personal and work references. She is from a close family. She lives in a community that is dedicated to commerce, agriculture and cattle. It is located in the district of  Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, northern coast of Peru.

Margarita has worked raising and selling pigs, and poultry (ducks, guinea pigs, chickens and more) for 15 years. In addition, she sells prepared meals sometimes (fast food). The investment will be used to buy feed to fatten her pigs and balanced feed for the newborn piglets. With it she will generate more income and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten pigs and balanced feed for newborn piglets.

loans.name: Bremilda

texts.es:
Bremilda tiene 56 años, es casada, conocida en el medio por prestar servicios de fotocopiado. Vive en casa propia con conyuge e hija de 20 años quien estudia secretariado bilingue. Conyuge trabaja en empresa agroindustrial de Cayaltí. Ella es una persona con buenas referencias personales y laborales, de familia unida. Vive en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Comunidad de clima caluroso dedicada al comerco a la ganaderia y agricultura, habltada por gente sencilla y amable.

Bremilda se dedica a prestar servicio de fotocopiado. Desde hace casi 02 años, adicionalmente cuenta con pequeña bodega y venta de productos de belleza meidante catalogo. Necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de mercaderia (arroz, azúcar, entre otros)para bodega, la cual le generará mayor ingreso a su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Bremilda is 56 years old. She is married and is know for her photocopying services. She lives in her own home with her spouse and 20 year old daughter who is studying to be a bilingual secretary. Her spouse works in an agroindustrial business in Cayaltí. She is a person with good personal and work references and is from a close family. She lives in a community located in the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, northern coast of Peru. It is a community with a warm climate that is dedicated to commerce, ranching and agriculture. It is inhabited by humble and friendly people.  

Bremilda has worked offering photocopying services for 2 years. She also has a small store and sells beauty products via catalog. She needs the loan to invest in buying merchandise (rice, sugar, and more) for the store. This will generate more income for her family unit.

loans.use: to invest in buying merchandise (rice, sugar, and more) for her store.

loans.name: Malahat

texts.ru: Малахат 45 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Малахат среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она с 1989 года занимается сельским хозяйством. Сейчас у нее есть 6 коров, 8 овец, также земельный надел, мерою 3,36 ГА, где Малахат ежегодно сажает пшеницу, ячмень и кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Также есть большой абрикосовый сад. Благодаря упорному труду Малахат, ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Малахат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 15 овец для откорма и реализации на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Малахат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Malahat is 45 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and she has been involved in agriculture since 1989.  This activity constitutes her family's main source of income.  Malahat currently owns six cows, eight sheep, as well as 3.36 hectares of land on which she plants wheat, barley and corn every year, for the family's own use and also for resale.  She also has a large apricot orchard.  Thanks to her very hard work, she makes an income of close to 10,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy 15 sheep which she will fatten and resell for a profit at the market.  Malahat plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Small-scale farming is a way of life in Africa, full of challenges and equally full of huge opportunities. The unprecedented population surge in Kenya has left the country with nearly 43 million people, and the population continues to increase steadily. This has led to competition and depletion of land and natural resources. In many parts of the country, available land is shrinking, either due to urbanization or cultural land-dividing traditions. For many families struggling to make ends meet, the sale of their land is viewed as the only option. 

Kiva Lenders, the picture above presents to you Patrick, a farmer who is struggling to survive. He hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya, an area that is blessed with good climatic conditions and favorable weather patterns that favor farming. Patrick is blessed with a beautiful wife and two lovely children and has been doing farming for the past three years. He was raised in a humble family, and he never got the opportunity to go to college because of a lack of funds for tuition. As a result, he never got any formal employment but didn’t surrender to that. He started farming, and through farming he has been able to take care of his family and also his parents. 

Patrick's income comes from selling vegetables, milk and eggs. These products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, but one problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time. The Nkubu area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Patrick is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike he will be able to deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. Patrick is very determined to succeed and because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans, through accumulated profits, to provide a secure future for himself and also for his parents. Patrick’s dream is to go back to school, and he hopes that through your loan, you will help him realize his dream.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Rom, 47, comes from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She has seven children, four of whom are married and three who are unmarried. She is an experienced and active farmer. By operating a farming business on a small rice field located near her house, she can earn around USD 3.50 per day to support her family's daily expenses. So far, she has been in this career for almost 30 years.

To keep her rice growing well and provide more benefit, Rom wants to use some natural fertilizer. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a KIVA loan to buy fertilizer. She hopes that this loan will help her rice grow well and bring her more crops. She also thanks all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: M. Atif

texts.en:
M. Atif is from Lahore and lives with his parents and siblings in a rented house. He is 28 and deals in buying and selling livestock. He has been doing this for many years now and has established himself well in the market. He is responsible and hardworking. He wants his business to become self-sufficient and start saving money to get married.
 
He has therefore requested for a loan to buy heifers and bull calves to increase the number of cattle and subsequently increase his earning. He hopes this addition will increase his business and would be beneficial for the growth of his business. He is thankful to BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to buy heifers and bull calves to increase his herd.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Cristóbal de 67 años de edad, se ha ganado el cariño de todos sus vecinos por su amabilidad y buen sentido del humor. 

Ama su familia, la cual es el motor principal para luchar cada día y generar el sustento para sobrevivir. 

Aunque no contaba con recursos para iniciar su negocio, esto no fue impedimento para cumplir su sueño de convertirse en comerciante, con un pequeño capital que le prestó un amigo, este hombre inició con una tienda de abarrotes. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace tres años.

Sus sueños no paran, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar. 

Espera poder mejorar su condición económica y poder tener una vejez sin preocupaciones monetarias,  garantizarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Cristobal, aged 67, has won the affection of all his neighbours because of his kindness and good sense of humour.

He loves his family, who is his main motivation to work hard each day and make a living.

Even though he didn't have the means to start his own business, this situation didn't stop him from fulfilling his dream of becoming a businessman. With a little money that a friend lent him, this man opened a grocery store. He has been running this business for the past three years.

His dreams don't stop there. For this reason, he is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase an assortment of basic-needs products.

He hopes to improve his financial situation, be able to spend his old age without money concerns, and ensure a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of basic-needs products.

loans.name: 25 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Yovanna es una mujer de 29 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos de ocho, cuatro y dos años de edad, y su negocio es la atención de una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, buena madre, solidaria, trabajadora y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un lugar caracterizado por el crecimiento constante del comercio en todas las áreas y por su población proveniente de tribus ‘Ayoreas’ del lugar y mineros relocalizados de occidente, de clima tropical con una temperatura promedio de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Yovana es de tez morena, cabello castaño largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español y habla guaraní por herencia familiar (la segunda de la derecha, blusa gris, pantalón azul). Debido a la necesidad de ampliar su negocio formó una banca de personas con negocios similares como; pensión familiar, venta de licores, venta de mantillas, tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de frituras, venta de ropa deportiva, Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica al transporte como taxi y sus tres hijos, el mayor estudia en la escuela los menores todavía están al cuidado de la madre, toda la familia vive en una casa alquilada de ladrillo que cuenta con los servicios de agua, luz y alcantarillado. Su negocio es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad como; pan, arroz, fideo, leche, azúcar, papel higiénico, etc. Lo realiza en su domicilio de lunes a domingo desde tempranas horas de la mañana hasta últimas horas de la noche. Ya lleva dos años de experiencia en el negocio y este es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución. Este negocio está en constante crecimiento por la demanda de los vecinos y clientes ocasionales que realizan compras en todo momento. Su sueño es tener una tienda amplia y poder vender por mayor y menor, y desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor para abaratar gastos y ahorrar tiempo.
Es por esos motivos que Yovanna solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor para surtir su tienda y tener mayor clientela.
texts.en:
Yovanna is a woman of 29. She is married and has three children, ages 8, 4, and 2. Her business is tending to a neighborhood store with foods of basic necessity. 

She is independent, entrepreneurial, a good mother, caring, hard-working, and very responsible. She does her work in the "Plan 3000" zone, a place characterized by the constant growth of commerce in all areas and by its population stemming from the Ayoreas tribes of the area and miners relocated from the west. It has a tropical climate with an average temperature of 30 degrees centigrade during the entire year. 

Yovanna has a dark complexion, long dark hair, and medium stature. Her mother tongue is Spanish, and she speaks Guaraní because of her family heritage. She is the second one from the right, in the gray blouse and blue pants. Due to the need to expand her business, she formed a communal bank with people with similar businesses, such as a family guesthouse, selling liquor, selling shawls, knitting baby clothing, selling fried snacks, and selling sports clothing. She lives with her husband, who works in transportation as a taxi driver, and their three children. The oldest goes to school. The younger ones are still in the care of their mother. The whole family lives in a rented house made of brick, which has water, light, and sewer service. 

Her business is a neighborhood store with foods of basic necessity such as bread, rice, pasta, milk, sugar, toilet paper, etc. She tends her business in her residence from Monday to Sunday, from the early hours of the morning until the last hours of the evening. She already has two years of experience in the business, and this is her first loan sequence with the institution. This business is in constant growth because of the demands of the neighbors and occasional customers, who make purchases at any hour. Her dream is to have a large store and be able to sell wholesale and retail, and she wants to expand her business by making the wholesale purchase of foods of basic necessity in order to lower her costs and save time.

It is for these reasons that Yovanna is applying for a loan for the wholesale purchase of foods of basic necessity in order to stock her store and have more customers.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs wholesale in order to stock her store and have more customers.

loans.name: Alcides Arnoldo

texts.es:
El señor  Alcides de 37 años de  edad, vive en su casa propia junto con su esposa y sus  hijos,  se dedica desde hace 4  años al negocio de Transporte en moto taxis, transporta a sus clientes todos los días desde muy temprano hasta por la noche.
Don Alcides les ofrece buena atención y buen servicio y es por eso que sus clientes le prefieren, sus clientes son todas las personas que transita hacia un municipio de San Lorenzo y 
Don Alcides el es un hombre emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, solicitando el préstamo para reparar una de sus dos moto taxis que se encuentra en mal estado y necesita hacerle algunas reparaciones, también para compra de llantas para moto taxis.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Señor Alcides, who is 37 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and their children. He has worked for four years in the transportation business with a mototaxi. He transports his customers every day from very early until night.

Don Alcides offers them good attention and good service, and it is for this reason that his customers prefer him. His customers are all the people who travel toward the town of San Lorenzo.

Don Alcides in a entrepreneurial man with the desire to get ahead, and he strives every day to improve his quality of life. He is applying for the loan in order to repair one of his two mototaxis which is in bad condition, and he needs to make some repairs on it. It is also for the purchase of tires for mototaxis.

His dream is to grow his business to improve his quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2014.

loans.use: to repair his mototaxi.

loans.name: Alvaro Javier

texts.es:
Alvaro con 26 años de edad, es soltero. 

Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a diversas actividades de manera independiente, con lo que ha generado ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 

Hace un año, comenzó a realizar la actividad de comprar y vender cerdos, pues los obtiene, los cría, engorda y al momento de la venderlos los ofrece a un precio más alto, debido al peso adquirido por el animal, esto le permite obtener los recursos para continuar con el cuidado y sustento de sus padres. 

El titular es un hombre luchador, pujante, se esmera cada día para salir adelante motivado por su familia, esto lo impulsó a solicitar el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos y pollos para engordarlos y venderlos, así podrá tener disponibilidad suficiente para cumplir con los pedidos que le solicitan y mejorará su margen de utilidad e ingresos.
