De esta manera, Alvaro espera avanzar un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de su sueño principal, que es formalizar su negocio y montar un expendio de carne, que sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo y lograr una estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Alvaro is 26 years old and single. During his productive life, he has worked in diverse jobs on his own, and with the income he has supported his family. A year ago he started buying and selling pigs. He gets them, raises and fattens them, and at the time of sale he offers them at a higher price because of how much more the animal weighs. This has allowed him to get the resources to continue taking care and supporting his parents. Alvaro is a hardworking and motivated man, who struggles daily to move ahead, motivated by his family. This made him request the loan, in order to buy pigs and chickens to fatten and sell. This way he will have enough available to fulfill his requested orders, and will improve his margin of profits and income. In this way Alvaro hopes to be closer to achieving his main dream: to formalize his business and set up a meat shop that is more profitable and lasting, and to reach financial stability.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Sandryani

texts.en:
Sandryani is a 37-year-old single woman who lives with her family. Since her mother died in 1996 she has been responsible for the care of her siblings.

For the past two years Sandryani has been a seamstress, a business she started using money from her mother's pension. She receives orders for such things as school uniforms, blouses, skirts, curtains and party dresses.

Sandryani is applying for a 4,500,000 IDR loan through TLM to buy fabric and thread. She hopes to build her business by getting orders to sew uniforms for companies. Her goal is to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Ma'rifat

texts.en: Her name is Marifat. She lives with her parents in the district of Shakhrinav. She is 42 years old. She is an educated woman. Marifat is involved in animal husbandry. She inherited this activity from her parents. Many Tajiks are engaged in agricultural activities. Marifat now has not many cattle and she wants to buy a cow for the house, so that it could provide the family with milk. Marifat understands the responsibility of a loan and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy is a hardworking woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. Aside from looking after their two children, Cathy also helps her husband in their fishing business. This business has given them the daily income that they need for sustenance and for other household expenses.

Cathy is in need of additional capital for fishing. With this, she requested to take a loan to buy new fishing nets. This loan will help Cathy and her husband improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged forty-four, married, and charged with the responsibility of taking care of five children aged 12, 8, 6, 4 and 9 months, four of whom attend school. He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling maize and beans among others. He earns additional income from farming. He desires to expand his business and pay school fees for his children. He will use the loan money to buy more beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Rondelio De Jesus

texts.es:
Rondelio es un transportador laborioso del municipio de Samana, donde vive con su esposa y su hijo.

Siempre ha querido ser independiente y tener un ingreso adicional a su trabajo, con el cual planea darle educación y sostenimiento a su hijo.

Solicita un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de cabezas de ganado para así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Su mayor sueño es crecer como independiente y empresario.
texts.en: Rondelio is a hard-working commercial driver in Samana municipality, where he lives with his wife and son. He has always wanted to be independent and have an income in addition to his work. That additional income he plans to give his son an education and support. He seeks a loan to buy heads of cattle so that he can improve the quality of life of his family. His primary dream is to become self-sufficient and a businessman.

loans.use: to buy heads of cattle.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen, forty, lives in Lahore, Pakistan, and is a responsible mother of five children. Her son has been an auto rickshaw driver for the last five years. His rickshaw has not been running properly lately due to its constant use. He feels that most of its parts need to be replaced.

Because of the rickshaw’s unreliability, Yasmeen’s son has been unable to generate business and income. He would like to replace it with a new one, but with so little money he would find it difficult to cover the cost.

With this in mind Yasmeen has requested a 35,000 PKR loan through BRAC Pakistan to help her son buy a new rickshaw and so get back into business. She wishes to express her thankfulness for the help Kiva and Brac Pakistan offer.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son's business

loans.name: Sokhem

texts.en:
Sokhem, 42, is married and has five children. The family lives in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. She has been a garment factory worker for over three years. Her husband, 45, distills alcohol for sale and sells potable water. Three of their children are students, while one is also a garment factory worker. Together, the family can earn approximately $13 a day.

To improve her family’s finances Sokhem is applying for a 1,500 USD loan through KREDIT to buy cows to breed for calves that they can then sell. Future plans include buying a tractor and a trailer for her husband to transport water, building a bathroom with a toilet and helping her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy cows to breed for calves they can then sell.

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
El señor Jhon es un experimentado carpintero que desde su niñez aprendió este oficio gracias a sus tíos y con el paso del tiempo fue independizándose hasta montar su propio taller con el cual gracias a dios y a pesar de las adversidades ha logrado salir junto con su familia.

Vive con su esposa y sus hijos en una humilde casa en el municipio de Medellín.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de madera que le permitan fabricar más muebles y lograr tener una buena rentabilidad por su trabajo, su principal sueño es enfocado en sus hijos y su educación, por lo tanto Jhon quiere que sus hijos vayan a una universidad y en un futuro no muy lejano vuelvan a su hogar como todos unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Sr. Jhon is an experienced carpenter, who learned his trade from his uncles during his childhood. Over time, he began to work independently until he opened his own workshop, which, thankfully, despite adversity, he has made a success of. He has also helped his family get ahead.

He lives with his wife and two children in a modest house in the town of Medellin. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase wood that will enable him to build more furniture and earn a good profit from his work. 

His principal dream focuses on his children and their education. Consequently, Jhon wants his children to attend the university and in the not too distant future return home as professionals.

loans.use: to purchase wood that will enable him to make more furniture.

loans.name: Rubelia Alonso

texts.es:
Rubelia de 47 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 1 hijo, desde hace 28 años tiene una tienda de abarrotes  la cual atiende en compañía de su esposo. 

Tiene como sueño ampliar su tienda donde distribuye artículos como leche, granos, verduras, lácteos y otros. 
En la actualidad tiene poco surtido y esto es perjudicial ya que no puede suplir con muchos productos que le pide su clientela. 

Rubelia, en vista de esto, optó en solicitar un préstamo con el fin de organizarse más y comprar al por mayor el surtido necesario (granos, azúcar, galletería, lácteos) para incrementar su oferta, además comprara sillas y mesas para así poder brindar mejor atención a las personas,  esto le representaría también el aumento en sus ingresos para cumplir necesidades básicas de todo negocio como son los servicios públicos, impuestos, y demás; mejorara también el bienestar de ella y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Rubelia is 47 years old, lives in an open union, and has 1 son. She has had a grocery store with her husband for 28 years. She dreams of expanding her store, where she sells items such as milk, grains, vegetables, dairy products, and more. Today she has little stock and this is difficult as she can't supply the products her customers are seeking.

Rubelia, seeing this, decided to seek a loan with the goal of organizing herself more and buying at wholesale the stock she needs (grains, sugar, cookies, dairy products) to increase her offerings. In addition she will buy chairs and tables to be able to provide better service to people. This will convert in an increase in income to meet the basic needs of her business such as public service, taxes, and more. She will also be able to improve her and her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy at wholesale the items she needs to stock her store such as grains, sugar, cookies, dairy products as well as tables and chairs.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia, 42, is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband has been running an auto rickshaw for the last three years. The family lives in Lahore, Pakistan.

Safia’s husband’s rickshaw has not been working properly for a while now, making it difficult for him to generate virtually any income. He needs to fix it as soon as possible, but with little money it will be tough to cover the cost of its repair.

Therefore Safia has applied for a 30,000 PKR loan through Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover repair costs for his rickshaw. Safia wishes to express her thankfulness for Kiva and Brac Pakistan’s assistance.

loans.use: to help her husband cover repair costs for his rickshaw.

loans.name: Leidy Yohana

texts.es:
Ella es Leidy, una mujer de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su esposo y sus tres hijos.

Ella se decidió por iniciar su negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rápidas y bebidas desde hace aproximadamente 3 meses en un carrito de comidas con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar surtido de ingredientes e insumos para sus preparaciones.

Es una mujer que sume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
This is Leidy, a woman with a strong character, good will, and the desire of getting ahead in life along with her husband and her three children.

It was with a lot of enthusiasms and initiative that 3 months ago she decided to start her own business making and selling fast food and beverages in a food cart. She learned this trade merely through practice and this allowed her to gain a lot of experience.

Nowadays, she wants to give her business a boost. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy different ingredients and supplies for her dishes. She is a woman that takes new challenges and faces them with courage.

loans.use: to buy different ingredients and supplies for her dishes.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Hello, lenders, meet Beatrice. She is a smallholder farmer, who lives in Cheborgei village in the South Rift area of Kenya. She lives together with her four kids and Stanley, the husband she was married to ten years ago. Beatrice used her secondary education to venture into agribusiness. Starting with nothing more than a rundown four acre piece of land, today Beatrice owns three cows, ten poultry and a cultivated fertile tea farm with more than twenty trees. 

Beatrice is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed for her dairy animals. A byre will help her manage her dairy farming activities better and control the cows' movements. The shelter will also offer protection to the animals against harsh weather. She is expecting to observe an increase in milk production after introducing a cowshed since the cows' surroundings will be more ample and conducive for productivity. The money she stands to make from this investment will help her clear the loan and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
From Dulag, Leyte, Alicia is 63, married and has three grown children. For the past two years she has run a sari-sari, a type of small general store from which she sells items like noodles, powdered milk, canned goods, soap, bread and other basic commodities. She also buys and resells at a profit ready-to-wear clothing like pants, shorts, t-shirts, blouses and jeans.

Alicia has applied for a 6,000 PHP loan through CEVI to buy additional stock for her store such as beverages, toiletries and soft drinks. She also wants to purchase a greater variety of ready-to-wear clothing, as she believes this will attract more customers.

Alicia hopes that her businesses will thrive, as they will help her achieve a better life for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store and a greater variety of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her degree course.

loans.name: Kanikei

texts.ru: Каникей 61 год, вдова, мать 7 детей. У Каникей - среднее образование, она на пенсии, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 21 год назад. Благодаря упорному труду Каникей, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы и 2 лошади, а также 5,00 ГА земельного надела, где Каникей в основном выращивает клевер. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Каникей обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 18 овец. Доходы от кредита Каникей хочет вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Kanikei is 61 years old, a widow, and the mother of seven children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and is now a pensioner.  She became involved in agriculture and animal husbandry 21 years ago, and these two activities constitute an additional source of income for her family.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns four cows and two horses, as well as five hectares of land on which she essentially grows clover.  Kanikei makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy 18 sheep.  She plans to re-invest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase 18 sheep in order to increase her farm's livestock headcount.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
The humid and rocky Kapkatet area within the Litein area can be considered a hardship area. Even with the savannah plains and little human activity, there exists a farm that stands tall: a farm with over three high-pedigreed Friesian cows, producing over 30 litres of milk. It’s quite an outstanding feat considering the harsh terrain and other handicaps, such as the lack of electricity from the national grid, and also the dependence on traditional methods of collecting water. 

Kiva lenders, meet Isaac, the man credited with the success story of the farm. He is a loving husband with two children and has been farming for the past 10 years. Isaac passionately loves dairy farming, and this can be attested to by the fact that he knows his cows, each individually, because he works with them twice a day, 365 days a year. He and his wife have even named one of them. Because he loves the cows, he runs his operation by four simple rules that have kept him and his herd happy. The rules are: breed them well, feed them well, clean them well, and milk them well. His primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal business that he engages in to make ends meet. The income he makes from selling milk, eggs, and crops is insufficient to meet his family's expenses, but he has still kept hope alive that he will improve. 

Isaac is seeking a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Juhudi Kilimo serves poor smallholder farmers in Kenya. This is a severely marginalized group with little access to financial services. By extending credit to farmers, Juhudi helps them acquire assets like motorbikes, dairy cows, poultry, irrigation equipment, and greenhouses. Isaac's source of income is vegetable, milk, and egg selling; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, but one problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time. The Litein area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market. That is why Isaac is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. 

Isaac is very determined to succeed, and because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans that through accumulated profits he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and also for his parents. 

Lenders, if there is someone you should invest in, that person is Isaac —all he is doing now is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to deliver fresh products to the market on time

loans.name: Gilobert

texts.en: Gilobert has a beauty salon, which has been running for two years now. He is 27 years old, married, and together with his spouse, they have been blessed with two children. This is his third loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he plans to use to buy more products for his beauty salon, such as blow driers and hair chemicals. In the future, he hopes to have a prosperous business and a happy family.

loans.use: To buy more products for use in the salon

loans.name: Bibisavz

texts.ru: Бибисавз замужняя женщина в возрасте 25 лет. В браке она имеет одного ребенка. У нее маленький сын. Бибисавз с мужем имеет не большое помещение, где имеется оборудование по измельчению муки. Это является их семейным бизнесом. Бибисавз работает вместе с мужем. На данный момент их не большой бизнес приостановлено, по техническим причинам. Периодически оборудование необходимо ремонтировать и сейчас самое время для ремонта и профилактики. Бибисавз начала ремонт, но не хватило средств для завершения ремонта оборудования. Ей не хватает не большой суммы денег, и она надеется на получения кредита и снова запустить бизнес.
texts.en: Bibisavz is a 25-year-old married woman.  She and her husband have one child, a young boy.  The couple live in a small place equipped with a flour-grinding machine.  This constitutes their family's business.  Bibisavz works with her husband, but at the moment their business is suspended for technical reasons, because their equipment needs to be routinely repaired and maintained.  Bibisavs started those repairs but she doesn't have enough money to complete what has been started.  She's only lacking a small amount of money, and she's hoping to receive a loan, so that she can resume her activity.

loans.use: to repair her flour-grinding machine, so that she can resume her activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Eliza

texts.en:
Ma. Eliza is a married woman and a mother of a 1-year-old child from Concepcion, Iloilo. She helps her husband in their fishing business. This is the source of their income. 

Ma. Eliza is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other fishing materials. This will help them in improving their catch. Ma. Eliza sells the catch to the market.

In the future, Ma. Eliza has hopes of making their business more stable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other fishing materials

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a hardworking mother from Dulag, Leyte. She has five children. The oldest child is 22, while the youngest is 15.

She is a Natasha products dealer, and sells items like liquid soap, toilet bowl cleaner, food keepers and many others. She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 10 years. In addition to that, she engages in the buying and selling of RTW (ready-to-wear clothing) like jeans, pants, shirts and blouses. 

Amelia has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more Natasha stock and various RTW.

This stock will help Amelia create greater yield, thus providing her family with good food and better living conditions.

Amelia hopes to have a stable income that would help her send her children to school for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy more Natasha products and various RTW (ready-to-wear clothing) to sell.

loans.name: Allah Rakha

texts.en:
Allah Rakha 44 is married and a father of five children. He has a dairy business and has a small farm consisting of cows for milk production. He has to prepare animal feed every morning and then take out milk, wash it and put it in containers to sell it to households and restaurants. He is a hardworking person.  

As he has a big family, his expenses have increased over time, so in order to have a better income, he increased the number of cows, but the space does not allow him to keep a large number. He wants to build a cow shed and buy fodder for the cows, but he is short of money. He has therefore requested a loan for this purpose. 

He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their ready support.

loans.use: to build up a cow shed and to buy fodder

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is not looking for a job now, but even if he were to be hired, he says he "can only accept the position of pig breeding consultant, not any other position.” Stanley is a very honest, hardworking and dedicated farmer who hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya, known to have the best weather patterns that favor crops and animal farming. 

Stanley has so much experience in pig farming, having done it for the past 10 years, that he is considered one of the best farmers in his village. Stanley’s primary source of income is selling pig meat, milk, eggs and crops. 

Stanley has space on his farm that is unused, and he wants to use it to keep pigs. He is kindly seeking a loan to buy pigs. This will help Stanley to improve his living conditions and also the conditions of his children by providing them with a solid education, because education is the “key to success.” 

The Kerugoya area has a large population and a ready market for pork. Hence, Stanley will not have a problem selling the pork and increasing his income level. Stanley is very disciplined with finances, and he is sure that, through accumulated profits, he will open a large pork selling butchery and be able to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Generose

texts.en:
Generose is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She works with her husband in their fishing business. In their place, Generose thinks that fishing is a lucrative business.

Generose is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets. With this loan, they will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Generose has hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, 45, lives with family members in a rural village of the Takeo province. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is in school, and another one is in university. To tackle with her family’s hardships, she grows rice as her source of income. Moreover, she can earn extra income via cow-raising. She can earn income of about 28,100 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Sok will spend her loan portion to pay for the tuition fee for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in mathematics. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in mathematics.

loans.name: Pove

texts.en:
Pove, 43, is a married woman who lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two dependent children. To make a living she has been involved in a farming business since 2000. On her farmland she grows rice and sells the crop to the local dealers and sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market. On average, she can generate an earning of USD 5 per day.

She wants to extend her farming area yet she doesn't has enough money. Thus, now she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a plot of rice farmland. She hopes that this additional farmland will provide a lot of crops for her family. She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to grow rice.

loans.name: Ndifeamodzi Credit Group

texts.en:
Nelia is 33 years old and married with four children.

She has a small food stall selling potatoes, tomatoes, maize and soft drinks. She started her business in order to help support the family financially and pay for their basic everyday needs, and to help her siblings with school fees.

With the knowledge she gained through MLF's business management training, she has requested this loan to bulk buy more stock and increase her profits.  With the profits she wishes to expand her business and diversify in order to create a more stable business for the future.

With previous profits she has already been able to start a small animal farm and has been able to start building a permanent home.

It is her ultimate dream to be able to buy land for business purposes in the future.

loans.use: to bulk buy more stock to expand her food-stall business.

loans.name: Debbie Marie

texts.en:
Debbie Marie is a twenty-seven-year-old married woman from Dulag, Leyte. She engages in the production of tuba (coconut wine). She makes and sells coconut wine. She has been in that kind of business for six years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more ingredients like tungog (used for colorant and preservative) and more gallon drums for tuba storage. This will help Debbie Marie sell more tuba wine and help defray the family's daily expenses.

Debbie Marie would like to expand her business to be successful in her chosen field someday.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like tungog (used for colorant and preservative) and more gallon drums for tuba storage.

loans.name: Dalitso Group

texts.en:
Melina is 54 years old and married with nine children.

She currently runs a small grocery shop selling cooking oil, soap and sugar in the local market to her immediate community. She started this business in order to help support her family and to reduce her financial dependency on her husband.

She has requested this loan in order to expand her current business and add on a section selling hardware items. With the business training received from MLF, she recognized that a large part of her customers were farmers, and that they were traveling to the next town to buy any tools they needed. By offering them at her new store, she will increase and diversify her stock items but also help reduce costs to those who were previously traveling elsewhere to buy tools.

loans.use: to expand her grocery business and add on a section selling hardware items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in finance and banking.

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en:
Noeurn, 44, is a married woman who lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has six dependent children. To make a living, she has been involved in a farming business since 1998. In her farmland, she grows rice and sells the crop to the local dealers, and sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market. On average, she can generate earnings of USD 4.00 per day.

She wants to extend her farming area, yet she doesn’t have enough money. Thus, now she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a plot of rice farmland. She hopes that this additional farmland will provide a lot of crops. She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of rice farmland

loans.name: Mylin

texts.en:
Mylin is 22 years old, married and has a 3-year-old child. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for several years now. This is the source of their income.

Mylin is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets. This loan will enable Mylin and her husband in improving their business as well as their income. In the future, she has hopes of making her business more stable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a young farmer, 23 years old, who learned to work in the countryside, thanks to his older siblings, when he was very young.

He is a man who lives alone. He doesn't have a partner. His only company are his trees, poultry and dairy cow, which give him sufficient production to support himself. 

Vincent's sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg selling; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, but one problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time. The Litein area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Vincent is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. Through the motorbike, he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. 

Vincent is very determined to succeed, and because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans that through accumulated profits he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and also for his parents. Vincent’s dream is to go back to school, and he hopes that through your loan, you will help him realize his dream.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver his vegetables, milk and eggs while they are still fresh

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her business.

Erlita has been in this business for 20 years. Erlita earns additional income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell for her business

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
Rizwana is a 36-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and four children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and is responsible for managing the entire household. By profession, he is an artificial jewelry worker; he has been doing his own jewelry making business for many years to earn income.

Rizwana's husband needs to buy different kinds of jewelry accessories and tools for his jewelry works business purpose, but due to financial constraints, he is unable to buy these tools and accessories. Therefore, Rizwana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will provide financial assistance to her husband so that he can buy tools and other items to fulfill the needs of his jewelry making business.

For this financial support, Rizwana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of jewelry and other tools for her husband's jewelry work.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar, age 46, is a fish vendor from Dulag, Leyte. He is married and has a 10-year-old daughter. Edgar sells fresh fish to the nearby community to earn a living. He has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 20 years.  Due to a financial crisis, Edgar has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase a variety of fresh fish, which will help augment his daily earnings. He can now provide his family with good food and better living conditions.  

Edgar hopes to have a stable income that will help him send his daughter to school.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fresh fish

loans.name: Twekambe Mixed Farmers Kayanja Group

texts.en: Faustine is a 48-year-old hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been growing beans and maize since 1993 for basic needs for his family. Despite bad weathers and price fluctuations, Faustine is working hard to see his business grow to a higher level that can reap more income for him. He is asking for a loan to buy agricultural inputs like seeds for planting. He is a member of Twekambe Mixed Farmers Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like seeds for planting

loans.name: Thyda

texts.en:
Thyda, 42, is a married woman who lives in the small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four dependent children and one married child. To make a living, she opened a small grocery store to serve people in her community. So far, she has been involved with this business for 14 years. On average, she can generate an earning of USD 8.00 per day.

Thyda is living a little bit far from a water source and it is not quite easy for her to access water. Due to this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan to dig a well next to her house. With the support from this loan, she hopes she can access water easier that before. She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to dig a well

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen, age 40, is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and five children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for many years. He alone is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Yasmeen's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories, such as pieces of cloth, needles, and a sewing machine with accessories. But due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable condition to buy these items for his business. Therefore, Yasmeen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband with these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs so that he can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of tailoring accessories for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 57 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Clarita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies. Clarita has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Connie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling fish and tailoring. Connie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like paints, wood, bamboo, etc for her fishing business.

Connie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like paints, wood, and bamboo

loans.name: Baikazi Kweterana Group

texts.en: Eugine, a Ugandan married man living in Kagadi, is 47 years old with six children. He has been growing beans and maize since 1967 for better household income. He hopes to get capital and venture into other businesses despite price fluctuations and transport challenges. Eugine is requesting a loan to buy seeds for planting and pesticides. He is a member of Baikazi Kweterana Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting and pesticides

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 43 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Edna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

Edna has been farming vegetables for six years and earns additional income from motorcycle transport services and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Gigi

texts.en:
Gigi is a 36-year-old fisherman from Dulag, Leyte and a father of three children who are 13, 12 and 10 years old, respectively. He catches and sells fish, crabs and sea shells to the nearby community. He has been in this kind of business for more than 10 years. Gigi has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fishing net, floaters, weights and crab traps. These tools will make his fishing activity productive and probably will create higher earnings. 

Gigi would like to expand his fishing business to finance the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, floaters, weights and crab traps

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells vegetables and spices in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell, such as garlic, onions, squash, eggplants, and radishes. Elena has been in this business for 10 years. Elena earns more income from motorcycle transport services. Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell, such as garlic, onions, squash, eggplants, and radishes.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta lives in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has ten children. Julieta is a very hardworking woman. She gives her best in order to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for their children's schooling.

Julieta wants to improve their fishing business but lacks the financial resources to do so. She is now requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets and a boat engine. A loan will enable them to improve their fishing business as well as their income. In the future, Julieta hopes for a more stable business. She also wants to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and a boat engine

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has an upholstery business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric and thread, and to pay for maintenance on her sewing machine. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric and thread and to pay for maintenance on her sewing machine

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de salir adelante y superarse, Luz desea montar un negocio de venta de mercancia en su casa en el municipio de Puerto Triunfo.

Esta idea surge a partir de la motivación que le dio su hijo mayor que la impulsa para montar este negocio y así generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 

Aunque ella siempre ha querido ser independiente, nunca había tenido el valor de arriesgarse a iniciar con un negocio; pero ahora se siente con la fuerza y capacidad para hacerlo.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar mercancía como ropa, cosméticos y accesorios.

Con estos elementos podrá iniciar con este proyecto y podrá cumplir así su sueño de ser independiente.

Con el apoyo a este crédito estarás impulsando las ideas emprendedoras de una madre colombiana!
texts.en:
With a desire to move forward and do better, Luz wants to start a business selling merchandise from her house in the Puerto Triunfo municipality.

This idea came after her eldest son motivated her to start this business in order to generate the necessary income to support her household.

Although she has always wanted to be independent, Luz has never had the courage to risk starting a business. Now, however, she fells strong and capable of doing it.

Luz is applying for this loan in order to buy merchandise such as clothes, make-up and accessories.

With these items she can start this project and achieve her dream of being independent.

By supporting this loan, you will be the driving force behind the enterprising ideas of one Colombian mother!

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothes, make-up and accessories.

loans.name: Maria Noleiva

texts.es:
La venta de frutas y verduras, es la actividad en la cual se desempeña Maria, una mujer con empuje y perseverancia para sacar adelante su propio negocio.

Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 2 años trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana todos los días.

Decidió iniciar este proyecto al ver la necesidad de obtener más ingresos para su familia y ya que no tenía la educación suficiente para otro cargo, opto por la venta de frutas y verduras.

Es una persona simpática y servicial, siempre dispuesta a atender las inquietudes y deseos de sus clientes.

Ella pide un auxilio económico para comprar un amplio surtido de verduras para abastecerse y vender una mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
The sale of fruits and vegetables is the business of Maria, a woman with the drive and perseverance to get her business ahead. She has been in this business for over two years, working every day of the week beginning very early in the morning.

She decided to begin this business when she saw the need for generating higher income for her family, and she didn't have sufficient education to get another job. So she opted to begin selling fruits and vegetables. 

Maria is a kind and attentive person, always available to attend to the wishes and worries of her clients.

She requests a loan to purchase a large supply of vegetables to stock her store and increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of vegetables to stock her store.

loans.name: Ana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 49 años de edad la cual se desempeña como madre amorosa y como agricultora, en vista de que los ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, comenzó con una actividad que realiza en los ratos libres que le quedan como ama de casa y es la cría y venta de cerdos de engorde con los que intenta mejorar las condición es de vida de su familia.

Es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la compra de cerdos de engorde y concentrados con los que podrá mejorar sus ventas e impulsar esta actividad, teniendo más activos en su micro negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá más cerdos para ofertar.

Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad.

Apoya a una campesina Colombiana con grandes sueños para su familia!
texts.en:
Ana is a 49-year-old woman who is a loving mother and farmer. Given that her earnings weren't sufficient to cover her household expenses, she started a new activity in the spare time she has as a homemaker. She began to raise and sell fattening pigs, with the hope of improving her family's living conditions. This is the reason Ana requires a loan: in order to purchase fattening pigs and concentrated feed, with which she will be able to improve her sales and stimulate her pig fattening business. By accumulating more assets in her microbusiness, it will appear more attractive to her customers because she'll have more pigs for sale. 

Ana's main dream is to be able to generate a good income so that her family will not go without anything that it needs. 

Support a Colombian farmer with big dreams for her family!

loans.use: to purchase fattening pigs and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Las Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
Natividad es una mujer de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de seis años, y trabaja como ayudante de cocina.
Ella es emprendedora, constante, paciente, activa, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de ‘el torno’ una comunidad campesina ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad en automóvil, caracterizada por el comercio agrícola que reúne a compradores de la ciudad y vendedores del campo, el clima del lugar es tropical con una temperatura constante de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Natividad es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño, ojos marrones, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por el comercio (de pie la segunda de la derecha, blusa a rayas gris y negro). su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica al transporte libre y con su hijo que ya estudia en la escuela, vive en una casa alquilada de ladrillo que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, no tiene alcantarillado y la calle es de tierra. Debido a sus deseos de independizarse reunió a un grupo de personas con negocios como; elaboración de colchones, venta de empanadas, comercio de cosméticos, venta de ropa de temporada, tejido a máquina, servicio técnicos de equipos, venta de muebles, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su trabajo es la cocina, ella es ayudante de cocina y se encarga de; pelar papas, cortar la carne, cortar las verduras, realizar las compras, etc. Para el almuerzo y la cena diariamente en un restaurante cercano al mercado del lugar. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos en cuatro años de experiencia en el negocio. Su sueño es tener un restaurante y desea realizar una inversión en la compra de cocina y utensilios para independizarse y tener su negocio propio, ella cree que le irá muy bien porque los clientes gustan de su comida.
Es por esos motivos que Natividad solicita un préstamo para la compra de una cocina y utensilios para independizarse y tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Natividad is a 25-year-old woman who lives with her partner. She has a six-year-old child and works as a kitchen assistant. She is entrepreneurial, stable, patient, active, responsible and hardworking. She works in the locality of "El Torno", a farming community located 45 minutes away from the city by car. It is characterized by agricultural commerce, which brings together buyers from the city and vendors from the field. It has a tropical climate, with a constant temperature of 30 degrees celsius throughout the whole year.

Natividad has a dark complexion, brown hair and eyes, and she is of medium stature. Her maternal tongue is guaraní and she speaks Spanish for commerce. (In the photo she is standing, the second from the right, in a black and grey striped blouse.) She lives her life with her partner, who works as a freelance transport driver, and her son, who already goes to school. They live in a rented brick home that has running water and electricity. They do not have sewage and their street is unpaved. 

Due to her desire to become independent, Natividad got together with a group of people to request a loan and prosper in their businesses. The other businesses include mattress-making, empanada sales, a cosmetics business, seasonal clothing sales, machine sewing, equipment technician services and furniture sales. Natividad's work is in the kitchen. She is a kitchen assistant and is responsible for peeling potatoes, chopping meat and vegetables, making purchases, etc., in order to provide daily lunches and dinners at a restaurant close to the local market. This is her first loan cycle in four years of experience with the business. 

Natividad's dream is to have her own restaurant, and she would like to invest in the purchase of a stove and utensils in order to become independent and have her own business. She believes it will go very well because her customers like her food. It is for this reason that Natividad is requesting a loan for the purchase of a stove and utensils, in order to become independent and have her own business.

loans.use: to purchase a stove and utensils to become independent and have her own business.

loans.name: Luz Nora

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de campo y madre de 1 hijo por el que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de ganado bovino.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar 2 terneras que criara y de este modo podrá iniciar con su proyecto productivo.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y su hijo.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Luz is from the countryside. She has one son, for whom she has had to overcome many adversities in her life. However, she has always had the strength to get ahead and continue making progress along with her family. 

For some time she has wanted to start a business rearing and selling cattle. For this reason she is requesting a large financial boost in order to buy two calves which she will raise. In this way, she will be able to embark upon her project. 

With this new business she will be able to earn an income for her family, which means everything to her. She will be able to improve the quality of life of her husband and her son. She will work every day in order to drive the business forward and make it both sustainable and profitable.

Support a hardworking woman with a loan!

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Luis Gonzalo

texts.es:
Luis es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo Colombiano.

Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo de café; alimentos que vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Támesis, Antioquia, una región cafetera por excelencia y donde el turismo es un referente muy importante de esta zona.

Este personaje tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar los que actualmente tiene y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes y la compra de semillas de Café.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.

Su gran sueño es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Con tu ayuda Luis podrá salir adelante!
texts.en:
Luis is a farmer. He is humble and hardworking with drive and tenacity that distinguishes him among the men and women in the Colombian country. 

He is a man with an enterprising mind and since he was little he learned all of the trades of the country such as growing crops and raising animals. Today he also has his own coffee crop. He sells it in the market plaza of the town of Támesis, Antioquia, a coffee region par excellence where tourism is an important part of the area.   

His objective is to expand his crops and improve the one he actually has. That is why he has asked for the help of the loan to buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer and coffee seeds. 

The loan will give him a chance to progress as a businessman and as a person, as well as increase his income and continue to contribute to the support of his home. 

His big dream is to pay for his children's education and improve the conditions of his home. 

With your help, Luis can get ahead!

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Rosa Edilma

texts.es:
Rosa de 60 años, vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos, desde hace unos meses tiene una tienda de abarrotes  la cual atiende en compañía de su esposo. 

Tiene como sueño ampliar su tienda donde distribuye artículos como leche, granos, verduras, lácteos y otros. 

En la actualidad tiene poco surtido y esto es perjudicial ya que no puede suplir con muchos productos que le pide su clientela. 

Rosa, en vista de esto, optó en solicitar un préstamo con el fin de organizarse más y comprar al por mayor el surtido necesario (granos, azúcar, galletería, lácteos) para incrementar su oferta y poder brindar mejor atención a las personas,  esto le representaría también el aumento en sus ingresos para cumplir necesidades básicas de todo negocio como son los servicios públicos, impuestos, y demás; mejorara también el bienestar de ella y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 60 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has two children. Some months ago, she opened a grocery store, where she works together with her husband. She sells milk, grains, vegetables, and dairy products, among other things. Her dream is to expand her business.

Her stock levels are low, which is bad for her business since she is not able to offer her customers all the products they need. This is why Rosa decided to request a loan with the intention to better organize her business and buy supplies in bulk: grains, sugar, confectionery and dairy products.

She will be able to offer more products and better serve her customers, which will result in more income to cover the expenses that come with running a business, such as utilities and taxes. Her and her family’s well-being will also improve.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk, such as grains, sugar, confectionery and dairy products.

loans.name: Izolat

texts.en: Izolat is an industrious woman who is a married parent of four children. She lives with her family in a country. Izolat’s husband is a farmer and his income is not enough to provide a good living condition for the children. With the purpose to find a source of income, Izolat is going to organize a new business. She plans to start an animal husbandry business. She will buy a milk cow and sell milk and milk products to local people. She is a very hardworking woman and she hopes that her business will go well because she will do all her best. Izolat is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni to buy a milk cow for organizing a new business. She took part in a course “To Get Ahead" of a women's organization and got a certificate. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow for organizing a new business

loans.name: Obed Hernan

texts.es:
Padre de 2 hijos y con un gran deseo verlos convertidos en todos unos profesionales es el motivo que llena de entusiasmo y animo la señor Obed, de 51 años de edad, a trabajar incansablemente en su criadero de cerdos pues aspira que con este humilde empleo brindarles una educación universitaria a todos sus hijos. 

Ya que su deseo es poder brindarles una buena educación sus hijos, necesita de un empleo capaz de generar los recursos suficientes para cubrir estos gastos y sin descuidar los gastos primordiales del hogar. 

Es por esta razón que se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para realizar una adecuación y reforma al corral donde tiene albergados sus animales. 

Con este crédito su negocio tendrá una mejor presentación y podrá trabajar de una manera mas cómoda y en mejores condiciones.

Obed está muy motivado con este gran proyecto ya que sus hijos demuestran buenas actitudes estudiantiles y disposición para triunfar y hacer que su padre se sienta más que orgulloso de sus hijos
texts.en:
He is the father of 2 children and he really wants to see them have good careers. That is why Obed is full of enthusiasm and energy. He is 51 years old and works tirelessly in his pig farm because with this humble work he hopes to give his children college educations.   

Since he wants to offer his children a good education, he needs a job that can generate enough resources to cover these expenses and also cover the basic necessities of the home.   

That is why he sees the need of asking for a loan to improve and repair the pen where he keeps his animals. 

With this loan, his business will look better and he can work more comfortably and in better conditions. 

Obed is very motivated with this big project because his children have good attitudes as students and want to triumph and make their father feel more than proud of his children.

loans.use: to make some improvements on and repair his animal pen.

loans.name: Jhony Fredy

texts.es:
Jhony es un joven muy emprendedor y entusiasta, tiene 20 años, es soltero y vive en Lima junto a su familia. Al no gozar de una buena economía en su hogar se vio en la necesidad de buscar un trabajo para poder apoyar a su familia en los gastos, es por ello que por iniciativa propia empezó su negocio de venta de ropa y se ha esforzado mucho por eso cree que le está yendo muy bien, porque es responsable y amable con los clientes.
Jhony piensa utilizar el crédito para poder comprar mercadería y así surtir su negocio de venta de ropa, con esto espera mejorar sus ingresos y así seguir apoyando a su familia. ÉL está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, gracias a ello sentirá tranquilidad y más adelante está pensando empezar a estudiar una profesión.
texts.en:
Jhony is an entrepreneurial and enthusiastic young man. He is 20 years old, single, and lives with his family in Lima. Due to the difficult financial situation at home, he had to look for a job in order to help his family cover the expenses. He decided, on his own, to start a business selling clothes. He has worked very hard, and is responsible and kind to his customers, which is why he is doing well.

Jhony wants to use this loan to buy merchandise and improve his assortment. He hopes that this will help him to increase his income in order to continue supporting his family. He appreciates the generosity of Kiva lenders. He feels confident and is thinking of studying to become a professional in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk for his business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su nieto, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados desde hace 15 años, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, Doña Concepción esta solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa y zapatos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en: Concepción is 65 years old. She lives in her own home with her grandson. She has sold clothing and shoes as a street vendor in different markets for 15 years. She has a lot of regular customers due to the quality of her products and the good prices  of the city. Concepción is asking for a loan to buy more clothing and shoes wholesale to be able to continue with her sales and have better income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes wholesale.
